description:
11/10/2018

It wouldn't be an exaggeration to say that I've been going to Jasmine Garden on a weekly basis for the past 6 years of living in San Francisco.

Jasmine Garden is an oasis for anyone who needs a pause out of their daily lives to enjoy a bowl of delicious Pho soup broth. Whether it's cold or warm outside, or if you're feeling a little under the weather, or if you're about to rage all night and need to refuel, or if you're just plain hungry, a Jasmine Garden bowl of Pho is perfect any time. On the rare occasion that they go on vacation, I have to add it to my calendar and I count down the days until they re-open. 

Not to mention the familial service that you'll get from the owner and employees. When you step into Jasmine Garden, they treat you like family. 

Single diners are just as welcome as large groups. Avoid the lunch and dinner rush to have a more relaxed atmosphere to enjoy your meal. 

I can only wish great things for this place, and many more years of success. 

What to order:

- Pho Noodle Soup (any way you want it)
- Crunch Roll
- Beef Carpaccio 
- Vietnamese Ice Coffee

Cheers and I hope you enjoy your meal!
author: Enzo N.

description:
I was so surprised (in the best way possible) by Jasmine Garden! Located its location in the Duboce Triangle, where there isn't really a large Vietnamese community, I had pretty low expectations for authentic food. While the restaurant, decor, and wait staff definitely has more of an upscale vibe than classic Vietnamese restaurants I've been to (I did not leave the restaurant deaf and emotionally abused), the food was really, really delicious. 

We got the shrimp spring rolls to start, and had the pho ga (chicken noodle soup) and bun bo hue. The hue noodle soup came bubbling hot and spicy, and the pho ga was a classic comfort food. I wish there had been a bit more chicken, but the bowls are gigantic with generous portions of soup and noodles so you'll definitely leave stuffed. 

While the prices are a bit higher than other Vietnamese places, it is still cheaper than the majority of restaurants in the area, and the ambiance is a lot nicer too (it's a nice casual place to take parents, or for a date). I will definitely be back!
author: Denise L.

description:
I've been coming here for the last 6 years and never  wrote a review so figured today would be the day. This place is amazing. They are owned by a cute Vietnamese family and have legit bowls of noodles, rice places, and rolls for the Castro. Service is speedy quick and when you become a regular they treat you like family. 

The first few times I came here the waiter reminded me that their bowls don't have tendon/tripe and that their bun bo hue has no pork blood. I guess we Vietnamese people look out for each other :p If you need these in your noodles, this is not the place for you. 

Highly recommend the imperial rolls, pho, bun bo hue, and bun rieu. Also love the bun thit nuong cha goi with pork (leftovers the next day just as good!). Portions are great and food is authentic, flavorful, and delicious.
author: Christy L.

description:
We came here for a weekday lunch. We got the Imperial spring rolls and the Vietnamese crepe to share. I really liked the spring rolls, and would recommend them! 

For my main dish, I got the lemongrass chicken with rice. Its flavour wasn't what I was expecting, but it was still decent overall.
author: Megan G.

description:
I have no idea why this place doesn't have a full five stars. If I could, I would give this place a million stars!!!! I AM IN LOVE!!!

I know a brutal honest truth about SF 'diverse' cuisines: it has indeed diversity however, not authentic. Everything pretty much whites out. I have tried many places; have my favorites and many of those that not make into the list...this place has my top vote. This month is my mother's birthday. I can only talk to her on the phone. I miss her so much! To remind me of her cooking, I've been eating out at Vietnamese restaurants all week. Been to my regulars as well as new places. Jasmine Garden is the very first place that has the Sweet and Sour fish soup, which has the closest flavor to my mother's cooking style. She is the influencer of my love for food so this is huge.

Of course, they could make it a little sourer still, I almost cried while tasting the very first spoon. Oh my damn, it is so good. I felt that I was actually at home *sobbing*

This is not the most affordable restaurant. Having said that, with the friendly and super fast customer services; clean, cozy atmosphere (though quite noisy as it gets late); super delicious dishes - many hard to find dishes& fresh ingredients-you can tell with the fishes; it is worth the paycheck!!! Plus, we usually spend this much on a dinner out ($30/each) anyway. With Jasmine Garden, we ordered 3 entrees, 2 main dishes, 2 extra jasmine rice and it costed us the same---the portion was large so...I totally dig it.

Will come back as much as I could. The waiter told me their top dish is "Bun Rieu"-it is my next order in line *^.^* so satisfy and happy!!!!
author: Bao V.

description:
Very solid and much appreciated wholesome Vietnamese restaurant in the Castro Gayborhood.

This restaurant is block diagonal away from the Market+Church Muni stop and makes as a great spot if you are craving for something Vietnamese style.
They have a great selection that ranges from Rolls to Salads, Noodle Soups to Vermicelli, and Rice Plates to Clay Pots. They also have Vietnamese Iced Coffee, Thai Tea, or Beer if you're feeling a little bit more festive and want something to go along with your food.
Everything has always tasted great and I have never been disappointed when it comes to the delivery of the noms.

I think what makes this place close to my heart, is the staff.
The owners seem to put a lot of attention and care and it almost feels like I am being served food by a family member.
Definitely makes me, and my stomach, feel warm and full on the inside.
author: Kevin W.

description:
The short: solid Vietnamese food with good service

Lured by the photos, my friend and I came here Friday evening for dinner. We were seated immediately and were impressed by the nice decor. Even the Vietnamese culture video playing in the background felt relaxing.

We ordered:
- the Imperial Roll: really warm, tasty, and crunchy. The side sauce was a lovely addition. I would recommend this dish.
- Jasmine Garden clay pot special: chicken, shrimp, and mushrooms in a delectable sauce. Plenty of rice. Only downsides were the dry chicken and wish there was more sauce.

Service was exceptionally good and friendly.

Verdict: pretty good. Imperial roll and the service carried this rating. If I go again, I'm curious to see what other dishes they do well.
author: Catherine W.

description:
Wow, I've been to a LOT of Vietnamese restaurants lately. I came to Jasmine Garden about twice in the past two weeks. It's located in a very convenient location in the Duboce Triangle area, and is a great dinner stop before going out to drink at the some nice bars around the area. It's right next door to Last Rites, which is a newly-opened really cool tiki bar, but that's another review.

This place has a "veggie pho" soup which is really cool for vegetarians, since to my knowledge a lot of pho places don't really have vegetarian options that don't use chicken broth. I tried this veggie soup this first time I was here because my stomach was feeling a bit unwell, and it was really well done - light but flavorful - perfect if you just want a soup that's not too heavy. The second time I came here I tried the Bun Bo Hue, which is the complete opposite of the veggie pho but was also super delicious. 

Anyway the cool part is they have a Banana Flambé dessert which I got the second time I came here with a friend for her birthday which is literally a banana with ice cream that they SET ON FIRE. Ok I know that that's literally what banana flambé means (I think) but I've never had one and neither had my friend and OK IT WAS REALLY COOL. So highly recommend if you want to see a banana set on fire. The rum flavor is really strong though so idk though that wasn't great.

Also the service here is super nice. We didn't tell the servers that it was my friend's birthday but they either overheard or inferred it was the case so they celebrated my friend's birthday which was super cute.

Lastly - parking - I know this isn't really an SF thing, but I was able to find parking here the last time I came around - so it's doable in this area if you're wondering about it. However, if you can take public transportation, literally every Muni Metro line comes around this area so that's still probably the better option.
author: Brian W.

description:
My friend and I were kind of worried about coming to eat here at 3:15 PM since they close for lunch at 4 PM. Luckily the lady let us sit down and we were actually done eating at 3:53 PM. 

We were craving pho so I got the beef pho with the meatballs and my friend ordered the chicken pho. The bowls were a good size and they do give quite a lot of meat and noodles. I tend to eat all my beef before eating my noodles anyways. I added some of the jalapenos to my pho and it actually made it spicy, which I did enjoy. I would definitely come back if I was in the area for a good bowl of pho. The price is just right!
author: Allyson L.

description: Love love love all of it. The waiting staff is so sweet, the environment is perfect, the food is all so fresh and tastes.
author: Rodney M.

description:
Their food and price is so good. I like getting the beef carpaccio, bun rieu, and spring roll because it tastes good and the presentation is pretty. 

This is actually one of my favorite restaurants, so I get very disappointed and sad when they go on vacation and close the restaurant on those days. There were several times where I was so excited to go and it was not open! I was told they will post their vacation days on their answering machine and online now, so hopefully I won't be as disappointed next time I try to go there!
author: Andrea T.

description: Really delicious pho and spring rolls! Everything people around us ordered looked awesome too. I got the spicy beef pho and it did not disappoint! Can't wait to go back again.
author: Taylor S.

description:
Really satisfying pho with generous portions! I got the seafood pho-- other than the fact that I wish there was a bit more seafood, I was quite pleased with my order. My boyfriend and I also shared the spring roll with BBQ pork. The presentation is so adorable. 
The service is quite good for a such a casual asian restaurant. Overall, I recommend coming here for some pho to warm up your stomach. We haven't tried any of their other dishes, but I saw some other patrons eating them and they honestly all looked delicious. I'll be back!
author: Christina W.

description:
The name and the place lacks curb appeal and ambiance, but the food here is solid.  Once you step inside you can smell that this place is legit. 

Everything we ordered was surprisingly better than i expected.   

Beef Pho
Lemongrass Claypot
Pork Chops 
Spring Rolls 
Thai Iced Tea  

Presentation is applause worthy.   The spring rolls come out in these tiny little bamboo baskets.   Makes me smile every time.  The pho comes with mini squeeze bottle of plum and Sriracha. Simply adorable.
author: Sandy C.

description: One of the few affordable food options left in SF. I have been coming here for years. Same great food with no frills decor. The crunch roll is a can't miss and I usually order the pho ga or chicken clay pot. Everything here is solid though and great for groups.
author: Julie B.

description:
So good!! I come here for lunch every once in a while and it never disappoints. The vermicelli with chicken and imperial roll is my favorite. 
Delicious food, nice clean environment and great service- water glasses are constantly being refilled. 
Great location, too! What a find.
author: Lizzie C.

description: This place is so good, super authentic vietnamese food. Love the egg rolls aka cha gio. Its crispy! If you ever crave canh chua this is the place to get it at. The wait isnt super crazy and they are very fast. The lady at the cashier is super nice offers and recommends side dishes that go well. Go here for the real sh*t and not the BASIC Americanized viet food ;)
author: Nan T.

description:
The food at Jasmine Garden takes me back to the days I spent in my mom's kitchen. I can always smell basil, fish sauce, fried egg rolls, and pho broth. It brings back so many memories.

After moving to the Mission Delores neighborhood, I had a hard time finding good Vietnamese food. I am glad to have stumbled upon this gem. I can say the food is authentic and the people are very kind.

Over the last two years, I have tried almost everything on the menu. The top 4 dishes I order religiously are:

1. Pho Dac Biet
2. Bun Thit Nuong Cha Gio
3. Canh Chua
4. Banh Xeo
author: Hieu T.

description:
It was getting late and my friend and I had a hankering for Vietnamese in the area. I usually try to research a spot before going, but I whipped out my phone and crossed my fingers for something nearby. Jasmine Garden, here we come.

AMBIANCE was chill. There was plenty of space to move around. We had a table for four, so between the two of us there was a comfortable amount of room for our dishes. 

ORDERED Thai ice tea, five spice chicken, spring rolls, and chicken salad.

FOOD was fantastic. The highlight of the meal was definitely the spring rolls (with shrimp). Also a thumbs up to the tender five spice chicken.

RATING is a solid four. $30 for delicious Vietnamese food for two? Deal. Definitely coming back for more!
author: Nicholas G.

description:
This restaurant is extremely tasty. If you want an authentic vietnamese food, it's where to visit. We visited 2 times some delicious dishes you may want to try besides Pho are grilled pork chop, shrimp/fish sour soup, fish caramelize. I'm pretty sure it will not fail to impress you.
The other thing makes me wanna come back jere for sure is their hospitality, they always give us a walm welcome and go beyond our expectation. Totally love it !
author: Rubie M.

description:
Nicer Vietnamese places.  There's two types; one with no service, condiments and utensils on the table and the other with table covers, glassware and service.  Jasmine has various Vietnamese string instruments on the walls and fans on the ceiling fans.  This is different from handwritten specials taped to the walls on most Viet restaurants in the TL.
Decided to come here because we were tired of the variety in the TL which we frequented because it was walkable but a 7 minute drive to Jasmine was well worth it. 

Quality, price, and ambiance was better than I expected.  Food better than what I've had in the city at about the same price as the first type of Asian restaurants mentioned earlier.  Quality ingredients for a good price is worth coming back for.

For me if a restaurant has banh xeo there's no need to see what else they have unless it's their specialty.  Their's is the best so far I've had in the city.  Crispy, flavorful, and packed with chicken and shrimp.  All the veggies that accompanied it looked fresh; lettuce, mint, Thai basil, cucumbers, and carrots.  The sauce is not as light as what I'm used to but good nonetheless.  
My partner got the pho ga.  Clear broth with plenty of noodles and chicken.  With slight food poisoning over the Holidays it was the only thing he could stomach with reluctance and he said it was pretty good as is, no hoisin or sriracha to mask the blandness.  We did take much of it home but I was glad he had some of it.

Street parking wasn't hard to find on Monday evening around 8pm.  J, KT, L, M lines are also great options Church & 14th stop.
author: Naty D.

description: It was delicious!! First time here and I loved it. I got the chicken curry and would highly recommend
author: Ryan A.

description:
Loved it! 
 So fresh. 
 So tasty.
Reasonably priced.
We had the Golden Shrimp, Pho Ga and BBQ pork with rice.  All of our choices were really, really good --especially the Tiger Beer that helped wash everything down.
Again, it's the freshness of ingredients that I appreciated immensely--especially the fresh sprig of basil for the pho.  It was as if they literally just picked it from a nearby garden and put it on a plate for us.
Jasmine Garden has been opened for nine years now and I can't believe it has taken me this long to get here.
We had a few cocktails at Churchill next door and then walked in to a wonderful meal with creative presentations and good service.
Clap! Clap! Clap!
author: Thomas D.

description:
We came in at 12 and there really wasn't many people here so we pretty much got our pick of which table we wanted to sit at. The servers were pretty attentive and gave us water and checked on us to see if we need time to order.

We ordered two more traditional Vietnamese dishes: 

- Hot and Sour shrimp soup - $11.50?
You can either choose to have shrimp or fish in it and we chose shrimp. It comes with shrimp, celery, bean sprouts, carrots and some chili peppers that we immediately took out. There were some pretty decent sized shrimps inside. The soup kinda tasted like the fish(?) sauce you get when you you geta dipping sauce for when you order spring rolls... It was decent and I just poured it into my rice.. 3/5

- Catfish claypot - $12.50?
This was ok and was strong in flavor and you really need some rice to tame the flavor of this dish. I'm not really a fan of fish and this one was kinda fishy tasting and it had a lot of bones so I wasn't really a fan... 2.5/5

Service: 3.75/5
Pretty decent and attentive, although when it was getting a bit busier, it's a little harder to get the attention of the staff to get the check. 

Bathroom: 3/5
There's only one unisex bathroom and it's very cramped. It's serviceable and nothing to write home about...

Would I come back?
Maybe... But it's definitely not worth going here if it's out of the way...
author: Gilda W.

description:
Good kitchen from vietnam. I had spring rolls (with meat) and fried rice (meat +fish). It tasted very nice. 

The service is nice and very quick (OK is was not full).

I do not recommend the Jasmine tea, which is not tasting so good (industrial tea).
author: Alex G.

description:
We came here on a Monday evening and the place was packed, however, we only waited about 10 minutes and the hostess was very attentive to getting everyone seated timely. 

We ordered veggie spring rolls and veggie pho with spicy broth. Everything was delicious! The waiter also gave great recommendations. Overall, great food and great service. Totally recommend.
author: Vanessa L.

description: Visiting San Fran and after reading reviews decided to check it out. Glad I did! The lady who took my order was very sweey and made suggestions based on what I was craving. I ordered shrimp pho, five spice chicken & crunch roll....loved them all! Coming back next time I'm in town..Thanks Jasmin Garden
author: Sara S.

description: I'm a big fan of Pho and love getting it here. The staff is also very quick so you're never waiting for long. I usually also get their Imperial rolls or spring rolls, both delicious and presented beautifully. You won't be disappointed!
author: Alejandro T.

description: God I love this place for lunch. Probably one of the best pho places in the city, sorry Mom. I'm a regular now. You can mix the Pho Dac Biet(14) with the Bun Bo Hue (16) broth so you get the extra meat and meatballs +pho noodles instead of thin vermicelli+ delicious soup. The Thai iced tea is rich and flavorful, not mellowed out by other places watering it down for profit. AND one of the only pho spots I know that take credit cards, that's a godsend.
author: Anderson H.

description:
Jasmine is my goto Vietnamese restaurant in the Castro. There aren't many Asian hole-in-the-wall spots in this gayborhood so this place doesn't really face much competition. It's a decent place that does its job - serving affordable Vietnamese food. 

I typically order the 5-spice chicken, crispy spring rolls, and Vietnamese iced coffee which costs around $20 total (if I'm splitting the appetizer with another person). This place isn't bad but I don't crave it like how crave Sunflower or Than Tham on Valencia.
author: John L.

description: I love this place!!! One of the best Vietnamese restaurants I've been to in the Bay Area. The food is always on point. Always. I normally try to stay within my boundaries when ordering at restaurants I frequent. However, I feel completely comfortable ordering anything on this menu, knowing it will be good!!! Another thing I love, staff is super friendly and efficient.
author: Ali R.

description: Just went back after a long hiatus and the food was better than I remember.  The imperial rolls were excellent (along with their presentation).  The BBQ pork over vermicelli was well done complete with the slight crispy texture achieved through just the right amount of "over-cooking".  Overall, I think the cooking has improved, and I look forward to coming back more often.
author: S S.

description: Great ambience, fresh delicious food. The owner is great and I love coming here. Great date spot as well. Love their pho and the clay pot.
author: Benjamin D.

description:
Not super authentic, but nonetheless delicious (at least for the dish I got).

I got the Bun Bo Hue, and while it lacked all the usual ingredients I love like pork blood and oxtail, it was surprisingly good! The broth was extremely flavorful, perfectly seasoned with a focus on lemongrass, and is the reason I'll be back again. The dish also had a good amount of thin cut beef, but the noodles left something to be desired. They used Pho vermicelli instead of the thicker vermicelli I usually see when ordering this dish. I definitely prefer the latter.

Service was good for a Vietnamese place. Kept my water filled and were quick with the check. Couldn't ask for more and very happy with the experience!
author: Derek L.

description: Looks like crap from the street but nice enough inside and staff were so friendly and attentive. Food was good and for SF, prices were good value!
author: David B.

description:
We stumbled into Jasmine Garden when A and I were both getting over some weird sickness. A was looking for Pho and I wanted something light, but flavorful. After checking Yelp, we trekked over. This place was really busy at 8:30PM on a Sunday. It is not a small restaurant and I am pretty sure we got the last available seats. It did take a while for us to get our menu and to order but that gave us time to appreciate the smells wafting out of the kitchen. Once we did get our menu, we were somewhat overwhelmed by the choices as everything looked delicious and was very reasonably priced. We also noted the really cheap alcohol so if that's your thing, definitely stop by. Anyways, we decided not to imbibe but we ordered:

-Imperial Rolls - This is our favorite guilty pleasure and Jasmine Garden's did not disappoint. They were perfectly spiced and I liked that these were miniature so they could be handheld. The sauce served with it was addicting.

-Beef Carpaccio - This is what I got and it really hit the spot for something light and healthy. It was spiced well and the textures worked well together. I did find it really hard to heat, however, especially with chopsticks.

-Beef Pho - This is what A got, as planned. It was fine and he seemed to enjoy it. I am not really into Pho but it was good.

Overall, we would definitely come back. A lot of their noodle dishes looked delicious and we would love to sample more appetizers. I will say that the service was pretty slow (our meal took an hour and a half from start to finish) so don't come if you're in a rush. Otherwise, Jasmine Garden is a great stop.
author: Carrie W.

description: First time to try here their lunch.  Ordered a side order of garlic noodles, veggie soup & appetizer sampler.  Everything was delicious!
author: Sandra C.

description: I've been a regular here for the past two years, and this review is long overdue.  This is my absolute favorite neighborhood spot for pho.  Here are some of the dishes I've tried and love: the spicy beef pho, the veggie pho (you can ask them to make the broth spicy too), the rack of lamb, the crunch rolls, the hot and sour soup with catfish or prawns, and the steamed seabass/salmon dish.  The service is always fast and on point, and the food is delicious.  Nothing not to like about this place.  Highly recommend stopping by if you're in the area.
author: Miruna P.

description: Came here on a recommendation last Thursday night from a friend, it was great!  Super fresh and I thought the sticky rice was amazing. The rest of the crew enjoyed theirs as well. Will def go again when back around
author: John C.

description:
This is the best Pho I've had in SF, period. Very flavorful. Feels quite clean and healthy. The Veggie Pho is both my favorite (vegetarian) and my fiancées favorite (meat eater) so that should tell you something!

Food is inexpensive but so, so good!
author: Camilla H.

description: I'm a regular at a bar that's around the corner from here and every now and then I stop by Jasmine Garden to pickup pho to go.  The wait staff is always so nice.  As I'm waiting they tell me to take a seat and ask if I want some water while I'm waiting.  Some good customer support even for people who aren't eating there.  I haven't tried much of their other food here so I can't give this place a 5 star but their pho is tasty and they give you a good amount of beef.  The only thing is that the pho is $10 but again SF gotta hustle to make it.
author: Ted Y.

description:
Okay, let's be honest. The yelp pictures of the two baskets lured me here! hahaha

For the picture I came here Friday night with my friend to get dinner. Parking is definitely difficult around the area but we got lucky and parked about 3 buildings away from Jasmine Garden. 

Upon arrival, the host sat the long line down in the restaurant. I quickly ordered the shrimp spring roll while still deciding on the entrees. 

Orders:
1. Shrimp Spring rolls - shrimp, very little vegetables inside; TOO MUCH NOODLES!
2. Beef Capaccio - raw beef with mints, fried scallions, red onion and cilantro. It was good but not the best I had from a restaurant
3. Bun Rieu - Friend's order. Tons of noodles but the noodles break easily which made it hard to eat with a chopstick.

Overall food wasn't that great. I wouldn't recommend anyone to dine here but if you need to the carbs, then this is your choice. I will not be back.
author: Maria H.

description: My favorite place in SF to get some pho. They also have an amazing claypot. The food here tastes great and is reasonably priced!
author: Addie A.

description:
We've all heard it- don't judge a book by it's cover. That's the story here. Don't judge Jasmine Garden by the unimpressive, dull building exterior (and its cliche Asian restaurant name... add a "Happy" in the title and you got a classic Chinese restaurant name).

We shared the bun rieu, bahn xeo, and catfish claypot. A lot of people order pho here, and I've also ordered that another time. Not bad. Decent portions, and we enjoyed them all. Affordable prices around $8- $11. Walk a few blocks over from the overpriced Mission and come here instead. 

Good place for groups to come. Not super crowded and friendly service.
author: Joanna L.

description: This place is okay. I wouldn't go out of my way to go here but it happens to also be the closest location for where I live so if lazy and don't want to travel far from home, this place is the right price for the right quality.
author: Mimi T.

description:
Delicious traditional Vietnamese food with decent prices, what more can one ask for?

This is my new favorite gem, and one of the places that has more traditional dishes in San Francisco.

We got the bo tai chanh (rare beef carpaccio) and it was probably one of the best I've had. Definitely enjoyed it more than any other places and the portion size was big. We also got the canh chua (catfish hot and spicy soup) was also mouthwatering and the amount of catfish was a lot. So satisfying! In addition, we got the five spice chicken with a side of rice, which was a giant portion but tasted average. The soup and beef carpaccio definitely held my entire meal up. Last but not least, we got the fried banana with ice cream (comes with coconut flakes) which was a nice palette to end my meal.

We will for sure be back!
author: Julian Y.

description: This is one of my favorite places to eat. They have really good vermicelli bowls. The clay pot is delicious too. My favorite menu item they have is the crunch roll, it's a BBQ pork fresh spring roll with a fried imperial roll inside..sooooo good.
author: Meg O.

description: My go-to pho spot in the Castro neighborhood! Tip: Don't do the other stuff on the menu and stick with just the pho.
author: Steven W.

description:
Delicious!! Great with kids!

I ordered the BBQ chicken and white rice for the kids and they gobbled it down! I ordered the chicken Pho with a side of veg for me and YUM! Everything tastes fresh and delicious. They were so accommodating and friendly. Would definitely recommend and will be returning.
author: Jenny J.

description: I was here several times over the summer of 2016 and just came back this past weekend (Apr 2017). Last time I was here, I was very impressed with their bun bo hue but it fell short this time. The broth tasted very diluted and our order of Imperial rolls were only okay. Definitely not something I'll go out of my way to order again. I've also consistently found that their service is not great and while I'm happy to give them another chance at some time, I am sad to see that their food has gone down in quality.
author: Quinn Li O.

description: Jasmine Garden, in my opinion, is a typical average vietnamese place. They offer a pho chay with small/thin rice noodles, which serves as a good option for vegans. Overall, I thought the vegan option was good but nothing special, and nothing really stood out about it. If I lived in the area I'd probably occasionally order takeout from Jasmine, but I definitely won't be going out of my way to eat here. My friend said the same thing about the meat pho.
author: Christina M.

description: This is my go to place for Vietnamese food in the city. I always order the beef carpaccio. I love seeing the staff come out and eat their meals at the end of the day.
author: Alias A.

description: I've come in here a few times for lunch. Their pho is decent and reasonably  priced. I have yet to try their other dishes but if it's as good as the pho, I think I may try something new next time.
author: Kenson K.

description:
I do not venture out here often for Asian food but this hidden gem is delicious!!!

Newly remodeled, cute, and welcoming with awesome service! Definitely coming back for more of the menu.

We ordered 

Golden shrimp - very very flavorful 
Salmon salad and roll - bits of salmon in salad with a side of salmon spring rolls .
Papaya salad- delicious!!! 
Crunchy spring rolls- your regular spring rolls with a kick if crunchiness. An egg roll spring roll hybrid!
author: Catherine K.

description: If you want a quick meal, this would be a good spot. However, expect a cold temperature type environment where ordering pho makes sense and cold type service where you must ask for more napkins and only receive one. On a positive note the imperial rolls were great. Avoid tea as it was a bigelow green tea bag (just one) in a teapot priced at $3.
author: Neville B.

description: The chicken pho is the best in the city. Yeah, I said it. Abundance of garlic, even lettuce, and hits all the right spots. If you're feeling fancy, pair the Bogle Pinot Noir after you take a bite of sprouts that come with the pho. Forreal do it. The imperial rolls are also the perfect crunchy. Service is great, and if you come often enough, the staff will remember you and your order. Sometimes when you have your neighborhood spot, you're a little biased, but I would travel far and wide to eat here.
author: Anthony G.

description: This got so many good reviews that I had high expectations. The soup was bland and watery, and the noodles very over cooked. I won't be back.
author: Rebecca F.

description:
I'm a bit torn about Jasmine Garden due to the fact that it's claims to be "authentic Vietnamese cuisine," but in fact I found it quite inauthentic.  Although this place has a Vietnamese owner and some of our dishes were tasty, I am docking one star (what would have been a 3 star review) for the authenticity part.  I dined there twice for lunch recently and what kept me going back was the Bun Rieu soup.  The soup base seemed authentic and I give them that.  

The location is right across the street from the Church St. Muni station, so it's easy to get to via public transportation.  It's also across the street from the Castro Safeway.  I don't imagine there to be many other Viet spots around the area, so Jasmine Garden might be your best bet if you are craving some pho.  However, I feel that because it may be the only Viet restaurant in the area, the owners have Americanized the traditional dishes quite a bit (and maybe also to cut cost).  

First visit eats:
- Beef Carpaccio:  I'm not a huge fan of raw beef, but my friend wanted to order it so I tried two slices.  It looked really nice presentation-wise and would be a great starter.  The beef was topped with a lot of fresh cilantro, red onions and peanuts.  Everything was fine until I took my first bite and one of the peanut pieces was so hard like a piece of gravel.  Maybe a bad bite.  I tried another piece and the same thing happened.  I swear I could have broken a tooth.   
- Vietnamese Crepe (Bun Xao): The crepe was nice and crispy without being too greasy.  It looked great with all the accompaniments (fresh lettuce, mint, cucumber, shredded carrots and fish sauce).  The crepe itself was filled with a ton of cooked bean sprouts, but had very little shrimp and chicken.  The shrimp were cut in half, so very skimpy.  The taste itself was completely bland.  There was no seasoning whatsoever on the bun xao and you have to rely on the fish sauce to give it any flavor.  Very disappointing.  
- Vietnamese Seafood Soup (Bun Rieu):  Traditionally, the bun rieu's main ingredient is crab.  However, at JG there is no crab at all.  Nor was there any pork.  They give you a huge bowl of thin vermicelli noodles but there's very little in the way of proteins.  There's mostly fried tofu, drop egg and maybe 4 shrimp if you're lucky.  The best is the soup.  That was layered with flavors including strong lemongrass and a rich tomato base.  It's just misleading bc this is not real bun rieu.  
Total tab was $42 including tax and tip.  Pretty pricey for what it was and what we got.  I thought the soup was the best part aside from the clean restaurant and good service.  

Second visit eats:
- Vietnamese Crepe (Bun Xao): Thought it might be better this time.  Wrong, it was just the same as the first time - bland and skimpy on the meats.  
- Vietnamese Seafood Soup (Bun Rieu): Again, very similar to the first experience but I did go for the soup. 
- Bun Bo Hue: Again, I hate to be the Debbie Downer here, but definitely was not authentic.  The soup was great (lemongrass and beef spicy broth) and that was the only thing going for this dish.  This is a classic Viet noodle soup that uses Hue noodles.  JG does not use hue noodles, instead they use the same thin vermicelli that is in their bun rieu.  The underlying theme is you get a huge bowl of noodles and not much else.  They serve the bun bo hue with 5 thinly sliced pieces of beef.  There was none of the traditional beef meats in this bowl such as the beef shank, oxtail, pig's knuckles or congealed pig's blood.  
Total tab was $45.  For the noodle bowls to be priced at $10.50 each, I would expect more proteins.  Instead, you get a huge bowl of noodles.  The only saving grace is that their soups are really tasty and flavorful.  

By no means is Jasmine Garden authentic.  I have to disagree with their signage of their storefront.  It might be the best Vietnamese restaurant in the area as there is little or no competition, so they raise the prices and skimp on the expensive ingredients (meat).  That's my theory.  Or maybe they think they can fool people who don't know much about Viet cuisine that their food is authentic?  Don't get me wrong, this is a nice family own restaurant and some of the food was tasty.  I think it's just not for me.  When I see Bun Rieu or Bun Bo Hue on the menu, I expect to get what it's supposed to be.  At JG,  they didn't deliver that so I felt disappointed especially after taking a trek across town.
author: Liv A.

description:
Came here yesterday for a good bowl of lunch pho - needed some good Bun Rieu to wash away the mini hangover! BFF suggested this new Castro neighborhood spot. While I was a little hesitant to get pho in the Castro, I was surprisingly excited about the results. 

Arrived at noon and we were the only ones there (assuming everyone else must've been busy with Lunar New Year and Super Bowl activities!). 

Service - impeccable. Every time I took more than two sips of my water, the waiter came back to refill my glass. The whole staff was very attentive and sweet. I'm all about some great service! Five stars. 

Food - ordered the Bun Rieu. While this wasn't a traditional Bun Rieu (had only shrimp instead of crab), I still give them major props on taste and quality of fresh ingredients. Herb condiments, fresh. Seafood, fresh. Tomatoes...you see where I'm going with this? The noodles were perfectly blanched, and the flavor of the broth was everything you could hope for in a good bowl of tomatoey Bun Rieu! Five stars. 

Mini hangover cure complete. FIVE STARS.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Best pho I've had in the city. 

Low key restaurant, but nice enough ambience that you want to dine in. Great for a meal with a group of friends - they can usually accommodate larger groups without too much of a wait. I've also eaten here on a casual date night, we love it here!
author: Emma B.

description: Good spot for soups and other Vietnamese food in SF. The inside is actually decently nice to sit down. The portions are big and food is always tasty. I usually get one of the chicken or pho soups. It's also easy to order the soups to go.
author: Greg S.

description: This is my go-to neighborhood pho place. Clean, fast, and giant bowls of pho. I also frequently do take out. For sit down it's quiet, usually not crowded, a good place for my solo meal excursions.
author: C Y.

description:
Let's start with how cute the ambience this place is. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but inside it's super cute. 

The imperial rolls and spring rolls came in cute little baskets and were fresh and delicious. The bowls of pho themselves were great portions. Very filling and keeps your bellies content. The ratio of meat to noodles is pretty poppin', hence their prices. Overall it comes out to $11-13 or so per person. 

This place does get busy, so come early!
author: Cheri C.

description:
This is at the moment one of my favorite Vietnamese restaurants in the city. Not because they provide a fancy experience but because they offer very solid Vietnamese at a good price. 

Service is not amazing though. People are correct but don't seem very friendly most of the time so I don't go there for fuzzy feelings. I come here to have a meal without having to wait long to have a seat and leave with a happy tummy!

All dishes I had there were all pretty good but one of my favorite is their vermicelli with pork. Their Pho is also pretty good :)

Tip: Waiter taking forever bringing you the bill? Go directly to the cashier instead ;)
author: Nuno S.

description:
Some of the best pho I've ever had. This place might be my favorite restaurant in SF, it just can't be beat in terms of value, convenience, and healthiness. When they closed for two months for renovations i was counting down the days until they reopened. Today I am returning from a trip abroad and I am so looking forward to my first pho again. I would recommend: veggie pho, crunch roll, spring roll. 

Tip for vegetarians: they offer to make crunch rolls and spring rolls with freshly fried tofu instead of meat and shrimp!
author: Xiaolu L.

description:
Best beef pho broth in san francisco hands down. Get the sliced beef pho, nice and tender! 

Service is sometimes slow because this place is busy, but if you're in a rush you can always pay at the register. I think they're closed on Tuesdays.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Jasmine Garden is a very solid Vietnamese restaurant in the Castro.  I've been here a couple of times and have thoroughly enjoyed everything I've had here.

Here's a sampling of what I've had during my last visit there:

Taste of Jasmine Garden -- http://bit.ly/1fG2bOX
Imperial rolls, spring rolls, golden shrimps, and papaya salad. Served w/ three sauces.
Basically a smorgasbord of all the appetizers that Jasmine Garden offers.  This is a great starter if you're eating a group of folks.

Salt & Pepper Prawns --  http://bit.ly/1fG2yc6
Prawns lightly battered then fried and wok tossed in salt and pepper, garlic, butter and chili.  Served with garlic noodles.
This is my favorite dish there.  Garlic Noodles and Fried Prawns?  Yes please!!  

Dancing Beef --  http://bit.ly/1fG29X9
Filet mignon cubes work tossed in garlic, butter, black pepper and served with organic mix green salad.
I've had Bo Luc Lac at other Vietnamese spots, but Jasmine Garden's seems to be one of the better ones I've had.  Even way better than Thanh Long's.  They give you a very generous amount of beef and it was cooked just right so that the cubes stay flavorful and not dry.

Curry Fried Rice --  http://bit.ly/1liX6kM
Fried rice with prawns, chicken, onion, garlic and curry powder
Fried rice with a slight kick.  It was a good choice to pair with the Dancing Beef.

So yeah, everything has been very solid and I really have no complaints here.  It is a little bit out my way to get to for Vietnamese food since I live in the Peninsula, but I know that if I'm around the Castro area, I know I can depend of Jasmine Garden to get my Vietnamese fix.
author: Rodney H.

description:
sunday lunch was crowded. staff looked overwhelmed.

Bánh xèo, the viet crepe was hot and crispy.
The egg rolls were complex and also crispy witout being greasy.
Bun bo hue had a nice broth that may had shrimp. however, it was only slices of beef, no other meats or pork blood. so it tasted good but it was more like beef pho with a different broth.
author: Jason C.

description:
San Francisco is blessed with a good amount of decent Vietnamese restaurants and Jasmine Garden fits perfectly in. An inexpensive menu with quality items, a welcoming interior and friendly staff. What more can you ask for?

If you're not in the mood for pho try one of their noodle plates or com dia (rice dishes). 

My favorite here is the VEGETABLE PHO ($7.95) - the broth is a little bit on the sweeter side and extremely delicious. The BEEF PHO ($8.95) is also very good, with thin beef slices in a very flavorful soup. 

The restaurant is frequented by single diners and groups alike, and the food comes out very fast. 

Love the service, the prices, and the food - one of my favorite pho places in town.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Plenty of seafood choices if you don't eat beef or pork! And fast service! 

Catfish clay pot is delish. Sauce is a little on the sweeter side.  Comes with a side of white sticky rice. 

Lemongrass salmon is good too . It's encrusted in a rub. Really like the crispy sticky rice on the side which was lightly seasoned with bits of scallion mixed in! Came with a side salad!

Papaya salad is light and crunchy with a good portion of cocktail shrimp!

Only drawback - free tea offered but with tiny espresso cups. Can only take a few sips before needing to refill!
author: Ruby S.

description:
This was my first try at finding a new Pho place here in San Francisco. It was nice but I will keep looking. The Pho places I have tried in the past (Dallas, Boston), offer a variety of options in regard to Pho ingredients. I felt this place was lacking in that regard.

The Pho I ordered came in a seafood broth. I am not a fan of the taste, I semi-enjoyed it but would not order it again. The highlight of the meal were the fresh Shrimp Spring Rolls.

Again, it was a nice place but it will not be my go to for Pho.
author: Rudy S.

description:
The food was good, but nothing spectacular, with small portions and mediocre service.

- Seafood noodle soup: Broth was good, but expected a bit more seafood. 
- Five spice chicken: Good flavors and tender chicken, but again, portion size was very small. It was a total of around six bites of chicken. 

Maybe we ordered the wrong things since the pho seems most popular, but I feel like there are plenty of other good pho places with larger portions around the city.
author: Sara L.

description: Extremely delicious food. Definitely one of my favorite places to eat at. Must try. Top notch service and food at an affordable price. Love it.
author: Dennis G.

description: Amazing! First time I've tried raw beef and I was very pleased. Great pho. LGBTQ friendly and very delicious. Large portions and friendly, attentive service.
author: Hel D.

description:
I was super impressed by this restaurant! The service was exceptionally friendly and the dishes were high quality and beautifully presented. The place is popular especially for weekend lunch. It was about a 10 min wait even at an off hour. The outside of the restaurant does not show off the nice homey decor on the inside.

MUST GET the crunch roll ($9) appetizer! That was the highlight of the meal for us. It is served in these pretty baskets. It's basically an imperial roll (fried) inside of a spring roll. It's perfect for people who can't decide between the two and want to try something new.

I got the beef pho ($9). The brisket was perfectly fatty and the beef balls were tasty. I thought the pho was amazing but the broth was not the best I've ever had. The rest of the group got the vermicelli noodle bowl (~$10) with pork, beef, and imperial roll. I loved their dish and that seemed more like the way to go next time.
author: Linda X.

description: I've been a long time customer at Jasmine Garden and their food is always great. The perfect comfort meal especially their noodle soups on a cold SF day. I love their bun rieu, pho noodles, and appetizers are all solid choices.
author: Jonathan Y.

description: Great service awesome garlic noodles And the fried rice was very good. The curry was not the best
author: Ramiro N.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in my neighborhood. I always get the vegetarian imperial rolls and the seafood pho but with tofu instead of noodles. It's such a delicious and filling meal at a very affordable price point. Also pleased they have a decent wine selection.
author: Alex C.

description: Basic pho I take to go and eat and home . Probably not the most flavorful but They are incredibly nice and gave extra hoisin sauce and have those really good candies. And it's reasonably priced for SF about $10 a bowl
author: Lisa L.

description:
Good place for a Sunday brunch. Ordered the imperial rolls and chick pho. Both were really good! The rolls are super deep fried and fully filled with a bunch of ingredients. Though they could have been slightly warmer, but still tasted good with the sauce. I was surprised that it came out so beautifully because the decor of the restaurant is definitely not aesthetically pleasing. 

I was also surprised at how delicious the noodles were. The right amount of chewiness, and good balance of noodles and soup.
author: Juliana P.

description:
Jasmine Garden popped up on one of the "best places to get vegetarian pho" lists somewhere, or at least I think it did. Or someone told us it had really good veggie pho. Most places give you slightly flavoured water with a few veggies mixed in and it's pretty sad to get so when we came here, I hoped I would get something super tasty and delicious.

We went through the menu and there were a lot of great looking options. I chose the Pho Chay (vegetarian pho) and my partner decided to try the Bun Bo Hue (lemon grass beef broth pho). Both soups came out quick and I was impressed that my pho didn't try to be a fake meat version. Instead it was a rich vegetable broth with several solid vegetable choices, plus good toppings and tofu. 

Both soups were hot, rich, filling, and everything we were expecting and could ask for. We couldn't finish our servings since there was too much in both our bowls for each of us, but we dented what we had quite well. If I could have finished it, I would have definitely, it was that good. Not too spicy, yet just enough kick to give it a good flavour, there was a lot going on in this soup that made it worth it. It needed no extra sauces or additions, outside of the regular ones that came on the side (sprouts, basil, a touch of lime juice). 

Jasmine Garden definitely deserves to be on the list of one of the better places for pho in the city (at least for their vegetarian option). We'd happily return here for this and to check out the other options on the menu in the future.
author: Cassandra J.

description: I went here late night with my boyfriend and we both agree we'll be back! I had the pho ga (chicken noodle soup) and it was comfort food perfection! The flavor was perfect and it had fried onion pieces which is my favorite part! My boyfriend had the garlic noodles with shrimp and was very happy with the dish. For an appetizer we shared the crunchy bbq pork roll and we both think it's one of the best rolls we've had. The service was quick and very friendly and the restaurant is clean comfortable.
author: Tori R.

description:
After reading "The 11 Best Bowls of Pho in SF" by the Bold Italic, I decided to try Jasmine Garden which was ranked as #9 and the only one recommended for the Bun Bo Hue. 

We strolled in around 1:30pm on a Sunday before the Superbowl. We found parking right in front and we were seated right way. Win! Jasmine Garden is located in the Castro and parking is all street parking and can be quite difficult.

The restaurant has better decor and is cleaner than your typical pho restaurant. It's owned by a husband and wife who personally take your order and serve you.

We ordered the Bo Tai Chanh (Vietnamese style beef carpaccio) and of course the Bun Bo Hue (spicy beef noodle soup). The bo tai chanh was delicious and just under $10, but the portion could have been bigger. The bun bo hue was disappointing however. The soup was tasty, but it was served with vermicelli noodles vs the thick round rice noodles and rare beef slices vs the traditional pork knuckles and pork blood. It didn't live up to the expectations we had. The wife did explain that they used to serve pork blood and pork knuckles but most of the patrons did not eat it and they ended up wasting a lot of the pork blood and knuckles so they substituted it with the rare beef slices.

Service was superb for a pho restaurant. I did laugh when my friend noted the rare beef and the husband thought he meant the rare beef was too rare so he took a pair of chopsticks and pushed the slices of rare beef into the soup. My friend actually meant the opposite and loves rare beef. The duo definitely care about their customers' satisfaction. They're very friendly and sweet.

I probably won't be coming back since I'm never in the area.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Since my original review, I have come here many times and love this restaurant more and more with each visit. My latest favorite that is full of flavor, healthy and light yet incredible satisfying is beef carpaccio. A hefty portion of very thinly sliced raw beef in a sweet fish sauce vinaigrette topped with basil, mint, cilantro, red onion and crushed peanuts. It is so good that my mouth is watering from even thinking about it :)
author: Anat N.

description:
This used to be our spot.

For hangover cures. For quick lunches before grocery shopping at the ghetto Safeway nearby. For casual gatherings when sister is in town. 

Pho ga. Pho dac biet. Imperial rolls. Stir fried eggplant. Their special roasted crab during dinner. Garlic noodles. All yummy. 

Now that there's no more us, I still drop by from time to time. To reminisce at the good times. To remind myself I've been fortunate enough to be loved by this wonderful man. To not feel alone, because Peter and Catherine welcome me like family. 

But I mostly come back for the pho ga. It's comforting, soothing and just makes you feel better. 

It's not just chicken soup. It's chicken soup for the soul.
author: Janice C.

description: Jasmine Garden was great! Only took a few minutes for me to get seated, but from there the service was incredibly fast! I had the Seafood rice noodle pho bowl with a Thai iced tea and it was incredible! Price is very reasonable too. Will definitely be going back.
author: James D.

description: Great place to go for pho in SF! I found this place off of an article online and really enjoyed going here! I got the chicken pho and it was incredible. The service was fast and the restaurant was authentic and fun to be in. Overall great experience and I will most likely be back in the future!
author: Daniel C.

description:
What a great value!  Jasmine Garden is a great place to get your fix of Vietnamese food.  The dining room is certainly not the fanciest place in town, but it's clean and cozy.  

I've read a few reviews that mentioned that the service was spotty...We certainly did not experience that!  Our server was professional and courteous.  He was very patient and attentive when our 4th person joined us late after being held up at work-- and we sincerely appreciated that! 

The food is very delicious and extra care is taken in plating dishes.  I wanted a light meal, so I ordered an appetizer.  Real orchids accented my gorgeous meal! (see photo)  The rest of the table ordered BBQ pork and rice plates and pho.  Everything was flavorful, plated gorgeously, and very satisfying.   

We were all very happy with our meals....and the price! The price!! Did I mention what a great value Jasmine Garden is?! 

I will certainly be back when I'm in the area
author: Andrea H.

description: The food here is Great. I got a curry dish, it wasn't spicy at all, but it was so flavorful. The service is really good, and the waitstaff are friendly. If you want a lot of good food, go here.
author: Kara R.

description: Solid, clean Vietnamese spot with an easy to access location. A hot bowl of pho is perfect for chilly San Francisco days and is not easy to come by in this part of the city. The pho portions are slightly smaller than what I'm used to (maybe I'm spoiled), but honestly, it's still plenty and should be totally sufficient for most people.
author: Kelly R.

description:
I was starving for Vietnamese food and my friends suggested to go here on a Wednesday for lunch! We walked in right as they opened and I couldn't have been happier!!!

Our waiter was very attentive and brought us water and menus immediately. I felt like the ambiance throughout the restaurant was very dim and set more for the dinner folks. But we seated ourselves along the windows close to the entrance to give ourselves a brighter vibe. The three of us ended up ordering the BBQ pork with imperial rolls and all with rice instead of vermicelli. And oh dear, the portion was delicious and HUGE! 

The BBQ pork itself was juicy on the inside and had a lovely crust of BBQ char. It came along with three miniature rolls of fried imperial rolls that cannot disappoint. It was extremely crispy on the outside and that's the most important part! Lastly, the rice was super moist and fluffy just the way I like it! The portion was huge but it was so good that I ate the entire thing in one sitting. I had no regrets though, and you won't either!

I also had a thai iced tea that I felt was sweetened perfectly for my sweet tooth and the dish and the drink totaled to be $14! I wish that I worked close by so that I could eat here all the time!
author: Linda K.

description:
Okay I may be biased but I honestly believe that Asians know how to make seafood the best out of all cultures. We just put so much amazing flavor into our seafood that it is the perfect combination of sweet, salty, savory, salivatory sensation in one mouthful. This place is just absolutely delicious with some of the most basic ingredients that make me wonder, why don't we have this in Texas, a state full of Vietnamese restaurants??? We need to step up our game a notch. 

I LOVE their lemongrass salmon. "When you eat you be like, wow, so simple, I don't believe...check it out though." I love fried shallots/garlic in lemongrass and it's the perfect combination. I feel like this dish in particular is more Thai than Viet but it's all southeast Asian, no? Anyway took a pic but the picture doesn't do this meal justice. I could eat this meal every day...
author: Grace L.

description:
Solid Vietnamese food. I've had better pho in the city, but I will probably be proposing this spot as an option when suggesting places to eat in the future for their proximity to public transit, fair prices, and generous portions. Between my friend and I, we had 2 pho dishes, Vietnamese coffee, and a Thai iced tea. our total pre-tax came out to ~30 bucks, which I find reasonable.

Excited to come back here and try their Bun Rieu.
author: Cindy Y.

description:
This is my happy place. The beef carpaccio is a hidden gem but you really come here for the pho.

It can get a little busy on the weekend but they move at a pretty good pace.

Imperial rolls are also solid.
author: Charles V.

description: The food here is delicious. It seems like everyone knows that so the wait can be quite a bit but they seem to do their best turning over tables, with that said you can expect the service to be straight to the point. The spring roll with the hidden fried imperial inside was delicious.
author: Long C.

description:
Not too shabs. I was drunkenly stumbling around after a fun day at Lagunitas brewery and decided to hop out of my uber and just go for gold at Jasmine Garden.

I had the rare beef pho, it was OK, the broth was nothing to write home about to be honest and they didn't have chow fun noodles which is what I like best, so I don't think I'll be back any time soon.
author: Crystal C.

description: For about $10 you can get a decent bowl of beef pho here. There is only one size, medium large-ish. The broth is clear and has the right amount of salt. I usually find the meatballs pretty chewy, but the ones it came with had a good texture. The restaurant is worth walking to if you live in the area and need a pho fix.
author: Huey N.

description:
Stopped by here after church on Sunday to get a quick bite before heading downtown. I first heard about Jasmine Garden from a friend who held the restaurant in very high esteem so I was pretty excited to try out the place.

Did it live up to my expectations? Yes. Yes it did. 

When you first get to the restaurant, it really doesn't look like much from the outside. I expected a very small restaurant with minimal space, but it's actually quite large and nice on the inside. Clean and very presentable. 

When I got the menu, I immediately ordered the pho ga (chicken pho) and the garlic noodles. Within 5 minutes of ordering, my food was in front of me. I first tried out the pho ga and I really just have to say that it's definitely 10/10. I've been to a lot of pho restaurants and Jasmine Garden has some of the best pho I've ever had. The broth actually tasted like beef bone soup unlike at some pho restaurants where the pho is really just noodles sitting in a salt water bath. After trying out the pho, I tried out the garlic noodles which were just as amazing as the pho. I'm not a big fan of garlic flavored things, but the garlic noodles had just enough flavoring to make it taste really good.

With the garlic noodles and pho, my total came out to $16 which was not bad considering the amount of food I got. If you are nearby the Castro area, I highly suggest you stop by Jasmine Garden to try it out for yourself. Great food at a great price! :)
author: Derek L.

description: The absolute best outside of Vietnam and I just got back so I know! Everything is scrumptious!
author: baretta v.

description:
I've been stopping by Jasmine Garden for the past four years since I've been living in the area and the food always hits the spot!  My favorite dish from my mom growing up was canh chua which literally translates to "sour soup." It's usually cooked with tomatoes, tamarind, garlic and can also have bean sprouts, okra, basil, and pineapples.  Jasmine Garden offers it with either catfish or shrimp.  For $10.50, you get a giant clay pot full of the soup.  I love to pour the soup and veggies and fish over a bowl of rice.  After eating at the restaurant, my leftovers lasted me two more meals! This is definitely a share-able dish and is soo tasty.

My boyfriend got the bbq pork vermicelli dish and the meat was very flavorful and tender.  We also got the imperial rolls which were really good.
author: T D.

description:
My parents are from a small town in Vietnam, and so I was trying to find an authentic meal for them after taking them to a more americanized pho joint two nights ago which they said tasted off. 

This place fit just the bill. My mom loved the crunch rolls, and my dad enjoyed his Vietnamese beer. Both my parents claimed the food tasted much better. 

My boyfriend also ordered the bun bo hue and the waiter gave him additional napkins, joking that his shirt was nice and broth stains are hard to get out. I particularly loved the coconut ice cream with the fried banana. I would definitely visit again.
author: Jenn L.

description: Jasmine Garden is absolutely delicious and a go-to restaurant with very friendly service. The jasmine taster plate is a must!! Also Salmon curry, and the coconut ice cream with fried banana dessert! Mmm I am getting hungry just thinking about it! It is a family-run restaurant and always such a pleasure to go to!
author: Kelly C.

description:
LMFAO let's talk about how I love the service here. It's very clear that no fucks are given in regards to the customer. Sit down, order fast, eat, pay fast, and leave. This is how they prefer it. If you mess up any of these steps, you're gonna get some sass from everyone working here. Its hilarious.

The pho is good, but the best part about this restaurant are the neon lights and the one woman who when we asked to split the bill simply said no. No? WHATCHU mean? Ok Jasmine Garden...I guess it's your way, again.
author: Morgen B.

description:
Great beef pho, and the five-spice chicken was sweet and spicy and delicious. I agree with other posters that the chicken was a bit on the small side, but we had ordered it as a side so it worked for us.

Our server (possibly the owner?) was charming and prompt.
author: Joshua A.

description:
Jasmine Garden is located in The Castro district of SF. I was looking for a new pho restaurant to try out and this place popped up as highly reviewed and popular on Yelp. It isn't too far of a walk from my apartment so I decided to try it out.

FREQUENCY: I've dined at this establishment once.

FOOD: I ordered the Pho Dac Biet. It contained thin sliced of tender beef, flank, and beef ball in a beef broth. The noodles and soup was delivered to me very fast and came out piping hot (a very important quality to me in good noodles and soup). The soup was absolutely delicious and I was quite full upon finishing. I'm used to getting Sriracha and BBQ sauce which I normally mix with sugar for a very good dipping sauce for the meats in the soup (I highly recommend making it for yourself) but I wasn't given any. I'm not sure if they were out or if that's more of an American add-on to pho but I did wish they offered any. I think I would have enjoyed the meal more had I been given some since I've become very accustomed to having those condiments with my pho.

DRINK: Jasmine Garden had a small selection of alcoholic and fountain drinks. I ordered a beer and a glass of water to go with my soup. It's a pretty small place without a bar so I wasn't expecting a huge drink menu.

ATMOSPHERE: This was a very traditional small Vietnamese pho restaurant. I went a little later in the evening but I could imagine it gets pretty crowded during prime dining hours. If the traditional Vietnamese restaurant style is very important to you when enjoying pho I think you'll enjoy this spot.

STAFF: I don't expect much conversation at traditional pho places. I grew up in Philadelphia going to several and normally my only conversations with the staff were ordering and then paying. I would have been fine with the same treatment this time had I not wanted to ask for Sriracha and BBQ sauce. Other pho restaurants I go to normally just have it on the table so you don't have to speak to the staff after ordering. If you are expecting a lot of staff interaction I don't think you'll find that here. But that's not a problem for me since I find it's expected at a place like this.

PAYMENT: Credit cards or cash were acceptable.

I enjoyed my experience at Jasmine Garden. There are other pho places closer to my apartment that I will probably frequent more often than this one but I'm totally open to going back if I'm in the area. If you are in The Castro and you love pho definitely check this place out.
author: Christopher D.

description: Great Pho in a casual setting. It's clear why his place is popular.  Great food at decent prices.
author: Bre D.

description:
Love this place!
Got the Hot and Sour Catfish Soup! whaaaaa??!!! So good. Got side of rice for extra comfort and proceeded to heaven. 
Don't sleep.  Everything I've ordered has been delicious, flavorful and clean.
author: Melonie G.

description:
Best Vietnamese....pho sure!

Get there when they open at 12. It gets busy shortly thereafter. We had a feast of spring rolls, crunchy roll, garlic noodles and spicy beef pho.

Garlic noodles were mediocre. Crunchy roll was divine.

The spicy beef pho was absolutely amazing.
author: Sarah S.

description: The food is amazing and they played legit Asian music. I took my parents here and they love the vibe here! Great Vietnamese restaurant in the area!!! Pretty authentic!!
author: Sophie L.

description: New ownership? The pho taste like dishwater and the staff isn't friendly anymore. What happened. Oh well many of other options.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This place is still very good, but just wanted to update that the last 3 times I've come they've 'ran out of imperial rolls'. They replied to me and said they make them every day but always run out. I came 1hr after they were open and they were sold out. So sounds like they just need to make more of them. :)

The Pho is awesome while sick. I get the veggie pho + add chicken with chicken broth and it's great. Fills up a big bowl and has great flavor.
author: Michael M.

description:
We came to jasmine garden because it's across the street from my friend's house. The location is great, but the food is just mediocre. I had the chicken clay pot, but it didn't have any veggies and there wasn't really any pizazz. 

I have heard that their pho is better so I would be open to going back and trying a pho dish. The place itself was fine - relatively clean and big enough that we didn't have to wait. 

In general, I'd come back for convenience but wouldn't seek out a meal here.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
How can you not like a place that serves their spring rolls in a miniature version of the shoulder baskets you would see Vietnamese locals carry using a pole balanced on their shoulders? I knew this place existed but never gave it much thought since I already have my favorite Vietnamese restaurants that are closer to my home. But I decided to give it a try when I had a free evening. Conveniently located adjacent to the  Church Street MUNI station and inexplicably decorated with strings of blue Christmas lights (...or maybe they were Hanukkah), it looks to be quite a popular spot since a lot of the tables were filled by 6PM. They also seem to do quite a takeout business since there were several people on chairs staring at their iPhones as they were waiting for their food.

I was seated at the table nearest to the front door where I could see the comings and goings of the staff and the customers. I was starving, so I started with the aforementioned Spring Rolls, a tad pricey at $6.50 but quite gargantuan and tasty to boot with poached shrimps, lettuce, bean sprouts, mint, sweet basil and rice noodles wrapped in translucent rice paper and served with peanut sauce (see photo). They were deliciously crunchy, and those baskets were empty in a near-flash. I was in the mood for pho, which they don't have on their dinner menu - but the waiter didn't even pause or try to talk me out of it. He simply rushed to the back to give me a lunch menu to decide on which one. I went with the $7.50 bowl of Bun Rieu, which they dub the Sea Noodle Soup because of the shrimp, I guess.

There was egg drop (instead of the usual omelette), fried tofu, and vermicelli noodles in a tomato-based chicken broth (see photo). It was a bit greasy on top, but I enjoyed slurping it. You'd think that would be enough, but I also ordered a $3.50 side of the Sauteed Green Beans topped with ground peanuts (see photo). It turned out to be a great additional ingredient in the soup . So was the hefty basket of steamed rice as I scooped it into the broth as well (see photo). I was getting full, but I still powered my way through the food which overall, was pretty darn satisfying considering I didn't know what to expect from a Vietnamese place in this part of the Castro. With the quick service by the staff there, I think this one will need to move up my list.

FOOD - 4 stars...hefty portions and quite fresh and satisfying
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...reasonably spacious and with those festive blue lights
SERVICE - 4 stars...pretty darn quick if you ask me
TOTAL - 4 stars...another non-Tenderloin place to get pho and spring rolls without having to risk your life
author: Ed U.

description:
Wow - it doesn't look like much from the outside, but I'm super impressed!  The food is VERY reasonably priced, freshly made, and decently healthy. The staff is helpful, yet  not overwhelming. The portions are large, and the presentation is fun. Truly a great value for your money.

Every dish on the table was (and looked) great. I especially loved my seafood noodles with shrimp, calamari, and scallops over vegetables, rice and broth. I also loved that they give you some different sauces and condiments (sriracha, thai basil, bean sprouts, and other unidentified - but delicious - things) to make your meal a little interactive.
author: Catie F.

description:
As someone who is blind, it can be hard getting good service.
This place is just the oppisite. Amazing service. 

Explained all the condiments and sides on the table and nice friendly staff. 
I got the beef combination pho and it was divine. This from someone who ate homemade pho growing up.
author: Colin W.

description:
THE BEST VEGETARIAN PHO IN SF! This is a huge accomplishment for there are so many excellent options for veg Pho...but after 3 years we feel we have found our absolute favorite. (If you're interested, the thing that makes this Pho so unique, in my opinion, is the addition of fried garlic and shallot before serving...flipping amazing flavors) We even ate dinner there Friday night then returned for a repeat at lunchtime Saturday! Love this place.
The service is great, too, lightning fast and super friendly.
author: deanna h.

description:
Best Asian food in the Castro.  Get either the beef and chicken pho here.  Perfect comfort food.  I've also tried a number of other dishes which were all very good.  

There is usually a wait, but it's never longer than 15 minutes.  This is one of my regular go-to's in this neighborhood.
author: Jaching H.

description:
We stumbled upon Jasmine Garden after discovering that neighboring Lime had already closed for the evening. Nevertheless, Jasmine ended up being a wonderful alternative.

Jasmine is located in a very seedy part of town. While walking, we couldn't help but constantly look over our shoulders to ensure that some creeper wasn't stalking us. Homeless individuals abound in this area, and they aren't typically the timid kind. In other words, they're very boisterous and agressive with passersby. I was a little nervous. Notwithstanding, we managed to make it into the doors of Jasmine unmolested.

Obviously, Jasmine is a popular spot for locals. The place was positively buzzing with activity when we finally arrived a little after 9pm. The restaurant is well staffed, and we were immediately seated upon entry. 

We decided to start with an order of BBQ Chicken Spring Rolls. These were the highlight of the night for me, really. Why, you ask? It's because of the manner in which they were presented (see photos). The spring rolls were served in two separate baskets that were adjoined by a single wooden rod. I just couldn't get over how cute it was. And I should also point out that they tasted fabulous.

I ordered a noodle dish or some sort that I recall being equally delicious. My B.K. also seemed to enjoy his selection(s) as well.

Prices are commensurate with other restaurants. Service is effecient. Overall, my dining companion and I both really enjoyed our experience at Jasmine and I won't hesitate to return again if in search of Asian-inspired cuisine.
author: Gary R.

description:
In a bit of a Chow rut?
Yep.

Yelp approved Vietnamese place nearby?
Yep.

Dingy exterior?
Yep.

Door that is hard to open?
Yep.

Surprisingly pleasant interior?
Yep.

Cool spring roll presentation?
Yep.

OK vermicelli bowl?
Yep.

Disappointingly tough and grisly chicken?
Yep.

Wallet friendly?
Yep.

Better than Sunflower?
NOPE.

(Not even close!)
author: Amy C.

description:
Jasmine Garden wasn't bad..actually. I was hungry for pho on a windy day, and this place satisfied the craving. It may not be your typical "Asian" pho restaurant, but give it a shot. The interior is nice. 

Warning: My Soup was EXTREMELY hot, which was a definite PLUS! I hate lukewarm temperatured pho soups. 

I ordered #14, the Jasmine Garden Pho Noodle Soup. The broth was tasty, unique, and flavorful. The flavor was distinctive and hit me by surprised each time. The meat included was good and standard for most pho restaurants. I wish they included beef tendons though, which would have made it a lot better.  There also wasn't a lot of noodles or onions either, but that's a different story. For $8 a bowl, the price was pretty steep for the amount of food.

Service was good. Glass got refilled. Check was also promptly delivered.
author: Chinsin S.

description: Great food great service. Ate there two times in a row. Carpaccio with mint and basil was great. We all had the bass wok style and shrimp skewers. Thank you Kelly for everything.
author: Ronald R.

description: I just got finished eating the most delicious bowl of spicy beef pho and I am so happy. The broth had so many spices and flavors. I ordered my pho to go and they gave me such a huge portion that I have enough for another big bowl for lunch tomorrow. Three cheers for Jasmine Garden!
author: Jordan S.

description: Came here Sunday for lunch, and this place got poppin real quick. We just barely beat the crowd. I got Jasmine Garden Pho Noodle Soup #14 (first pho in the noodles section), and our food came out pretty fast. I really like the broth, and I was surprised by the generous amount of noodles in my bowl. I got pretty full off of it. Good service, good serving sizes, good prices, good food!
author: Annie S.

description: This place use to be a lot better. The couple who used to operate this place was friendly and provided excellent service; only now it's replaced with abrasive and not-so attentive waitresses. The food isn't that great anymore either. The egg rolls are tiny and the fillings is barely there.
author: Brad N.

description:
Wanted to try some west coast pho and this place was pretty good!

Got the #14 Jasmine Garden Pho Noodle Soup. Really good broth. Definitely recommend. I asked for more veggies to put in and although they were a little stingy, they did bring some more. 

The spring rolls were pretty good, but they were average for spring rolls and overpriced. The presentation however, was very pretty. They came in these basket things. so yeah.. i guess you're paying for presentation.


Bottom line: SOLID pho. (that means very good)
recommend this if you want some pho in SF.
author: Yong K.

description:
I go here about twice a week.

The pho, bun bo hue, garlic noodles, and spring rolls, noodle dishes.... pretty much everything is DE-licious.

The prices are great, the atmosphere is exactly what I want, service is great, good vietnamese coffees... I have nothing but good things to say about this place. 

It's closed one day a week though, and I often forget what day that is... which is furstrating.
author: Jake D.

description:
This place is SF's best kept secret. Located in not so well-known spot in the city, the outer appearance of the restaurant is not anything special. It even looks a bit run down and outdated. But I think Jasmine Garden deserves a solid 5-star review for the following reasons.

The food is the best I have ever had thus far. I tried many Vietnamese restaurants in and outside of the bay area, but no other place makes their pho's, salads and rice plate dishes better than Jasmine Garden. What also distinguishes them is that each person gets their own bowl of pho veggies (basils, sprouts, etc), and their veggies are super fresh. This may not seem like such a big deal, but it is a good reflection of the freshness and cleanliness of the foods they prepare. My favorite, btw is #17 (seafood tomato based noodle soup) with pho noodles (because it usually comes with vermicelli noodles). 

Their service is great! The waitstaffs are professional, efficient and friendly. What more can I expect?

Overall, Jasmine Garden is my favorite Vietnamese restaurant for the quality of food and service, and I eat there every week.
author: Jane M.

description: Food is tasty and has good portions.  We went there and ordered spring rolls that came in a cute basket, along with seafood egg noodle soup, side order of green beans (seasoning was too sweet), crispy egg noodle with shrimp and calamari which was tasty, Jasmine Garden special claypot which was average and shrimp garlic noodles which was tasty.  All in all the prices and taste was good.  They have several different menus with a variety of different entrees but if you want pho, you have to ask for that menu.
author: Karen W.

description:
This is just a review of their bun bo hue. 

I yelped a place specifically looking for this dish, and this place came up as one of the top rated places for their bun bo hue. I was seated in a few minutes and got my order in very quick (beat the rush of obnoxious 49er fans flooding in from local bars). I got my food in a timely manner.
