When I got it, though, I has to ask if they got my order right. The lady said it was correct. So, I kind of sifted through the noodles looking for the cartilage, tendons, pork blood cubes...and found nothing. All that was present were thinly sliced pieces of raw beef. Like the ones you get in pho, NOT bun bo hue, and little of anything else. Actually, there was nothing else except lots of cilantro. So ....what is this?? What did I order? Some kind of poorly remixed bun bo hue?! 

To be honest, I couldn't even finish it. The waiter asked if I wanted the food to go and was shocked when I said no (since there was more than half the dish left over). I mean, if the broth were decent (as opposed to just spicy and red), then maybe I would have mustered through it. But even they wasn't reminiscent of the bun bo hue I've had in other restaurants near Tenderloin or even in the East Bay. Pretty sad. And it cost me $8.50, which is on the costly side for Vietnamese noodles.
author: Han P.

description:
Chapter One: Today's Visit

Sometimes youuu waanna go, where everybooody knows yoour naaaamme, duhh nuh nuh nuh, and they're aaalways glad you caaamme, duh nuuh nuh... this is Jasmine Garden. I see it as a 3-star place with at least 4-star familial treatment for its regular customers.

I'd only been here once before and wasn't recognized this time, but nearly everyone else was greeted and / or seen off with a hug, kiss, knowing phrase, etc.. The staff seamlessly unpaused what were obviously running conversations with most of the diners, and new talks were taken up with out-of-towners. Side note: if you don't want your personal life aired out, don't get too intimate with the workers. Their conversations with customers were very audible. My own service got off to an uncertain start, but by the end of my meal I too got a chat with the man and a holler 'n' wave from the woman. I honestly understood maybe 40% or less of the man's English during our talk, but what counts is the staff's social nature.

The dish I ordered, like numerous others on the menu, was labeled "(spicy)". Rather than specifically request hotness, I had my dish as-is to gauge this restaurant's baseline spiciness. My threshold for heat is so low as to say it's pretty much nonexistent. Given this, even I say my dish wasn't spicy at all. Maybe I would've gotten some zing out of biting the whole red chilies that were mixed in, but the sauce, the food itself, the scattered flakes of pepper... nothing. It didn't bring the ruckus. If you want heat, I suggest explicitly telling your server to turn up the spice. Or do what my friends and I do - take out a thermometer, point to the top, and be like, "My food better be like THIS okaaaay?" Kidding. Don't do that (unless you're dining with us).

Also, the amount of food was small compared to those of similar restaurants and prices. Was this a lunch thing? I'm almost never in restaurants before nightfall, so I wouldn't know. I'm not a big eater, but I don't expect cooks to read my mind and respond by giving me less. Had the portion been any smaller, it would've entered the range of tapas. I'm not exaggerating.

I'd say the realest minus of my experience was that two of the three specialty Vietnamese drinks listed on the menu were unavailable. This was a graver tease than when I saw servers wearing Hite (a Korean beer) aprons in a Japanese restaurant that didn't have Hite. Incidentally, the conversation that the man started with me concerned the missing drinks. The clearest parts I caught were that, around here, they're only available wholesale and not many customers ask for them. Otherwise, I would've considered the hard-to-find beverages a reason to come here. I'll have to check back in the future.

If you're going to eat here, I suggest you do so while they still have the Christmas decorations up. Included are stuffed animal chicks or ducklings sitting in stockings and wreaths. They're something to see. One even sits in a wreath above the prayer altar at the front of the restaurant.

(Mini) Chapter Two: A Prior Visit

Are you one of those pranksters who sneaks meat onto the plates of vegetarians and vegans, telling them it's soy / seitan / gluten / whatever? Well, this place pulls the opposite on you. I was here in a group of 3, and one person ordered vegetarian / vegan rolls. The person bit into a piece, analytically chewed, then told the group they thought the rolls had meat. The other 2 tasted pieces but couldn't tell. Asking the man (the same man from today) revealed that what tasted, chewed, and seemed like meat in the rolls actually was faux.

One of the people in our group spoke a little Vietnamese, which probably didn't hurt the level of service we got. So if you have Vietnamese-speaking friends, consider bringing them along.

Everyone liked the food. I ordered the "Fresh Coconut" drink, which literally was a coconut with the very top sliced off to insert a straw. This kind of thing needs to be done by more establishments, such as airplanes for when I fly to Vietnam to score the missing drinks from today.
author: Dan B.

description: My favorite weekend Vietnamese place. Service is friendly and quick. The bun cha gio thit, imperial rolls, and the pho dac biet are standouts.
author: Glendon M.

description: We came here with our friends for dinner, the food was delicious but when we asked for our check it took 30 minutes. The owner came over with the check and both parties credit card information was written on the check and she said "our machine is not working but we will charge you tomorrow". We told her that that is not appropriate for her to write down our credit card numbers. We asked her to rewrite our check and she ended up charging us $30 more than the original bill. Really disappointed in the service. She explained that "all our customers are okay with us writing down the card number and the CVV number". Good food but don't trust this establishment.
author: Emily F.

description:
I've been on the hunt for good Vietnamese. This is the 4th vietnamese place I've been to in SF and i have to say it's pretty good. 
Spring rolls are a must - very fresh, great presentation, $7 for 4 pieces and commendation sauce to with it! Very authentic.
I had item #14 on the menu which is the Pho Dac Biet. They came with a bowl of vegetables of Vietnamese basil, 2 slices of peppers and sprouts - could have been more. 
The broth was ok - not out of this world and I felt like there was maybe a bit too much MSG in it. 
Still, tasty enough and very reasonably priced. 
We came at 7:35pm and thank god for that because 15-20 minutes later, there was a line pretty much out the door of about 4 different parties. 
Will I come again? Yes probably. It's in the neighborhood and convenient.
friendly staff.
author: Van-Anh N.

description:
I always go to Jasmine Garden when I want pho! The beef broth here is always rich in flavor. I typically come here for lunch or dinner, but I had pho here at 10pm once, and the broth was AMAZING (probably because it had been simmering for longer).

If you're going to get an appetizer, I highly recommend their garlic noodles! Absolutely delicious.

I've gone here probably more than 20 times now, and every time, service has been spectacular. Food gets served quickly, and I've never had to ask for my water to be refilled. Speaking of water, their water is honestly the best water I've ever had. They add the perfect amount of lime and basil to their water, so it's super refreshing.
author: Wendy V.

description:
Most pho places don't have spicy broth so when I do see one, I order it!  This place had it and I definitely enjoyed it.  The broth was spicy (pretty spicy) but delicious.  The broth color was a nice red tint.  There was a lot of noodles in the broth and the total was only like $8.  

The menus that they first handed us did NOT have pho so we had to ask them a few times to give us the other menu that had pho.  Not sure why the pho wouldn't be on all the menus.
author: Danielle C.

description: The vegetarian pho is amazing here. 4 stars since the atmosphere is always cold and it gets quite loud when full.
author: mary g.

description:
Stopping by this restaurant with my mom who has never tried pho. She fell in love right the way.

The food is great, fair-price and comfortable environment. Would definitely come back
author: Jeff G.

description: Decent five-spice chicken. Pleasant service.
author: Inigo M.

description:
This is place is horrible, for a couple reasons: 

1) it's so dirty. The seats, walls, doors etc haven't been cleaned in years. The first thing you'll notice when you arrive is how bad it smells. 

2) the pho was fair at best. Overly cooked noodles. Nasty old beef. 

3) flies were everywhere 

4) egg rolls were fries too long 

5) spring rolls had too much noodle so they didn't wrap
Tight enough 

6) tea was weak
author: maggie p.

description:
"Peter!....Peter!.....Peter?"

As soon as my friend and I walked into Jasmine Garden today, we were graciously welcomed by one of the owners thinking that my friend was "Peter". With puzzled looks on our faces, the owner quickly realized that my friend wasn't "Peter" and nicely ushered us in to sit at a table. Apparently, "Peter" is a regular with the same fohawk and dresses in a suit every time he comes in. But anyhow...

F O O D:
This is not your typical Pho restaurant. Although they do have Pho on the menu, they also have a variety of Buns (noodle plates), Com Dia (rice plates) and Cac Mon Thit (entrees: chicken, beef, lamb and seafood). They do have Roasted Crab but you have to call in advance to reserve it. 

I rarely venture out of the TL, Richmond or Sunset to eat Vietnamese food but I was pleasantly surprised at this Mom & Pop restaurant. I told the owner/waitress that I'm sensitive to MSG and she kindly put in a request to have my food prepared without it. 

*BO TAI CHANH - Vietnamese Beef Carpaccio w/ Mint, Basil, Cilantro, Red Onion, Crispy Shallot, Fried Garlic, Crushed Peanut & Fish Sauce ($7.95):  A MUST ORDER!!!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5DeL87rp02kT8xHn1CJS1g?select=VDaa_I9rXKZh6xmy_FtoRw

Each bite was like a refreshing BURST of various flavor and texture profiles! You get the soft beefyness from the silky carpaccio followed by the freshness of the mint and herbaceous basil, red onion and cilantro combo. You then get a sweet crunch from the fried shallots and garlic while the crushed peanuts gave it a nutty crisp. The fish sauce completed the dish adding a sweet, savory and tanginess without overpowering the star ingredient. 

*COM TAY CAM DAC BIET - Vietnamese Rice Clay Pot w/ Chicken, Shrimp, Chinese Sausage, Mushroom, Garlic & Ginger ($7.50): YUMMY IN MY TUMMY!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5DeL87rp02kT8xHn1CJS1g?select=RZHhae2kjKmXSKLPTTO3ig

Presented by the Chef and served in a sizzling clay pot, the ginger and garlic aroma from the claypot permeated into the air. Inside the claypot was the white rice which had caramelized on the bottom and the sides of the claypot to a delicious crispiness. The Chinese sausage was rich and savory, however, the chicken and shrimp were a bit overcooked and dry. The sweet, savory sauce was packed with bold flavors and had infused into the rice and proteins making each bite full of garlicky ginger flavor. I love ginger and there was no shortage of ginger slivers which gave the rice layers of sweet aromatic flavor with a subtle spice. 

S E R V I C E:
The husband and wife duo are extremely hospitable and accommodating; very atypical of your ordinary Asian restaurant. They periodically checked on us to make sure everything was ok and my water glass was never empty. Btw, I loved the mint infused water which was very refreshing. 

Our orders came out fairly quickly; 5 mins for our apps and while we were still eating our apps, our entrees came out. 

A M B I A N C E / D É C O R:
A bit more upscale than your typical humble Asian restaurant but very simple nonetheless. Tables were well-spaced out and everything was clean. 

P A R K I N G:
I would normally drive but since I was on my lunch break, I walked to JG because I'm a complete noob when it comes to public transportation (I missed the F-Line twice and then took the wrong bus so I threw in the towel and walked there). Yay, for flip flops!

Metered street parking is moderately easy to find before 6 PM on weekdays but is difficult thereafter and on weekends because of all the surrounding restaurants and bars. However, being so close to the F-Line and the Church Street Station, you may want to take public transportation instead.

If you're craving Vietnamese food and don't want to go the shady TL, JG is an excellent option. The food is packed with bold flavors at very reasonable prices and you can't beat the hospitable service. 

We never got to see the real "Peter" while we were having lunch. Dammit, I guess we'll HAVE to return...
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Came here on a Sunday night and the place was pretty busy but it only took about 5 minutes to be seated. Service was great as the owners brother and seemed to be the man running the place knew my boyfriend and came over to our table to introduce himself to me and to see how things were going. 

We ordered spring rolls and calamari for appetizers. Presentation and taste was great for the spring rolls and their sauce was delicious. The calamari was probably the best calamari I've had-and I try lots of calamari. It came with a sweet and sour sauce too. For dinner, we both ordered pho and were served huge portions. If you're looking for pho, this is definitely the place to go. Prices are affordable as well. Looking forward to coming back very soon.
author: Briana G.

description:
I love this place, if I lived closer to sf this would probably be my go to place! My favorites are the chow fun, rack of lamb, and the beef capriccio. The chow fun is sweeter than your average chow fun, but if gives the dish a nice twist and I prefer it that way anyways. The rack of lamb doesn't have a gamey taste and the meat is tender. The sweet rice served with it is a nice compliment! The beef capriccio is AMAZING. I was hesitant at first to trying it, but once I dug in... I couldn't be saved from the delicious crunch, salad, beef amazing-ness. 

The service is great too! They are really attentive. From what I've seen they even explain to their customers about their food and menu well! 

Once again to emphasize my point, I LOVE THIS PLACE.
author: Erica C.

description: I've been coming here routinely since I moved to the city 3+ years ago and it has literally never disappointed. Best vegetarian pho I've found yet in the city, but their bun rieu and vegetarian egg rolls are my absolute favorites.
author: Britt J.

description:
I came here once before with the parents; I couldn't remember much about the meal, just that it was good enough and we had a good time chatting up with this waiter guy. 

Tonight I came here again with a friend; we were craving for Viet food and it was close to where we work. I recommended this place to my friend because I vaguely remember that it was good, and that...well, Yelp said so
The moment we sat down, the waiter asked if we're ready to order. I get it, if you're a regular (which we are so not), maybe you know exactly what you want the moment you sit your ass down?  Or...or because we look (and are) Vietnamese, we innately know what's good? OR, we already yelped the menu ahead of time and know exactly what we're craving for? Well, if you run a business, DO NOT assume those things! The two waiters kept returning to our table every half minute asking if we're ready to order, giving us nasty looks when we said we were not. And keep in mind, there were not a lot of customers in the restaurant at this point.

Food: what a disappointment! I ordered a simple bowl of Bun Bo Hue. Nothing in the bowl spoke Bun Bo Hue: the noodles, the meat, the vegetables, the broth, everything was wrong! Either they're trying to be creative (not really), or they're cheating their customers by using cheap, convenient ingredients and call it something that it's not! When you call yourself "authentic" Vietnamese foods with Vietnamese decorations and television everywhere in the restaurant, you need to keep it authentic! It cannot be a Bun Bo Hue without its key ingredients, even if the broth is good.
My friend's Hu Tieu was so insignificant she didn't even finish it. 
I think 2 stars is very generous for the appetizers' cute decoration.
author: Vân P.

description:
The presentation of Jasmine Garden's spring rolls, lovingly perched in a darling bamboo carriers - made me smile. Their sauteed string beans packed an epic garlic punch and were incredibly addictive. Their Lemongrass vegetable dish was delightful and full of sensational sauteed veggies. And their pho broth is heavenly.

But unfortunately their service - while friendly, was lacking this past weekend. We were seated right by the front window and had to keep on reminding our server about things we ordered and were left alone for most of our meal.

Still - I imagine that on more mellow nights - Jasmine Garden is far more accommodating when it comes to attentive service and their food definitely speaks for itself - with it's fresh ingredients, generous portions, and affordable prices.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Food was good and tasty. Nice and quiet atmosphere.  
Loved all the selections, and the customer service was excel I end as well. Will come again when in the area.
author: Xavier T.

description:
- Locale Destination - 
It's on 14th St and between Belcher St & Church St in Castro, SF.

I'm not so sure about areas in SF, but it's a bit tacked away from the main street in Casto. Decor isn't that fancy, though they were trying. Oh, the front door doesn't close by itself, so make sure to close it. They have a TV but was on Vietnamese channel. Nice attentive service. But the slowest service ever - at Vietnamese restaurant. Expect waiting for your food. Credit cards are available. 



- Gluttony Expedition - 
Pho is on "Lunch" menu, but it's available at "Dinner" time.
 
Rare steak pho: The broth is very sweet with a medium body. Not bad, just OK. The portion is quite small - noodle, soup, and the condiments. I'm very spoiled by the Little Saigon in Orange County. Though it's good for staying skinny in this city, but I even thought the portion was small.   

#19 Sate Noodle:  The sauce was spicy and flavorful with tamarind, Thai basil, and chili. It's more like a "Thai" flavor, but it was very tasty. The egg noodle was skinny and deep-fried hard one, which I did like. Some of them got soft due to the sauce - I love the mix textures - soft and hard together. The portion was quite small but it was tasty! 



- Conqueror's Deduction - 
3.5 stars, close to 4. Good flavors but very small portion. Pho wasn't impressive - but I'm very well trained at Little Saigon in Garden Grove when it comes to "Pho". The waiting for the food was quite long unlike the Little Saigon in OC. But they do offer tasty meals.
author: Akiko I.

description:
My favorite Vietnamese restaurant in SF! The service is great, and all the guys who work here are really cool and friendly. One of them recognizes my party because we come so often...

We've ordered the beef caparccio (so good), the vermicelli rice plate (#20), pho, and catfish clay pot. All delicious.This restaurant is my go-to!!

Their thai iced tea and Vietnamese iced coffee are both super good as well.

Highly recommend!
author: Rachel Y.

description:
Ambiance is super nice and very Vietnamese :)

They are SUPER friendly and sweet! So generous when we asked for extras on the side.

Veggie pho is yummy... However, I must note that it tastes like hu thieu. Still delicious. Similar to pho 69 in San Jose's vegetarian pho.

Noodles were really broken, but veggies were abundant and broth was really flavorful.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
The lemongrass spicy Pho was very different. I would recommend it because it was full of flavor. I thought it was going to be more like Bun Bo Hue (tomato based dark spicy beef soup), but it the broth was tangier, and not as dark or opaque. I don't think I've seen this on a typical Vietnamese menu, and that says something - either I am very imperceptive, or this is a pretty unique dish. I prefer to believe it is the latter.

The Bun was not bad, and the flavors were all there, but I wish they were more generous with the meat and toppings.

Pretty decent prices, pretty decent Vietnamese food, I plan on returning to taste the carpaccio and other dishes. As you would guess, the Vietnamese food in SF pales in comparison to SJ, but I'm just glad I don't need to venture across to the Sunset/Richmond  or risk my life in the Tenderloin for Pho now.
author: Jess C.

description:
Jasmine Garden is a treasure.

Pros: fantastic food, cleanliness, quick but friendly (!) service, great value
Cons: looking for one

Welcome to my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in SF, maybe California. Seriously, Jasmine Garden is literally one of a kind. Why? Lemme s'plain. 

First of all, the food is really really good. From the Pho to the BBQ pork, to the awesome spring rolls, all your familiar ingredients are here but in CLEAN and HIGH QUALITY forms. It's like the Whole Foods of Vietnamese restaurants. Also, unlike many Vietnamese restaurants, please feel free to order something other than Pho. May I suggest the noodles with BBQ pork or the chicken salad. 

Part of what makes Jasmine Garden great is also the service. Sure, it's ruthlessly quick like all Vietnamese restaurants, but it is able to deliver without the salty "what the hell are you going to order??" attitude. For those who don't know what I mean, this means that the server actually asks you if you like your food and doesn't shove your bill in your face when you just put your napkin on. 

To top it all off, it's in a great neighborhood (Lower Haight) and the restaurant is spic and span. I will say that the first time I went there, there was some pretty bizarre techno going on, but then the second time they had INXS playing, so we'll call that part a wash ok? 

Don't hesitate, just do it. Go to Jasmine Garden. Now.
author: Andrew C.

description: My love of Jasmine has grown strong. Their food is consistently delicious, fast, and inexpensive.
author: Carson S.

description: This place is GREAT! The fresh rolls with the peanut sauce, the papaya salad, and the clay pot dishes are all on point.
author: Bryan S.

description:
Got here at 6:30pm on a Sunday after picking a restaurant in the area that had a decent rating.

Ordered two orders of imperial rolls, which were good, and I also got the 5 spice chicken. My friends got pho and their orders came out in reasonable time, but not at the same time which was a bit odd. My dinner didn't come out and my friends began eating and I eventually flagged down a waitress and asked about my food. They said the kitchen had forgot about it and they were cooking it now.

I would've appreciated them saying something about that without me having to flag them down when my friends were 3/4 of the way through their pho. They were nice about it, but the place wasn't particularly busy so it shouldn't have happened.

The five spice chicken was good, but I didn't think it was anything special. It was served with a few veggies and a side of steamed rice. I added some sriracha to it to get a bit more spice and flavor because it felt a bit bland to me.

I might go back, but I'd definitely try out other vietnamese options first.
author: Matt B.

description: It is amazing I recommend it a lot you should really try it , And you should especially eat the Jasmin Garden Noodle Soup and also try the Imperial rolls!
author: Xrlarx X.

description: Had been looking for a long time for a good authentic and simple vietnamese food place in the area. Its perfect. The spring rolls are fresh, the broth/meat is flavorful and done exactly right. Perfect for takeout as well, very quick friendly service.
author: Lily C.

description: Pho is fine, service is ok. Nothing special but solid if craving pho.
author: Eddie K.

description:
This place has amazing pho. Some of the best in the area especially for the price. I'm also in love with the fresh coconut that you can get. It's an entire husked coconut chopped open with a straw thrown in. Absolute best coconut water ever. Beats the can every time. 

I wish I could give it 4.5 stars instead of 4 because I really really do love the food. It's not 5 stars because the service has been terrible every time I have gone. The waiters just aren't attentive and if you go, don't expect it to be a quick meal. You will be there for a while so bring a good date or a group of friends because the food is worth it!
author: N S.

description:
Pho all the way! The girlfriend and I come here for lunch/dinner all the time. We always get the pho - they're all good! Traditional Beef, Chicken, and Seafood Pho- doesn't matter. The owners are all so so nice and never forget us every time we come in. The food is delicious, authentic, and so well presented! Definitely as tasty as it looks. The neighborhood surrounding isn't the best, but you can't kick all the bums off the curbs I guess. Don't let them shy you away though, this place isn't worth missing!

Sometimes the service lacks when it's busy, but their isn't a whole lot of em on deck ever. People need more patience, it's always worth the wait. Not recommended for people who are in a huge rush.
author: Ashley F.

description: Recently discovered this place with a good San Francisco friend of mine, now I'll make it a regular stop. Kelly and her brother made us feel like family right away. I had an appetizer of crunch rolls which were fresh and delicious. The main course(seafood pho) was perfectly seasoned and full of shrimp and noodles. Impeccable service and nice atmosphere made for a perfect luncheon experience!
author: JCC L.

description:
My friend had proudly proclaimed that Jasmine Garden was her favorite place for Vietnamese in the city. Considering the bar was set high, I was doubtful in the beginning but all fears were allayed the moment we walked through the front door and took a whiff of some homely and comforting smells.

Between my friend and I, we shared garlic noodles with chicken and chicken claypot rice.(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5DeL87rp02kT8xHn1CJS1g?select=MPZPmVnMuQCr1Zd-qr6a2A)  They were both satisfying although I wished the garlic noodles were a little more garlicky. It was still delicious though. The claypot rice had a nice balance between sweet and savory and the charred rice was perfect with the thick soy. Wash all this down with a nice Tiger beer and I was one happy diner. 

I'll be back to try some pho the next time but you should also ask them for Bun during dinner becuase it's on a separate menu but it's good from what I heard from other friends who ate with us that  night.

Jasmine Garden excels at creating vietnamese comfort food. From the aromatic dishes to the tranquil ambience of the restaurant and the gentle attentive service, it's a relaxing place for a good meal with friends.
author: Jon L.

description:
This is a pho restaurant you can take a date to. Casual but nice. It's more modern and not one of those Asian places where you'll feel rushed and under-serviced. Clean and the decor is pleasant.

Food is good but slightly less than authentic. Their fresh spring rolls come in these cute little baskets. The rolls are plump and firm. The sauce is delicious! Their pho broth is more sweet than savory and less complex than it should. Good portion but doesn't look like they're trying to trade quanitity for lack of quality (and service). Eggplant with chicken was a bit bland; eggplant needs stronger flavors and the peppery sauce they used was just not enough. Comes with lots of white meat chicken juliennes and a good-size dime of steamed rice. They also plate their food so it's not just a glob of _______ on a plate.

No che.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Best Pho in SF. I have been eating here weekly since I moved to the neighborhood in 2010. Quality is always there and the price is super reasonable. Be sure to get the BBQ Pork Spring Rolls...awesome appetizer before diving into a big bowl of goodness.
author: Jesse P.

description:
Answer your pho'king phone! I don't care if it's Saturday night and it's a bit busy. It's Saturday night. 

I desperately want to like this place as it is the closest/walkable pho to my house. I've tried. I really have. For 5 years. After tonight though, I'm done. Tried to call for 30 minutes and finally decided to come in and see if I could order take-away in person. I want pho. Badly. It's been a very long day. 

25-30 minutes for pho and an order of rolls? Seriously? Fine if you're letting people order over the phone (or god forbid online), but your website is obsolete and you're not answering the phone because "it's busy."?! Hire more people. It's Saturday night. Pho takes about 5 minutes to prepare if you have the broth ready. Not 30 minutes. And I can really do without the attitude I've gotten nearly every time I've come in before this.

I don't leave bad yelp reviews unless absolutely warranted. This warranted it and I'm not coming here again. Which is a shame. Because I like pho. And I like supporting places I can walk to. 

Someone please open a pho place in Hayes valley or proximity. 

*rant over, and Chinese food ordered which is not the same as pho, but...*
author: kai k.

description: This is one of our usual go-tos. The staff is friendly. The place is clean and never packed. The food is served relatively fast. Things to get here: garlic noodles, spring rolls and egg rolls. I am surprised they have bun rieu and bon bo hue, which are my usual orders. Unfortunately, it's not the best noodle soups I've had, but it's still hearty and tasty. It doesn't have much of the pork blood and tendon, but the flavor is there at least. They also only just have the one beef pho and chicken pho. The non-soup vermicelli noodle bowls are also a good deal.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Friendly, delicious and inexpensive, really a $ place not $$, will be back again soon!

Chicken pho #15, beef spring roll#5, and fried banana with vanilla ice cream were all amazing!
author: Michael R.

description: I love the food.  There were two people there that were great.  But once the new staff came in service went down hill
author: A W.

description: Quite good. Not quite in the league of some of the best places I've been, but it sure beats the living pants off of a lot of the eateries around here. Lots of mediocre food in the Castro, but this is one of my three go-tos.
author: Sean B.

description:
I live close to Little Saigon, in the Tenderloin, so I have eaten at some of the best Vietnamese restaurants in SF. I was in the Duboce neighborhood and wanted to give Jasmine Garden a try. 
I really wanted to try their imperial rolls but they ran out at 1pm! I've never heard of such, very disappointing as most of the dishes we wanted to try had imperial rolls added. 
Ended up with calamari (not the best, skip this) and  bbq pork spring rolls (good). I had the thin beef noodle soup and hubby had the seafood noodle soup. Broth is pretty generic. They were both OK but lacked that kick we expect from pho. 
Oh and the whole time we were there not one single Asian person came in, all white people. So it's a very specific taste that caters to specific crowd. Not really my style, but service was very good. And also very good value.
author: Vol T.

description:
You know how they say not to judge a book by it's cover? Apply that saying when coming to eat at Jasmine Garden for the first time. After you jostle the  handle and push with all your might to open the door, you will find yourself in Pho'kin Heaven. 

There was a point in time where my boyfriend and I were coming here twice a week --we get  the SAME thing every time. Chicken Pho (no lettuce) for me, Jasmine Garden Pho (with rare beef on the side) for him. We have dabbled in an array of appetizers, Chicken Salad, Spring Rolls, Calamari -- all equally as delicious as the next. 

The Pho is consistent, every...single...time. Flavorful, hot, oodles of noodles, and the perfect side dish of basil, sprouts, and jalapeños to add to your liking. 

After you start coming here more often, which I promise you will after you try it once -- You'll get to know Peter, who I believe to be the owner. (He is the older gentleman with the bushy eyebrows, who will probably ignore you when you walk in -- and you'll have to get his attention in order to be seated, but he really does mean well) He'll ask you how you're doing, pat you on the back, shake your hand, and totally forget your name even if you've been there 100 times. But he'll remember your face :)

This spot, is full of regulars, so you know it's good if people are continuing to come back. Not to mention, it barely makes a dent in your wallet -- and you never leave hungry! $10 (including tip) for a ginormous bowl of noodle soup, that is a steal if you ask me!

WARM YOUR TUMMY HERE!
author: Hannah M.

description:
The food here is delicious. When the weather gets cold and foggy nothing can beat the chicken pho. The people are friendly and the food comes out fast. 

Why two stars? I choked on something sharp and *freaked out* while eating my pho after taking it to go. After forcing myself to barf to not get internal bleeding, I found woody fragments of lemon grass. If I didn't know the ingredients I would have assumed it was wood--WOOD SPLINTERS in my food. Strain that out! Use some cheese cloth to make sure it doesn't end up in people's throats. Seriously! Eat with caution here!
author: James S.

description:
This is now one of my favorite spots in the city for Vietnamese food.  Thanks to my Viet food expert, Thach N., for the recommendation!  Jasmine Garden provides the happy medium of authentic and clean cuisine.  It's the hole-in-the-wall that's not well, just a hole...

Our group ordered everything from pho to bun thit nuong to banh xeo.  I tried it all and loved it all.

The banh xeo - so crispy and hearty that it sent me back to my happy place when I visited Vietnam
Pho - really solid pho and probably one of the best I've had in the city.  Tender beef and #thatbroththo!!
Bun thit nuong - finished this up for a friend so I didn't get the full effect, but I can tell this dish was made of purse awesome. 

Would love to come back here and try their Bun Bo Hue or Bun Rieu.  :)  

Most Vietnamese restaurants have very informal service where your bowl of pho magically arrives and the server is gone!  The cherry on top of the cake of this restaurant experience is the friendly service and warm welcome.
author: Kathleen W.

description: Came here last night for dinner and the food was good.  Had the papaya salad which was really great and crunchy.  The steamed sea bass was also very good and came with glass noodles.  The garlic noodles were a little disappointing as they were pretty overcooked and mushy.  Also had the shrimp and calamari clay pot which was flavorful over rice once you drained the sauce away. It was heavy on the sodium...and too much sauce.  It was like a thick salty soup.  Overall I'd come again to try other dishes
author: Debbie L.

description: Probably the best vegan pho in the city. Service is attentive.
author: W T.

description:
Jasmine Garden was our go to spot when we lived in the Mission. The outside might seem a little plain, the awning a little faded, but don't be fooled. The food is delicious. I always got the Pho Ga, which is tasty and comes in a decently sized portion. The barbecue chicken is also flavorful, but the portion size is a little small on that dish. If you're looking for an appetizer, the imperial rolls are always nice, crispy and warm. 
The service side of things is great as well. Waitstaff was very friendly, attentive and prompt.

I highly recommend if you're looking for a great Vietnamese restaurant in the neighborhood.
author: Paul P.

description: My favorite classic vietnamese restaurant in the city. They gave me tissues while I was slurping pho with a cold.
author: Ingrid K.

description:
This is my Vietnamese go-to for over all value. What you get for the money I feel is on par with the likes of Slanted Door. Obviously there, your paying more for the location and decor. This is an awesome family run business that has even closed early to let me have a large group there one year for my birthday. The owner even got me a cake. It took me a while to be adventurous enough to walk in the door but once I did there was no turning back.  
The standard are solid but try a clay pot or whole fish to have your world rocked.
author: John W.

description:
Love this restaurant! A great date night or family place! Food is delicious and beautiful presentation! It's a family restaurant and they are as sweet as can be! Great prices as well!!  :D

Try the vermicelli, carpaccio, pho, sampler plate, Thai tea, it's all amazing!!
author: Kellie C.

description:
Planning to go to this restaurant. Called today and they said that the menu has changed.

They now only serve noodle soups and appetizers, nothing else.

Oh well. I guess I won't be coming.
author: Mango M.

description:
Great food, needs some customer service improvement. My party of 4 walked in and there were at least 3 parties of 2 ahead of us. There wasn't any kind of organization when it came to seating, the waiter called out asking "Who's next to be seated?" The table took a while to clear and when it came to our turn to be seated, the empty table for 4 was empty for 10 minutes before we were seated. 

Other than that, great food, great prices. I would come back and try more things on their menu.
author: Kawai N.

description: The service is great here and they can accommodate larger parties.  It's not grungy or dirty like some Vietnamese places and service is quick and efficient.  The food is pretty good.  I'd come back.
author: Chris L.

description: 4 stars for the imperial rolls only, super delicious!  I have to always get these, even if I'm on a diet, because they are so crispy and tasty.  Seafood noodle soup is decent here as well.
author: Wendy S.

description:
So my experience here started off quite embarrassing...it was so freakin windy and cold outside yesterday...I could not get the door open.  I had to call the restaurant...and ask for help.  Haha.  The guy walked to the door and opened it for us.  Thank goodness.  

The restaurant is hidden...but peeps obviously know about this place as it filled up pretty quickly.  Wifey wasn't feeling well so he stuck with combination pho...I ordered 5 spice chicken and a side of garlic noodles.  

Surprisingly, the pho was super tasty.  The broth wasn't so oily and the meat was plentiful...noodles weren't soggy.  Not bad...not bad at all.  The chicken?  Meh, not so great.  It sat on a bed of veggies...but it tasted mostly like stir fry to me.  The garlic noodles?  Not so great either...crustacean's and sunflower definitely have a one up on this recipe.  

The service was nonchalant...pretty much what you expect at any Asian restaurant.

I would say that I would prob come back for the pho...but I don't think it's worth the headache with the lack of parking.
author: Jen W.

description: Spicy pho and spring rolls. If you like pho and spicy, don't hesitate. It's the kind that makes you cough because of the spice but the taste is amazing. Spring rolls have a pleasant presentation with decent peanut sauce. Everything else I've tried there, like rice and chicken dish, is a bit meh.
author: Steve T.

description:
Ordered takeout here.  Both the vermicelli with chicken and imperial rolls and the BBQ pork plate were good but the ratio of starch to meat left something to be desired (seriously, it was a lot of rice).  But the meat itself was really quite good and also the spring rolls with pork were much better than ones I've had elsewhere.

Good takeout option for the neighborhood.
author: F. P.

description:
I love their pho. So good.
The owners are friendly and always greet/acknowledge us quickly. They check in regularly to see if you need anything. You can tell they're loved and have a solid customer base as on the day prior to their closing to go on vacation, people stopped in to say goodbye and wish them well (they are out of the country from 5/28/13 to approx. 7/4/13). They really do all they can to ensure you have a great meal, and it's appreciated by many. Definitely recommend. Great food and excellent service.
author: Elle W.

description: No satisfaction customer service guaranteed. I came in two days ago to order a vegetarian soup with tofu they charge me $11. Today 12/2 Friday, I came in to order the exact same thing and they charge me $14.94. I asked the cashier why that was the case, she said because you told the server you wanted to add extra vegetable. I told her that I did not tell him to add extra vegetable, that I specifically ordered vegetarian bowl with tofu, and that's what I said. She said well that's not what the server told me. Your server was wrong, and so is your approach when you insisted that that's what he said that I ordered. The cashier didn't even bother to listen to me but rather she was talking over me. I don't mind paying for my meal, but to over charged someone wrongly, and not even listen your customer, is poor judgement and extremely disappointing. To top it off, after she overcharged me for something that I didn't order, in which I paid for in full, the cashier sarcastically says have a good day! What nerves you have. The way you treat people, reflects the way you treat yourself, she was all bad. I will never come to this place again, especially because the customer service is  disappointing, unwelcoming attitude in this place, and the soup is not all that good. Next time I would suggest that you listen to your customers before you loose them... Terrible!!!
author: Génevieve T.

description:
Please excuse my lengthy review, but I feel like telling a story today.

Friend and I arrive for dinner at around 7:45pm. I try to open the door with extreme difficulty, and then attempt to bust the door open with a forceful shoulder but to no avail. A guy inside, standing nearest to the door, clearly sees my struggle and ignores me. Thanks, dude. We walk around to see if there's another entrance, and there obviously isn't, so my friend tries the door and finally gets it open. 

There's a bit of a wait, but we get seated within 5 minutes, but with no menus, so I grab a few paper menus. The waiter swings by almost immediately, grabs those away from me and plops down proper (and really nice!) menus. As my friend and I rifle through the menu, WE DON'T SEE ANY PHO. Um... I thought this was a Vietnamese restaurant? And why is it that both our neighboring tables all have noodle soups? We literally sit there for another 5 minutes reading and rereading the menu. Nothing. Finally, I scrounge up the courage to ask one of our neighbors what they ordered. That's when they tell us THERE WAS ANOTHER MENU! And that they went through the exact same struggle as we did when ordering. So I get back up, and grab the paper menus again. And like magic, the same waiter swings by as soon as I sit back down, grabs the paper out of my hand, and plops down an identical looking menu, but with completely different items inside. Why would you give me only the rice plate menu in the first place?? 

Anyway, we finally order a papaya salad to share, and I went with the bun bo hue.  The salad was super delicious, and the fresh shrimp was an extremely nice touch. Also, I loved how they put the spicy fish sauce on the side without us having to ask (especially since my friend can't handle heat). And now granted, my dish wasn't a true bun bo hue with all the bits and goodies you would normally find, and they just used the regular pho noodles, but the sliced beef was fresh, and the broth was full of flavor and nice and spicy. Very filling. 

Now the other amusing thing was, during our dinner, both our neighboring parties left and their tables were refilled with some new patrons. And both tables were also obviously wondering where the pho menu was. The couple next to us were whispering and pointing at our soups, and I heard one of them say "is there another menu?" That's when I did the neighborly (read: busybody) thing and shared our story with them. The other table didn't bother with the other menu, but I heard one of them say "what is she having?" and he wound up ordering my same dish. 

This is probably one of those had to be there moments, but overall a very amusing dinner and the food was pretty good.
author: Veronica C.

description:
Food is great, but service is terrible.  They ignore you, and just puts a bad taste in your mouth.  
If your okay getting treated like shit and wait 30 minutes and they have 6 tables open and won't sit you.... Then Enjoy!!!
author: David M.

description: Great Pho and fantastic spring rolls! Be sure to come early as the kitchen closes at 9:30 on weekdays. Great ambience, and always busy.
author: Derek L.

description:
Tell me if you can find a better Pho place in the city. Because I don't think one exists. I didn't want to review this place for a long time, just to try and keep it more of a secret, which is admittedly a silly endeavor.


My veghead girlfriend loves this place. Their veg stuff is top notch. They're legit underpriced. So I'd expect it to go up some time. You can have dinner for 2 for $20. Great great great.
author: A.J. T.

description:
Beef pho is amazing.  We also had spring rolls and the peanut sauce and everything - awesome.

They forgot my tea order but I didn't care.  We chomped down that pho like a boss.

Good stuff here
author: Jason C.

description:
Hmm... I swore I wrote a review for this before... oh well! It's so good, I don't mind writing it twice!

If you've been to Evergreen Garden on 18th and Harrison, they're related. However, I think Jasmine Garden is definitely the place you would go to get good food and a relatively good date place (probably not my first date choice).

Wait time can get pretty crazy here sometimes... came here recently on a Friday and had to wait close to an hour for a party of 3. Pho here is hands-down the best. Can get it at all times of the day... you'll have to ask for the lunch menu during dinner though if you want pho. Beef carpaccio here is good here too. Beef is sliced thinly, the nuts, the onions, basil, and fish sauce all blend nicely together. Nothing overpowers each other... each ingredient works in harmony with each other. The crunch roll is delicious too... sad that it comes with so little but its definitely tasty. It also comes in this nifty little basket. 

Been here numerous times and usually all their food is pretty good. If you're friends with the owners, they tend to hook you up or you get even better service. Unfortunately, they know my sister and not me... so... I usually only get treated nicely when I'm with her LOL. The husband cooks and the wife comes out to help wait the tables every now and then. One time I wanted to try something new and she told me to order an off the menu item... she called it "The Handsome Boy Rice plate." It wasn't bad, pretty tasty too... but I don't know if you can order that without getting a weird stare or if that was just some random item she made up and slapped a name to it.

Either way, food here is good! Service... depending on who's working the floor can be moderate to excellent. Clean and everything is presented nicely. Definitely recommend this place!!
author: Johnson S.

description:
Very good pho. We had the appetizer sampler, everything tasted good. I had the meat pho, non-spicy, with the beef broth. Added the lime, to bad no authentic chili sauce. 
Overall excellent.
author: Khaled B.

description:
*OMG the sea bass! (#35)
*Carpaccio is amazing
*All the variations of spring rolls
*Great service
*The giant screen with a Saigon kitchen....

One of my new favorite Vietnamese spots even if prices are a bit steep for me...but it's totally worth it.  It's a great place for both vegetarians and meat eaters and the presentation is esthetically pleasing: they place the spring rolls in mini baskets (very cute and appetizing) and my GF had a salad with rolls (can't remember the name) that was in an upside down martini glass with the rolls on top (you gotta see it, it's art) Anyways it's not only beautiful it's more importantly delicious.  While you wait for your food you can watch food preparation and other scenes in Saigon on the big screen, makes you wanna travel...and eat!
author: Monkey B.

description:
Are you kidding me Yelp? 4 stars?!
The food is standard, price is cheap because the place and service are pathetic.
The decor is disgustingly old and cracked - the atmosphere is quiet and awkward. The server was rude and threw our silverware around, mumbled and stumbled aimlessly.
This place is a hell to the no.
And it smelled of wet dog.
author: S. M.

description: Comes fast, tastes great! Was a wait on Sunday at 7pm but not on Wednesday night. The waiters are also courteous, which is not the stereotype of Asian restaurants.
author: Amy Y.

description:
I used to go here 2-3x a week. Now that I work further away, I still need to make it out at least once a week. 

For $9-15 a meal, this place has an absurdly high quality and incredible taste, and I've only tried the vegetarian options!

My only issue was when I got a fake meat dish - portion was small, and a big spot of rice, but $10 for a tiny slab of fake meat doesn't please a Ginger. But now that I know, I just get the good good.

Veg Pho: best I've had
Mi Sate (pan fried noodles, veg, tofu):  mmmmmmmm
Fried Calamari: whole new twist on the traditional tomato or cream sauce - best alternative calamari I've had

OK Just writing this makes me wanna go back.
author: Nicholas H.

description:
Just came from lunch here and despite being stuffed from all the food I had, I'm still dreaming about their spring rolls! What's so special you ask? Instead of the traditional shrimp stuffed inside, they have this deep fried kind of wonton wrapper in it along with the noodles and stuff you find in a regular non-fried spring roll. But that wrapper inside gives it this crunchy texture that's delish! (Anyone familiar with Brodards in Westminster?) They also serve it in this adorable basket which I love, because I'm those kind of people who thinks presentation adds to the overall taste of the dish. 

We also ordered the deep fried spring rolls -  nice and piping hot, the sour catfish soup - yummy, but definitly an acquired taste, lightly battered cod over garlic noodles - super buttery without being too heavy and the rack of lamb with salad and TOASTED RICE. I love eating the bottom of a bibimbap where the rice is slightly burnt and crunchy which is exactly what was served in this dish. The lamb was really good and I say this because I DON'T eat lamb because of that funky smell it has, but the one bite I had didn't have that taste at all! 

Overall, this place is run by a couple who is super sweet and seems to love their restaurant and their customers. I experienced excellent service and observed the wife kissing regulars on the cheek as she addressed them by their first name and the husband shaking hands with first time customers. 

Minus one star cuz it was on the pricier side for a lunch meal. ( but then again, I didn't order a bowl of pho)
author: Heather W.

description:
Greeted as soon as I came in, both servers extremely friendly and attentive. We had imperial rolls, calamari, and 15, 16, 17, 18. The fish sauce was delicious and in the sweeter side with a nice tart. As I ate, I noticed how they greeted and interacted with the other guests; they know their regulars by name as well as what orders they usually get. 

This is definitely the kind of environment for a nice friendly meal with people who make that meal delicious and enjoyable.
author: Thuy M.

description:
Had been tipped by a friend that the food here was very good. She is right.

This is one of those places where it is important to remember that you came in because you are hungry. You are not there for the gracious white gloved welcome or the jewel like setting or the deferential service. You won't find any of those here. You will find very, very good food.

I had to stop myself from ordering another beef carpaccio. The garlic noodles were sublime. When I think back, everything we ordered, and we only missed the soup, which I hear is fantastic, was excellent. The owners were both working alongside younger T-shirted young fellows, and everyone was friendly. Oh, and the Pancake...oh, yes, please, more.

Enjoy!
author: William M.

description: Awesome affordable place on the city. We ordered two plates, two appetizers, coffee and dessert for $43!!. Food was very tasty, specially the chicken clay pot! Must order imperial rolls! Will definitely come back!
author: Ibelig V.

description: Super authentic. One of my go-to spots in SF for yummy food. People who complain about the service is retarded. You think authentic places give a crap about your entitled white privilege expectations for service?
author: Nini S.

description:
Food is authentic, delicious, well-portioned, and priced very reasonably! Prices range from $6-$13 for most of their appetizers and entrees. 

    I tried the Vietnamese BBQ pork rice plate. This dish was very authentic (as far as I know..) the pork was thinly sliced and had a great flavor to it. It was also served with a side of lettuce, fresh tomato, pickled carrots and daikon, and the fish sauce for the rice. The meal was very filling and really tasty.

    My bf ordered the vermicelli bowl with BBQ pork and imperial rolls (deep fried egg rolls). The rice noodle portion was very large, but the pork portion was smaller than the pork portion I had for my rice plate. So, if you prefer more meat, I would suggest the rice plate. Both dishes were priced at $8.50. The imperial rolls were very crispy, savory, and tasty.

   We also ordered BBQ pork spring rolls as an appetizer (~$6). Two spring rolls (each cut in half) were served in little woven baskets and served with a fish sauce. I usually prefer the peanut sauce, so I requested the peanut sauce and the lady happily brought us some. This appetizer was just okay. The peanut sauce was really yummy.

Service is really wonderful! My water was refilled constantly and the staff is incredibly friendly and helpful.

The restaurant is decently sized (maybe on the smaller side), but because food comes out quite fast and service is efficient, I'm sure the wait wouldn't be too long if they had a full house. The ambiance of the restaurant is modest and homey. Overall, Jasmine Garden is a great place to grab a casual meal (or pick up to-go orders from)! This is definitely one of my favorite Vietnamese restaurants in San Francisco so far! : )

I definitely want to try other things on their menu!
author: Monica T.

description:
Their imperial rolls are great. Nicely fried and tasty. If this is your first time, get the imperial rolls!!! 

The pho was a let down. They have one size which makes no sense to me. You only get one selection for meats which is your typical combination. The bowl they have was about the size of a large so I guess $8 is worth it. 

Then I tasted the broth. It was mediocre. Nothing weird about the taste, just more watery than anything. The noodles were stuck together in a hard ball that I had to yank apart. They gave a decent amount of meats. I say decent because I've been to many better joints who were way more generous. Nothing wrong with the meats. In fact they were pretty tender and soft. 

So if you're looking for a basic place to get your pho fix, it's not a bad choice. But if you're like me who's searching for a spot you can frequent, then maybe this isn't the place for you.
author: Sean B.

description: We only tried pho and spring rolls but good food, cheap, amazing service. What else do you need?
author: Margaux M.

description:
#12 with the #14 broth (Beef pho with the lemongrass broth). That is all you need to know. 

Don't believe me? Try it yourself.
author: Mark L.

description:
I have been coming here for years.  The owner and staff are very friendly and welcoming.  They remember frequent customers which feels great.  

The pho is delicious and if you need to take it to go, it is packed perfectly.  Shrimp rolls are fresh with delicious peanut sauce.  The salmon flower rolls are an elegant treat.

Delicious food and very affordable.  Check it out!!
author: Chris E.

description:
Great Pho! The broth here is the best I've ever had. Garlic noodles are the best here too. Better then most places.

I would give 5 stars because they are so kind and the food is delish but.... Service sucks at times. 

Peter is great but he gets overwhelmed. I don't know what the lady's name is but I love her!!! I just wished there were more people during lunch to help that's all.
author: Cel Y.

description: The owner of this place is great! I love talking with him every time I come in. Food is always high quality and tasty.
author: Denise N.

description:
Rounded up from 3.5 stars.

We had...

Shaking beef. This was a nice cut of meat with a good sear that held in the juices; the only thing I would note, and this is purely personal preference, was that I wish it tasted slightly less plum saucy (and more like Bodega Bistro's, though their meat isn't as tender and there is no sear).

Bun bo hue. This was pretty good but it was a tad... sweet? Not Thai food sweet, but it just had a tinge of sweetness for every bite of salt.  I needed a lot of acid to cut through that sweet aftertaste.  I'd still come here for BBH, but it had me running to the combo beef pho to get more of a savory taste.

Combo beef pho.  I don't eat this too often, but it was pretty good.  I could've just been craving the soup after my dish, though.

Good service and clean restaurant; you pay a little more than most pho places.
author: Erika C.

description: My roommate and I went here for lunch...apparently he's a regular as he got a hug when we walked into the place.  I'm not a huge Pho fan...but he raved about it.   I have a few vegetarian options that were fantastic.   I would definitely keep this place on my list of places to take my veghead friends and guests.  attentive and friendly service here was greatly appreciated.
author: Jason F.

description:
Jasmine Garden is definitely one of the best Vietnamese restaurants in SF, just as long as you're NOT eating pho.

The Pho here has way too much cinnamon. It was like an apple cider broth. The beef slices were tough and the broth just isn't hot enough. Everything about this pho was lackluster and not even worth serving at what is otherwise an amazing Vietnamese restaurant.

-----------------------
FOOD:

Catfish Sweet & Sour Soup = 
Incredible. A perfect blend of sweet and sour that goes extremely well with white rice. 

Banh Xeo =
Crispy and flavorful, I loved this Banh Xeo.

Raw Beef Slices =
Delicious. The mixture of the cilantro, peanuts, and fish sauce made these tender raw beef slices amazing.

Chicken & Shrimp Salad =
This was okay. There wasn't much flavor in this dish -- had to drench it in fish sauce.

Shaking Beef =
The Shaking Beef here was tender, but the flavor was a bit off. It was still good, just a bit sour from the vinegar in the sauce.

Deep-Fried Shrimp w/ Garlic Noodles =
Shrimp should have been a bit more deep-fried, but the garlic noodles were EXCELLENT here. 

Sea Bass over Glass Noodle =
This dish was just okay. The sea bass was a bit TOO flaky and the glass noodles were too garlicky. It went pretty well with white rice (since there was so much pungency from the garlic), though.

Roasted Quail =
Excellent quail. It came out bursting with flames (from the Bacardi 151 that it was doused in) and had tons of flavor.

-----------------------------

Jasmine Garden is one of the more authentic Vietnamese restaurants I've been to in SF. With the serious exception of their horrible pho, Jasmine Garden is an amazing Vietnamese restaurant that will guarantee a great experience.
author: Roy C.

description:
The first time I ate here I had the Seafood Noodle Soup, which hit the spot. The broth is not like PHO broth, its lighter and more delicate. I really enjoyed it and I was happy with portions and the variety of seafood. Do not order this if you like the traditional heartier PHO broth. 

The second time I came here with a few other friends. We had the following:

-Crunch Roll
-5 Spice Chicken
-Pork Vermicelli
-Quail 
-Garlic Noodles

All 5 dishes were a HUGE HIT. The Crunch Roll was our favorite. Its great for people who like the fresh Vietnamese rolls, and for those who also enjoy fried spring rolls. The Crunch Roll is a perfect marriage of both.

As far as customer service goes, this restaurant is on top. The quail was served to us while on fire and the server handled and cut the quail in front of us at the table.

The decor inside is really inviting, low lighting with double mirror walls so the place looks larger while still being intimate. I love the blue icicle lights they have, so cute!

Definitely recommend this restaurant!
author: Lizette C.

description: This place is authentic, delicious, fast, and reasonably priced. This is my go to Sunday night dinner spot. I recommend the pho and the summer rolls. Two thumbs up!!
author: Joe M.

description: Went back and I'm still in love with this place. Wow, good Vietnamese food and I didn't have to drive out to the Sunset or the Tenderloin.  I'm thinking I'm about to become a regular. And I won't even be broke, because it's totally cheap. Yay!!!!!
author: El B.

description: I was very excited to give this place a try, since a lot of the reviews mentioned the authenticity of the food. Unfortunately, we didn't have that kind of experience with the food. My BF ordered the pho dac biet and the noodles were all in one clump, the broth was extremely salty and the meat didn't taste fresh. I ordered the bun rieu which I would rate 4 stars but the broth was very sweet. Definitely had the salt bloat afterwards so I suspect they use a ton of MSG. Still on the hunt for an authentic Vietnamese join in the Mission.
author: Chauanh D.

description:
I'm finally putting some effort into this review because the owners made that much of positive impression on me... Located near the Ralphs on market near castro.. this small restaurant is a hidden gem.. walking in it looks like any tiny asian restaurant.. clean but not fancy and really small...

My friend had yelped this place before hand and wanted to try the yumi? noodles kinda like pho but spicier.. and i didn't really know what I wanted... I asked for some recommendations and the shaking beef and sea bass were both recommended... being that im trying to be healthy i went with the bass with garlic noodles (on the dinner menu) and we shared the yume noodles (pho -like)

WOW! BEST pho like noodles ive had in SF.. Delicious broth with bok choy. and the sea bass was made to perfection.. lightly crispy on the outside.. moist and tender meat on the inside... I don't think it could have been done any better.. Price-wise it was on the steeper end but i guess 19 bucks for sea bass and noodles for dinner is reasonable... I still give this place an easy 5 star rating.. 

Will definitely come back! The owners are also extremely nice and will give their honest opinions on what to order based on what type of foods you like!
author: James H.

description: I'd say this is the best Vietnamese in SF. The beef pho was perfect; five spice chicken was also delicious; and the vietnamese coffee was super tasty! The atmosphere is clean and inviting, the staff is friendly and the prices are very decent. My new go to for Vietnamese!! Woowee:))
author: Snow G.

description: I had #18 seafood pho, and I was very very very impressed. Since my son was born 4 years ago, I no longer have time to write reviews. I have time for this one. It was that good. The shrimp was bouncy and decent sized, and there was actual regular sized scallops in the soup. It had a sprinkle of lettuce in the soup. Broth was tasty. Service friendly. It's the best pho I've had in SF.
author: Lisa F.

description:
I eat a lot of pho. It's my favorite dish at the moment. And this is some of the best I've had. 

I travel a lot and I've found a good pho joint serves a large bowl with lots of noddles and lots of beef. Almost too much of both - I'll always walk away stuffed! This place nailed it. Lots of beef- but no tendon or tripe (two cuts I always avoid) and plenty of green onion. Also the broth is great- not to potent but tasty. A tad sweet and oh so delicious. 

Cheap too. Like under $9. 

Also I ordered and they brought the food in like 2 minutes. Score. 

I knew San Fran would nail the Pho game.  Happy to report this place did not disappoint. 

Eat here. Nice vibe- not the greatest atmosphere ever but coop lighting and a nice causal dinner vibe. No ugly florescent lighting like so many Asian place often have.
author: Luke S.

description:
Ordered takeout from here last night and it was so delicious. Had a vermicelli noodle bowl with lemongrass beef and added imperial rolls. The flavors were strong and portion sizes large.

Will definitely be back!
author: Lee R.

description: I seriously LOVE this place and have been consistently going for a while. Their pho is the best in San Francisco hands down. You can always tell by a restaurant's broth, and there's is amazing. I docked them one star for service. Although they are attentive, they can also be very slow and frazzled since there are the same 3 or 4 people that are running around the restaurant to help the customers. They should also add a waitlist or a spot to add names. This area is extremely inefficient since you have to get their attention to let them know if you're first, second, third, etc. Can get confusing for someone who hasn't been there before while they're busy. Other than that, their food is delicious!
author: Tasha L.

description:
Just found out about this place and decided to check it out.  One of the few Vietnamese places near work (TL's a bit of a trek).

First impression: Friendly servers who actually smile (How many times have you gotten pho and get Mean-Mugged for no apparent reason? Or if you haven't decided your order within 30 seconds of being seated?) and very clean restaurant.  They don't leave the condiments out by default, which can actually be a good thing since it can make things messy/smelly.  If you need something, just ask and they are very accomodating.

This place is a little more "starter" Vietnamese, forks are the default, not chopsticks - the Beef Pho contains a variety of meats and if you want to edit, you pare down the selection.  It keeps the menu uncluttered unlike a lot of pho joints which will have 15 selections of pho on its menu with only minute changes (#1 Rare beef, #2 Rare beef, flank, #3 Rare beef, flank, brisket, you get the idea).  So I got the pho with everything.  The broth is a little mild, almost sweet, but I just asked for some fish sauce to make it more savory.  Wasn't the best I've had, but it was super reasonably priced considering we're in SF and they gave gigantic portions (I probably waddled back to work), I will definitely return if I have a lunchtime craving.  Again, the friendly service boosts it up a notch. 3, but leaning to 3.5.
author: Alan W.

description: Very good Pho. Good Service. Spring rolls were amazing. If your craving Pho... This is the place to go.
author: Mark F.

description: This place was a pleasant surprise I had been meaning to try. It was busy but we were seated pretty quickly. I had veggie pho and spring roll- delish. The vietnamese coffee was a nice touch too.
author: Danielle D.

description: Good pho, great price (you can get out of there for under $10 before tipping), excellent service. Best cheap eats Vietnamese in the surrounding neighborhoods.
author: Rob G.

description: Really yummy. My partner had the clay pot chicken and says 9 out of 10. I would say closer to 7 out of 10, but still very nice. Good service.
author: Scott M.

description:
Went here last night with our party of 19! Good service, Good Food, Good FUN!

 We originally reserved for 15 and they were more then happy to accommodate our extra 4 guests last minute without any trouble even though the restaurant was busy =)

Food was excellent! We started with an array of appetizers from the crunch rolls to calamari to beef carpaccio.. yummmmm 

With a party of 19, I believe we tried almost every dish on the menu for entrees.
Some of the favorites at our table were the Dancing Beef, Both Sea Bass dishes, Garlic Noodles, Chicken curry, Five Spice chicken and Garlic Butter Fried rice.. mmmm.. Mouth is practically watering as I type this hehe... 
Portions of the dishes were perfect, we even had left overs ... You really can't go wrong with any of the dishes here TRUST ME!.... We will definitely be coming back again!


Enjoy!... you can thank me later =)
author: Jared B.

description: Jasmine Garden is this tiny little shop just outside of Castro and it's perfect for a group with vegetarians and omnivores alike.  They are very flexible with making things vegetarian.  They also have plenty of meat and fish dishes.  It ranges from Quail to Beef to Tofu!
author: Amanda N.

description: I admit that I only get takeout from here, and only because I live a block away. The lady that works there (worked? haven't seen her in awhile) is absolutely adorable and so nice, but the men are a little less personable. The vegetarian pho is really, really good and has a lot of nice veggies in it (bok choy, mushrooms), and the regular beef pho is also very good. They have their takeout game down to a science, with everything packaged perfectly for you to eat at home in your pjs.
author: Amy Y.

description:
When I go to Jasmine Garden, it's definitely for no other reason than the delicious vegetarian pho with the super savory and flavorful spring onion broth. I was beginning to have a panic attack, as a new vegetarian, on how I was going to be able to eat pho! The broth is usually made by boiling several animals together with tons of delicious spices, how will I ever find a soup broth comparable? Jasmine Garden has my back. 

The service was also super friendly and inviting, the owners were lovely and would go out of their way to make sure you had the best experience. 

I also appreciated the fact that they did half orders on appetizers. I popped in here by myself and still wanted appetizers, but didn't really have the stomach or want to spend the money for a full order just for myself. Then I found out they did half orders and all was well.
author: Kim C.

description: Ordered the catfish claypot and was very disappointed.  The taste was good but the preparation was very bad - the catfish was filled with bones.  It was not filtered as one would typically expect from a claypot but rather the fish was chopped up horizontally to the spine.  Not sure why the chef would do this because it makes it almost impossible to eat without choking.
author: Amit P.

description: Right when I opened the door to Jasmine Garden, I see at least ten people waiting to be seated. It's a pretty small place, but I was willing to wait because the decor was so inviting. The lady was very friendly and always smiling. We only waited for around 30 minutes. Right away we ordered the beef carpaccio as our starter. We also ordered the dancing beef and the garlic noodles with shrimp. Everything we ordered was delicious. The carpaccio was mouth watering. The dancing beef was my favorite of the three. The flavor, the seasoning, and the tenderness of the beef was literally dancing in my mouth! The garlic noodles with shrimp was chewy with the most chopped up garlic ever. I absolutely loved it. This meal was satisfying and extremely comforting.
author: Anji W.

description:
The owners are super nice. She always remember my order. Friendly staff. Glad I work close enough to come once a week.

I enjoy their garlic noodle and hue noodle the most. Thai ice tea isn't bad either.

One of the few vietnamese restaurants that I would eat in SF.
author: Chadwick L.

description: The veggie crunch roll was the highlight of my dinner, the tofu and special crunch filling was soooooooo good!!!
author: Lillian S.

description: I'm Vietnamese so to find a place that served Viet food, I was hesitant, but to my pleasant surprise, the food was so good, we came back a 2nd time during our 5-night stay in SF. The canh chua ca (fish sour soup) was very tasty and a decent spiciness to it. The 2nd time we ordered, it was take out and was a little on the saltier side but still good. We also ordered ca kho to (clay pot fish) and, as recommended by other yelpers, the garlic noodle side dish. The 2nd time we tried it with shrimp. Food was great, service was great. Very pleased overall and happy we found a good place to eat so close to where we stayed.
author: Linh T.

description: Hidden SF gem. Can't think of a single reason they don't deserve 5 stars -especially pho the value. They are nice to you and the ambiance is cool. I don't usually opt for chicken pho, but they do it right here. Trust.
author: Micaela H.

description:
Went here because I was craving Vietnamese food and it turned out to be some of the better food I've had in the area. It helps if you know what to order :).

I'm sure the pho is fine, but I wasn't in the mood for soup.

I'm pretty sure we also got the Bun Cha Gio Thit, Ga Nuong or some variation of vermicelli noodles and meat. This is a rice noodle dish with different fried eggrolls and chicken and pork to eat with it. Also should be eaten with a little of the sauce. The rice-paper fried eggrolls are one of the things Vietnam is famous for.

I also recommend the Banh Xeo: you wrap pieces of the yellow "crepe" in the lettuce/greenery and dip it in the sauce. You really have to eat it with the sauce because it's half the flavor. (And it's also the bomb). And no, it's not made of egg. It's yellow because of turmeric. 

We also had the catfish in a clay pot (Ca Kho To) which was super yummy! It cooked perfectly and really well seasoned. Pretty self explanatory.

Fresh baby coconut, because OBVIOUSLY.

And finally, you should definitely eat family style.
author: Jackie P.

description: The crunch rolls! Yes please, more. The five spice chicken is also really good. So far still haven't found much else on the menu to love.
author: Heather R.

description: Rolls were quite good, pho and other dishes we had were alright but not great.
author: Dan L.

description:
MEAT CRACK! Get yours now! 

That's what my friends call their beef carpaccio. It's to die for! Thinly sliced beef with garlic, basil, cilantro, peanuts & fish sauce. 

There's a separate menu if you want to order pho. The broth is delicious and comes in large portions. My boyfriend loved his basil beef that came with a bit of a spicy kick.
author: Anna R.

description:
Like all my favorite Pho places, this place doesn't look like much from the outside. And sure enough, you can't judge a book by its cover! The restaurant is actually fairly quant on the inside, and the pho delicious.

We had the Jasmine Garden Taste to get started. It was a nice way to sample popular apps like imperial rolls, spring rolls, and papaya salad.

I had the #12 (beef pho) and my girlfriend had the #13 (chicken pho). Threw in some Sriracha and we were all set.

Cheap, good pho. Nothing very unique. But when that's what you're in the mood for, it's perfect. Looking forward to going back and trying more items off the menu. Including possibly (gasp) non-pho entrees!
author: Greg K.

description:
Excellent pho.  Now I am neither of Vietnamese descent, nor a food critic specializing in Vietnamese cuisine, but I do eat a LOT of pho, and try it everywhere I can find it on the menu... most of it is sub-par.  Jasmine Garden, I love.  They do a mean spring roll appetizer, too.

I could really end the review here, but it really would be criminally negligent of me to not give props to the very friendly folks who work here!
author: Vandana N.

description:
Not crowded and delicious!

CLEANLINESS: 5/5
SERVICE: 5/5
FOOD: 4/5
+ Vermicelli noodles with pork/beef.

This seems like a hidden spot in the Castro as it does not get overly crowded during lunch time! If you're craving some good Vietnamese food, this is the place to go. I always get the vermicelli noodles with pork or beef. You can also request to get both. I've also tried the pho, which is also tasty. The owners are super nice and make small talk once in a while.
author: Desmond C.

description:
I hate giving horrible reviews to a place, and usually just chalk it up to an off night, but a recent night there was exceptionally egregious. 
Service was practical non existent. Wait was over 30 minutes and there's was no waiting list or direction from the wait staff. After being seated and ordering, we waited another 50 minutes before being told that part of the kitchen staff had gone home for the night and what we ordered was no longer available. Speechless.
author: Walt S.

description: I really do like their meatball ad steak pho! Yum yum! Hits the spot every time! They have a solid broth and the noodles are good. It can be a tad loud here, but the atmosphere is still very welcoming and social.
author: Andersen Y.

description: Love this place and employees (Peter is the nicest) that work here! It's my neighborhood pho spot (and favorite place for pho in the city).
author: Jess H.

description: Best pho around! This is my go to spot. I order the chicken noodle pho - the chicken is all white meat and the broth is delicious. The imperial rolls are a must! Husband gets the spicy beef pho and he loves it! Tip: Ask for chop sticks and utensil if you need them cuz half the time they don't give them to you.
author: Kelly H.

description:
normally not a pho guy. in fact, i usually stay away from it because typically i find it kinda bland for my taste and not really too flavorful. 

but this place is different. their standard chicken pho is the best i've ever had and (from now on) the only place i think i'd order it.

standar order: shrimp spring rolls, chicken pho. perfect
author: Gordon C.

description:
My husband and I walked out of this place both saying that we did not want to return.  There are too many other choices to tolerate the horrible service we had at Jasmine Garden.  The food was good particularly my scallop and glass noodle dish, but all else wasn't anything special.

Here's my vent about the service (written live while at the restaurant):
Wow, the service is awful.  We've been sitting here forever and just asked the server to check on our imperial roll appetizer.  The guy comes back to say, "out of Imperial Roll."  Before we could ask for something else the guy had quickly walked away. Ha! And now the table next to us gets their imperial rolls. Wtf!!
10 minutes have passed, and now he comes back to say "we have imperial" after we ordered replacement BBQ pork rolls.

This was a highly frustrating dinner experience,
author: Alexis B.

description: I love this place! They have that authentic Vietnamese feel with a more clean feel to it. The staff here always make you feel like family.
