Very friendly and courteous, making sure I'm doing ok. The food is amazing. I'm Vietnamese so I know the difference between good and bad Vietnamese food.
author: Kelly N.

description: Wow. Just. Wow. I've been secretly looking for the best pho, only to be disappointed time and time again.  My search is over.  Jasmine Garden serves the best pho I have ever tasted. I tried the #15, beef in a spicy broth. Turns out, it's an award winning recipe. I immediately knew why.  Spicy the spice is perfectly balanced against the warmth of the broth. Not overwhelming, but enough to get your attention.  The beef, lean and delicious.  Perfectly pink when I immediately received my bowl, it cooked to perfection while I ate.  The waiter, a gentleman (who I think might have been the owner).  . .attentive and very proud of the #15 in particular.   If you live in SF and you crave pho. .  .do yourself a favor. . . go here.
author: Gardner H.

description:
My review may be biased because I came with Janice C who knows everyone! Our waiter, Peter, was awesome and took great care of us, stopping to chat with us about Vietnam and make sure we were okay.

We ordered the Five Spice Chicken which was slightly fatty and really flavorful, beef eggplant with onions and red peppers, a Chinese-style fish claypot soup, and the combination appetizer platter. Everything was delicious and their prices are reasonable.

They seem to be frequented by alot of regulars since the staff seems to know everyone, which is a great sign. Great find!
author: Mariela D.

description: This place is nothing to look at from the outside, but tasty, tasty food awaits in a surprisingly pleasant interior (if you can get the door open). The pho ga is awesome - super hot and comforting. The bun bo Hue is disappointing if you know what bun bo Hue is supposed to taste like, but nevertheless is a good, spicy bowl of soup. I love having Jasmine Garden in the neighborhood - take out or dine in, and the prices are great.
author: Esther C.

description:
Whoa! How did it take me so long to find out about this place? I live near by and it's become one of my favorite eateries in the neighborhood. Fresh, yummy, and a cute atmosphere. I highly recommend it! 
  My favorites are the crunch roll appetizer (SO GOOD! Always a hit with my friends) the chicken goi salad, and the Pho Dac Biet (beef). Oh yeah, and the fried banana is so amazing that they sell out sometimes.
author: Johna G.

description:
this is one of our favorite sunday lunch spots! the owners are super nice, and the atmosphere is welcoming.
The pho is amazing; easily the best i've had in the city! the broth is flavorful, and the noodles are tasty! love it here.
author: Cami J.

description:
Chicken Pho delicious! Fresh coconut water (served fresh and natural in the coconut)
Love this place!
author: LJ E.

description: Great fast service and nice servers, freshly made rolls, yummy pho (good amount of lean beef), decorative effort, and Soo good when you are taking care to avoid flu everywhere!!
author: Caroline L.

description:
Not really sure Vietnamese gets better than this.  The pho is one of the best I've ever had and the massive portion for less than $8 could be the best deal in San Francisco.

The spring rolls, fried calamari and the amazingly fresh green papaya salad were all excellent.

The whole front of house is pretty much run by two people, so things can get a bit delayed here and there, but not too bad.  Our waitress was very friendly, funny and helpful when we had questions about the menu.   You can tell that they have a huge amount of local and repeat customers since they seems to know that story of half the people who walked through the doors.
author: Chris U.

description: My husband and I like this place.  It is casual but good.  Love to start with the Banh Xeo (vietnamese crepe) - it is so good!  The crunch roll and garlic noodles are good too.  If you like clay pot dishes, they have that too.  While it is not fancy, they have decent wines by the glass.  Prices are fair, place is clean and service is friendly (helps when they get to know you).  Plus the number 37 MUNI stops right in front of their door.
author: Bryan H.

description:
Church and 14th's best kept secret.  If I didn't love the 37 so damn much, I never would have known this place is here.  And there's never a wait!  Watch people walk by on the street or wait for the bus if you sit up front.  If you sit in the main area of the restaurant, you're treated to an informative video of traditional vietnamese food and restaurants.  How can you pass this up?!

Awesome value -- expect two people to eat for under 30 dollars, with appetizer and main.

Things I recommend:
Imperial rolls (fried) or spring rolls (fresh)
Spicy Beef Pho
Garlic Noodles
Glass noodles with shrimp and scallops (I'll have a hard time not ordering this every time I go)

Pro tip: The Pho is only on the lunch menu, but all you have to do is ask.
author: Ang F.

description:
My lunch date told me this place was amazing, and so I gave this a shot! From the outside, it didn't look like anything special. Definitely a hole in a wall type of spot. The decor inside was nothing too fancy either, but that's not the point.

The papaya salad was average, with a generous portion of shrimp. 

The Vietnamese iced coffee has me wired right now.

The beef carpaccio was FREAKIN' HUGE. When the dish came, I was quite shocked. It was pretty much all prepared already, and required no more lemon sqeeuzing, mixing etc. It was GOOD.

My pho noodle soup had a generous portion of steak, which seemed to have been good quality meat. The bowl was freakin' huge! I would've probably finished everything if we didn't order 2 appetizers as well =P Broth was tasty, and bean sprouts fresh. 

I probably would've given this place a 4 star, but the service was definitely top notch for a pho place, and gave off a super friendly, warm vibe. For the hour I was in here, I saw many regulars, and even hugs being exchanged when they walked in. THAT MUST BE CUSTOMER SERVICE right there. I was very impressed with all of the people that worked here.

And that is why you get a 5 star from me :)
author: Elaine H.

description:
This place has one of the best pho's I've ever tasted. Order the spicy beef pho with lemongrass broth. You won't regret it! It does come with a bit of a kick, so you might need a Thai iced tea to wash it down.

It did take a bit long to be seated (about 15 minutes), but I suppose that's not bad by San Francisco standards. When we ate here the waitstaff was scrambling frantically to prepare for a birthday party of 12, so I feel like we did not see them at the top of their game. Looking forward to my next visit!
author: David P.

description: Uh...why does this place have such a high rating? VERY mediocre and service is slow and absent-minded. Garlic noodles, the dish that I was looking most forward to, were too soggy and soft. Sampler appetizer platter was nothing to write home about. Pho took the longest to come out and, again, nothing special. Definitely NOT the best Vietnamese place in the city.
author: Kathy L.

description:
OK food but HORRIBLE service. These people are completely incompetent. I have given this place 3 chances. This last time was one of the worst take out experiences ever, and I will not be returning.

We ordered from their dinner menu, which is from 5 pm - 9:30 pm Monday-Thursday (they are closed on Tuesday and open 5 pm - 10 pm Friday-Sunday). Being a vegetarian and seeing that vegetarians apparently go nuts for this spot I decided to go with the Crispy Egg Noodle With Seafood vegetarian version this time. I had previously tried the vegetarian pho which was mediocre. I tried substituting the shrimp, calamari, and scallops for soy chicken. They did not allow me to do this and charged me $2.50 for it, which I thought was ridiculous. My boyfriend ordered Beef Caparccio under the Pho section. The man who took our order was rude on the phone and hung up right before we asked how much it would be, without any estimated time for pickup. Several minutes later he called back informing us they were out of egg noodles. Ok...so I ordered the Vegetarian Chow Fun. However, this also came with a ton of seafood but only broccoli. My boyfriend asked if there were still veggies in this dish. He said not a lot, since my original dish had mixed vegetables we asked if we could still have that in this dish. He replied "it does come with mixed vegetables." Making sure he understood what we were asking we asked again if there would be mixed veggies. He said "That will be more money!" Ok this is ridiculous. After some convincing he finally said he would add them. 

My boyfriend went to pick up the food and brought it home. He looked at his dish which was definitely not soup. Confused, he went back to see if maybe they forgot it, luckily it was right down the street. They told him he did not order a noodle soup and that it was a mistake on their menu that they haven't changed. My bf still wanted pho so he ordered it, which came out pretty quickly. They still charged him full price for their mistake, which does not seem right. $40 spent and definitely not worth it. 

How this restaurant got 4 stars is beyond me. Bummer since this place is so close too.
author: Crystal G.

description:
What a fantastic gem near the church and dubose muni stop! The food is great and affordable, and the staff is quick and friendly.

I recommend the lemongrass soy chicken. The lemongrass really shines through in this dish.

The vegetarian soup is also a must. It comes out pipping hot and has a nice spice to it!

I'll be back!!

# Vegetarian Review
author: Eric H.

description:
If you're looking for something authentic, this place is not for you.  It's a fusion-type Vietnamese place.

Walking in to the restaurant, I was anticipating myself for a full blown Vietnamese feast.  It's really hard finding a good Vietnamese restaurant in SF.  I guess growing up in SJ (and having mom's Viet cooking) makes me spoiled. I liked the decor of the place, it's very cozy and intimate.  It's also pretty authentic, as they were playing Vietnamese music when I walked in.  They also have Vietnamese import beer, which was pretty cool.

I ordered Bun Bo Hue, and was expecting a real good bowl since I was already convinced this place was the real deal thanks to the music and Viet beer.  Then I got my bowl.  It was NOT Bun Bo Hue.  Don't let the title of the dish fool you, because my dish was not what I was expecting.  Why are the noodles so thin?  Where was the pork blood?  Pig's feet?  Why was there bo tai in it?  What da heo?!?

It looked more like Bun Rieu than Bun Bo Hue.  Not to say that it wasn't decent, which it was, I was just a bit shell shocked.

Thus to the average no Viet food connoisseur, it might look good, but just heed the warning that if you were raised on Viet food, this place might not be for you.
author: Andy V.

description: Came here to get my pho fix after a night of drinking.  I was not disappointed.  The service was great as well.
author: Richard M.

description: Girlfriend is from Saigon, and this is her favorite Vietnamese place in The City.  That is high praise.  Always great food, and the woman who I'll assume is the owner is always very friendly.  Wonderful meal whenever we go.
author: Mitori H.

description:
I came here for my birthday dinner and this place is hands down one of the best Vietnamese restaurants I've ever been to.

As soon as I walked in, I was warmly greeted by the waiters. The place is owned by a nice couple who would come out occasionally throughout our dinner to make sure everything tasted right. The interior of the space is well decorated, and there was a flat screen TV on the wall that constantly broadcasted people eating delicious Pho, which got me even hungrier than I already was.

For appetizer, we got the salmon spring rolls. The presentation was really unique and creative. They used an upside down wine glass with the rolls displayed on top and the salad covered by the glass on the bottom. The veggies were  fresh and the salmon was flavorful. 

For entree, I got the roasted crabs, which came with garlic noodles. Note that if you want to order the roasted crabs, you must call in at least the night before to make a reservation so that they can prepare it in advance. Again, the presentation of the dish was really cute. The garlic noodles were put into the shell of the body of the crab, and the legs were stacked on the side. In the middle of the place, some veggies surrounded what appeared to be an egg omelette with meat. I later found out that the meat was actually crab guts...but...doesn't matter, STILL DELICIOUS! The shells were full of flavors, as you can get a taste of all the the sauce, garlic and onions.      

For desert, I got the banana flambe. It was my first time ever having it, so I was a bit amused to see it brought out in flames. Though I had nothing to reference on, the taste of it was pretty amazing: sweet but not overwhelming, which was just the perfect desert to a tasty meal.

Great food, thoughtful presentation, and excellent service; I couldn't have asked for a better birthday dinner, THANKS!
author: Lu H.

description:
Staff are sweet but don't do a great job with managing the space in order to reduce wait times for people wanting to dine in. I recently went with a party of three. There were two parties of two in front of us. Three tables opened up at the same time: 1 two and 2 three tops. They gave the three tops to the parties of two and then made us wait another 15 minutes. Not great.

Food was fast and tasty.
author: S O.

description:
First I noticed that this is a Chinese/Vietnamese owned restaurant, which was fine, as long as the food was good. So I ordered the Bun Bo Hue(spicy Beef noodle soup) since it was a chilly day, along with a Thai iced tea. 

The Bun Bo Hue broth was good and spicy enough for my standards. However, they used the wrong noodles. They were the tiny thin noodles, while they were supposed to use the thicker noodles. They only gave like 5 thin pieces of beef that they're supposed to put in Pho. There is supposed to have beef shank, oxtail, pigs blood, and other stuff. So even though it was $7, you don't get anything but broth and noodles. 

Thai iced tea wasn't cold enough so it was blah..But the owners there were really nice.
author: Dorothy T.

description:
I have to say, this place hit the spot hands down. I am just sad to say that it isn't in my hometown, so I will probably never get the chance to eat here again unless I am in the bay area. 

We ordered their spring rolls, their vegetarian pho, and the jasmine garden chow fun special. All were amazing. It helped me to kick off the hangover that had been lingering around all day. 

Do your taste buds a favor and try their chow fun... The best I've ever had.
author: Brianna S.

description:
Castro is not necessarily the best neighborhood for food, it just does not live up to the expectations that you get from other parts of the city.

I live nearby this place (about 3 blocks) and I have probably been here more than 20 times at this point.

my recent discover is their spicy pho with lemongrass, this is a keeper. fantastic, fantastic! also their prawn dishes are excellent. 

their service can be a little bit wonky, that has been my issue with this place for a long time but now that i usually get take-outs, it doesn't bother me.
author: Sung C.

description: Had my usual pho. The broth was fantastic but the rest was sub par. The brisket and meatballs were few and far in-between.   The staff was friendly and helpful but can use a fresh wardrobe more suitable for. (Nothing fancy, newish t-shirts would due...)
author: mark S.

description:
As far as I am concerned, this is the only solid Pho option without booking it to the Sunset or a random Chinatown location. 

Jasmine garden is a big space with plenty of tables that's great for groups: Read hungover folks who need the Pho miracle cure...FAST. Service is very friendly and quick. It's clean and pleasant on the inside, despite an exterior that isn't so impressive. Give it a chance!

Great Pho Tai and imperial roles!
author: Nikki M.

description:
This used to be my go-to place for Pho or Vietnamese food.  But the service was really disappointing.  We walked in one day with a group of people, and before we even sat down, we were told that they did not have pho that day and that we would have to order other things.  We said that would be fine and continued on.  Halfway through the meal, we realize that all the tables around us were getting pho.  When we asked about it, they said some incoherent story about how the other tables weren't having real pho.

I don't know what motivated them to lie to us, but the dishonesty means that I won't be returning anytime soon... if ever.
author: Ti Z.

description: I just wanted to update and say that I am still singing high praises for this place. Not only is the food on point, you can really tell that a lot of TLC is in every dish. The owners are amazing and are always there. I fully support this place. Only legit Vietnamese spot I can say that has consistently delivered no matter what the dish. Pho, bun hue, beef dishes (ie dancing beef), chicken dishes, garlic noodles w seafood, and the list goes on. Everything on point. I love you jasmine garden. I know you love me too. So let's keep this relationship blossoming. Til I see you again...
author: Rouz E.

description:
OMG! We love this place. Kelly and her staff was wonderful! We had our office Christmas party here and it was FABULOUS!!! The food was AWESOME! Love the all the dishes that was prepared for us; garlic noodle, spring rolls, imperial rolls, the sea bass, grilled chicken, grilled beef, grilled pork served with vermicelli and veggies. Everything was so good thy some of us had came back for 3/4 serving.

I can't wait for our next get together there. See you Monday Kelly! :)
author: Michelle T.

description: Although getting through to make take out orders can be a tad frustrating as some people have commented, this is my favorite PHO in the area. Yes it's even trumped Sunflower in my book which is ok, but no longer great and I have some questions about their sanitary practices. BUT WE ARE TALKING ABOUT JASMINE GARDEN. I always go with the Pho Dac Biet and it's delicious. Another dish I very much like is Ga Ngu Vi Houng five spice chicken. five spice boneless roasted and grilled chicken served with steamed rice, lettuce, tomato, cucumber, carrot and fish sauce. Do not spill the fish sauce on yourself though it lingggers. I like this place a lot , and I think the quality of their meat is way better than Sunflower
author: Lauren V.

description: Our family's favorite for years now. Authentic, delicious food, always attentive and friendly service, and an amazing quality-to-price ratio. You can still get a delicious meal here for under $20 per person, all in. It's not the price, but the delicious dishes that bring us back here time and again, though. Must-tries: crunchy spring roll, caramelized sea bass, hot and sour shrimp soup. All three are absolute winners!
author: Tobias D.

description:
pork vermicelli:  mediocre.  I have definitely had better.  Something about it is just very flat.

salad sampler thingy:  delish!  the spring rolls were good and so were the imperial rolls.  The shrimp thing is just alright.

sizzling rice pot:  great!  the rice sizzles and crackles so its berry delicious.
author: Christine B.

description: Nice atmosphere, not one of your hole in the wall, dirty Vietnamese restaurants. I came here one night for dinner and once I opened the menu my first thought  was "man, these prices are high" and my second thought was "what the..where's the pho?!". I asked the server and he handed us the secret lunch menu where they had pho and the prices were more reasonable. They were very generous with the amount of meat they gave. Ordered a bowl of pho and a rice dish and the bill came out to be around $16.
author: Cindy A.

description: I never write reviews, but since I go here like 3 times a week it felt deserved. Hands down my favorite Vietnamese in the city. I usually go with the Beef Combo Pho, but everything here is great!
author: Tom F.

description: My friend and I were really craving soup so we stopped here after seeing 4 star reviews on yelp.  After being abruptly seated we decided to order the Pho Chay - vegetarian since we both don't eat meat.  The waiter didn't really serve us - they seemed very busy and not having much time for anything.  Our soup came and it had NO FLAVOR!  We were so disappointed, it was like a water broth with veggies and tofu.  We added as much of the sauces on the table as we could to try and make the soup taste good but even that didn't help too much.  We were both very disappointed with the soup and the service.
author: Laura G.

description:
Seafood Pho is amazing. 
My bf got the beef one he really enjoyed.
The service is great-always filling up your water and very fast with the food.

The shrimp spring rolls are a MUST have the peanut sauce is perf!
author: farah b.

description:
Seriously, people. Just pick up your goddamn phone. Think of the starving cyclists in San Francisco.

Ok, the food is pretty good, but that doesn't help when I can't get any of it. :(
author: Lina M.

description: Amazing sweet and sour catfish soup!!!  Clay pot was good.  Pho okay.  Cleanliness could be improved.
author: Julie S.

description:
Uuuummm...did I do something to the staff or something? Throughout the entire meal, I've been getting pretty shabby service, and it doesn't seem like it was directed at my table, just me. And I have no idea why. 

I didn't make any special requests. I all I wanted was pho. But they seemed to only fill up everyone else's glass of water, but mine even though mine was completely empty. They didn't come at all when I asked to place our orders. They did, however, look at me a couple times, so they at least acknowledged me..but still decided not to come and make me wait like 5-10 minutes. My bowl was also had a bit of a longer wait for some reason even though we orders pretty much the same thing. And then when I paid, they gave the receipt for me to sign to my friend. ...I'm the only Asian one at the table and I have an Asian last name. It wasn't too difficult to figure out who it is. No idea what I did, but it was completely off-putting. 

When it came down to the food, it was good. Not amazing though. But it's was a solid bowl of pho.  

I'm going to give them a benefit of a doubt that it was just all coincidences that they gave me pretty bad service. But there are so many other places in the city that will at least give me decent service. Just saying. 

If it wasn't sure the service, I would say it's worthy of 3.5 stars.
author: Justin C.

description: Excellent beef pho! Not really my crowd. Love the hip interior design. Cute tea cups and yummy Thai Ice Tea!
author: Isa M.

description:
The service was awful and the food was not cooked how I asked.

I came in and sat down and within 5 minutes the waiter came up to the table 3 times asking if I was ready to order -- even within the first minute.  I picked a dish quickly, without even getting the chance to really look through the menu (and the restaurant was empty, so there was no reason for a rush).  I got the chicken curry and asked for it to not be spicy.  It was the spiciest dish I have ever eaten, and I've been to Thailand and much of southeast Asia.  

What wasn't spicy was good, which is the ONLY reason I'm not giving this place one star.
author: Ryan S.

description: Simply put, the best Pho ever!!!!  So tasty.  Besides Philadelphia's Sang Kee, the only soup broth I could literally drink with a straw.  Plus, super cheap & super fast.  No need to even look at anything else on the menu (the vermicelli was good).  But I will be getting Pho if I'm ever fortunate enough to be back here.
author: Dan C.

description: Good pho for an even better price. This is one of the few places in SF where you can leave full only having paid $10. I got the spicy, beef pho. The beef was extremely tender! Only complaint is that the broth was a bit too spicy. Then again, I left with very clear sinuses so I guess everyone won?
author: Mike W.

description: Got a large to go order for a group of people.  The food was good but the service was testy and standoff-ish.  I particularly enjoyed the Lemongrass Beef and we had a clear noodle dish with seafood in it.  Would probably head back if in the neighborhood.
author: Scott P.

description: Probably some of the friendliest table service in the city. Great food, had the Chef's Special Clay Pot (#33) and it was pretty darn tasty. The prices aren't bad either :)
author: Kevin C.

description:
The only reason I like Jasmine Garden is because they are the closest place to my home that serves Pho and when I want Pho I usually am too lazy to walk or drive very far to get it. What really excited me was when I found them on Yelp and discovered they deliver! The Pho itself is fair and does the trick. I've definitely had more flavorful Pho, but for the price and convenience it's ok. However, after one successful delivery in the past, it seems they now don't deliver on weekdays. Funny since the last time I got it delivered it was on a Wednesday. They're also terrible at answering the phone and sometimes it's off the hook for the entire evening. Why offer delivery but limit when you do it? Lame. 

The decor inside is pretty odd. There's a huge U shaped monstrosity above half the restaurant and they tend to decorate the place with tacky cheap stuff like Mickey Mouse cut outs and stuffed animals. It cheapens the place. The music is lousy and almost unbearable. it's like an 80's asian synthesizer playing elevator music. Service is fair and they are nice, but there's definitely a standard that's missing. I understand this is a family run operation and that it's casual, but come on, have some professionalism. Deliver if you say you deliver. Answer your phone.
author: Foodie F.

description: Best chicken pho In the hood. They only get 4 stars bc it's nearly impossible to call in an order. They seem to leave their phone off the hook when it's busy. Grrr, I will still wait for the good stuff.
author: Cat O.

description:
My favorite Vietnamese food spot in the city.

Many restorative bowls of pho here have saved me on a hungover Sunday or cold summer/winter evening. 

Apparently, this is also Josie from Top Chef's favorite too. She was there on a packed Friday night and we all clapped for her, it was pretty cute. BTW, she had the beef carpaccio and the owner (who is so very sweet) gave us an order to sample. It's exquisite.

Classic pho, amazing garlic butter noodles, and my absolute favorite: BBQ Pork. Rice or vermicelli- PICK EITHER AND GET THE BBQ PORK.

Everyone who works here is so sweet and very very helpful.
author: Hillary L.

description:
It seems they took their phone off the hook. I'm sick and I can't get through and I'm craving pho!! Why are you doing this to me?! 

I'll update when I can finally get my filling of pho.
author: A S.

description: I've been here so many times, I can't believe I haven't reviewed it! If you don't want to go out to The Richmond, this is a great choice for pho. Much better quality than the pho at someplace like Sunflower. I particularly like the lemongrass pho; the broth is delicious! You never have to wait long, and they serve you quickly, for reasonable prices.
author: Denise B.

description:
Great Pho - 8.0 on the pho scale. Smells amazing!
Nice venue if a little quaint.
author: Sid R.

description: Looking for a new place to have lunch, I decided to go to this place.  I ordered the fresh spring rolls and the seafood noodle pho. Both were great - and the portion sizes were huge.  I had to take 1/2 of it to go.   The staff was very friendly, attentive, and courteous.
author: Rex C.

description:
I've avoided this place for too long and finally checked it out the other day.  From the outside it doesn't look like much and the area isn't the best, but as soon as you walk in the door you'll find a warm and comforting atmosphere.

The service is friendly and attentive.  The woman who was there (and I believe is the owner) is so friendly she seems like a long lost friend!

The food was delicious.  We started with fresh spring rolls and then moved on to three entrees for the two of us.  It was all so good we couldn't stop eating and didn't have any leftovers to bring home.

I think we've found our new favorite Vietnamese restaurant in SF!
author: Ed J.

description:
Ok, so I'm a white girl who grew up next to Little Saigon in Westminster, California.  So I know a thing or two about pho. Even though it seems like this should be common knowledge by now in the diverse and food-centric bay area, I'm still surprised at how many people don't know that pho is not pronounced "faux", it's pronounced "fuh" like, "huh".  

Now that we have that cleared up. Jasmine Garden is awesome. The first time we went there, it was on a random weeknight and the place was doing a ton of takeout business and the person answering the phone was taking orders loudly out in the eating area. Also the crazy mirrored decor and eclectic music choices were kind of off-putting. However, once we tried the food, we were hooked.  Nice fresh spring rolls, cute presentation.  

On to the pho- it's delicious. I don't always love weird meats, so I always keep it pretty simple with my pho, either chicken or beef. My favorite is actually vegetarian, but most places take a "if they want vegetarian they probably don't like any flavor whatsoever so let's just pour water over a few steamed broccoli florets and call it good" approach.  NOT the case here.  The veggie broth was flavorful and delicious, and the bowl was piled sky high with delicious veggies and tofu.  My husband's beef broth was off the hook, and my friend got one of the spicy broths that was also amazing. 

Also, you can get a coconut water drink that comes in the coconut. Don't be put off by the atmosphere, and don't be afraid to ask for the pho menu at dinner time- seems like they only put it out at lunch.
author: Kari J.

description:
Pho (jasmine garden) is pretty good. The broth is a 4, plenty of toppings and I liked that the combination pho comes with beef balls.

The spring roll wasnt my favorite (imperial) but I will comment that the service was excellent. (the waiter saw me eating the spring rolls with lettuce and brought me extra without asking, then when he saw that I stopped eating it he wrapped to-go for me before bringing my entree)
author: Cheung L.

description:
Sorry Kelly.  I meant to write sooner but didn't have time!  However, I must say this is definitely a gem in the city.  Lemon grass pho soup was the best I've ever had!  When I eat pho (or any noodle soup), I like to put lots of ingredients in it.  With this soup, I didn't have to put a dang thing with it.  It was perfect the way it was.  My only regret was that I kinda wish they gave me more though. :) The Carpacio dish was superb.  I couldn't get enough of it.  It is a must!!  The Beef Pho was also excellent.

My only (small) gripe was that the Calamari was a bit chewy but it was crisply cooked.  It would be nice to have another tangy sauce that comes with it instead of that typical sweet chili sauce, though.  (I may be biased --I'm a sauce girl and love trying new sauces on everything.) 

The restaurant can get a bit humid as it's not a big place, but everything was clean.  Service was phenomenal.  Owners Kelly and her husband, Chef David, were so engaging and hospitable to every one of their guests.  We definitely felt at home eating there.

We will go back again and again when in the mood for awesome soup or Vietnamese food.
author: Kay T.

description:
What a little gem in the Castro.
I had the lemongrass beef over vermicelli, which was the best I've had in a very long time. The beef was infused with deep flavors and prepared perfectly. The overall taste of the dish was awesome, very well-presented and proportioned. The calamari appetizer was a bit soggy, but the flavoring of the batter and dipping sauce was good. I'm assuming the oil temperature wasn't high enough during cooking. Their hu tieu hai san broth is KILLER, like... enough to bring us back like... today! Great spacious atmosphere, musical decor, and an abacus guest check holder makes for an interesting dining experience. Definitely coming back!
author: Rosavida C.

description:
I'm writing this review to make a single point -- the Pho is *extremely* meh.

A lot of people writing in here about how much they like the Pho at JG mention how cheap it is.  Yeah, it's cheap because the broth is basically bullion-based, and the rest of the ingredients are pretty much out of a box.  

I can only imagine that the folks raving about JG's Pho haven't been to PPQ, or Pho Ao Sen in Oakland, or any of the many other truly amazing Pho places in the Bay Area.  In really good Pho, you can tell how fresh the broth is by the way it smacks your lips together.  The noodles come apart easily and don't clump.  And the meat is fresh and soft.

That said, the rest of the food we had was pretty good, in particular the crepe and the garlic noodles.  And to be fair, Jasmine Garden doesn't specialize in Pho (in fact it wasn't even on the menu, we asked for it because of all the rave reviews).  So I'm not going to slam it in the rating. 

Overall, good option if you're stuck in the Castro.  But if you have a real hankering for great Vietnamese food and particularly great Pho, put a little travel time into it.
author: Matt S.

description:
Came here because we live down the block from Jasmine Garden and we heard good things on Yelp.

The place was pretty busy for a Friday evening.  We were sat down within 5 minutes, even though the place was packed.  We kept reading on yelp how good the pho is but we didn't see anything on the menu with pho on it.

After we asked the waiter if they had pho, they gave us a separate menu.  Make sure if you want pho, you ask, since they have two different menu's apparently.

We started with the spring rolls since everyone on yelp said they were so good.  They were a little bland for me and nothing really all that special.

I ended up with seafood pho and my boyfriend got the beef.  The beef was actually really good.  My seafood pho was also really good.  The noodles were very flavorful although not enough and there was nearly not enough seafood in it.  The menu said it was prawns, calamari, scallops and mussels.  All I got were 3 prawns, 3 calamari and 3 TINY scallops.  No mussels.  And for $17, I was expecting a lot of seafood at least.

None-the-less the pho was good, but left me still hungry.

3 stars because there wasn't enough food and the service sucked!  We were obviously finished and it still took 15 minutes just to get the check.

I might come back again, but not for the seafood pho.  Play it safe and get the beef.

Side note: Silly hipster girl next to us asked for "foh."  It's pronounced "fuh"
author: Kameron K.

description:
I swear on everything holy, Peninsula Vietnamese restaurants suck and customer service is non-existent. During lunch hours, they DISCONNECT their damn phones or leave them off the hook so they don't get "bothered with phone orders". I've actually witnessed this in person. Vietnamese restaurants in the East Bay would not even consider acting with such conduct because they actually CARE about returning customers. 

The food is PAR, but nothing spectacular, so the attitude, and the way in which they conduct business makes this restaurant not worth patronizing.
author: A L.

description:
The food was a solid four stars but the woman (I think she is the owner) was so warm and charming that I gave them the fifth star. She warmly greeted all the cute guy couples eating there and even hugged some who I am assuming are regulars.

We had the appetizer sampler with golden breaded shrimp that were hot and crispy, fried rolls (ditto), fresh rolls that were fresh, and a very decent papaya salad. It came with a cute trio of sauces.

My wife had the seafood pho and she gave it a ten and loved every spoonful. It was full of seafood and noodles and tofu and vegetables. 

I got the curried fried rice and I asked for it with vegetables rather than the chicken and shrimp that it came with. It was good.

Because it was lunar new year they had lots of decorations up and the owner brought over four very cute dried baby bananas for a bonus dessert. 

We will be back.
author: Marco M.

description:
Probably one of the fanciest pho places I've been to so far. That is when compared to your average pho place where almost everything is self serve (sauces, silverware, etc.) This place is all about serving you.

The decor is nice and the staff is very nice as well. We came here on a Sunday afternoon around 1pm with 12 people. They were able to accommodate us no problem. The menu is smaller than you average pho joint, but still has good dishes. I opted for the Bun Bo Hue and wanted banh pho noodles instead. The owner/boss lady told me that if i wanted. I can get the regular Dac Biet w/ Hue broth.. I was like WOW! So I got that instead. She said that they can do anything we wanted, so though the menu doesn't list much, you can alter your order as you wish. Now, depending on what you order, the waiters will bring you the correct silverware, for example if you ordered pho they bring you the chopsticks and soup spoon. Also instead of giving you a plate of bean sprouts and all that for everyone to share, they bring each person their own bowl of sprouts, basil, jalapenos and lime.

Anyways, for once the Bun Bo Hue broth was actually pretty good north of San Jose. Still it was missing the usual pigs blood and pigs feet but the broth itself was spot on (from my knowledge anyways). With all this great service and good food. My bowl was a mere $7.50!! I expected it to be like $8-$9 but not even. Pretty impressive.

I checked out the dinner menu and they have a lot of dishes that I miss. I will definitely have to try their dinner menu when I get the chance.

I am coming back here again.
author: edward k.

description:
Actually a 3.5 stars:
Come here for the Vietnamese food.  NOT for the service.

Stumbled upon here when realizing it was dinner time and my stomach was rumbling.  Located near the Safeway area in castro, this place has got the best spring rolls I've had in awhile, and they have a special they can make for you that's got fried parts in it and is oh so good.  

The flavor is big, the quality is good.. what else more? The restaurant has got a fine feel, had some asian food channel on tv which was a bit distracting since I've got ADD I can't focus on my husband, but rather keep staring at strange asian men looking like they're digging through the sand.

I don't know if I'd go back since there are many more restaurants I'd like to try in Castro if I do end up there (far from home), but I know I won't settle for bad vietnamese food anymore in the city since I can just come here!
author: Hannah W.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE! I probably frequent this place once a week and I'm pretty sure they know of me as the girl who orders "bun bo hue," since they make a comment every time I order something different. Convinced a good amount of my coworkers to eat here too haha

Not the best pho b/c I have loyalty elsewhere... but I'm seriously addicted to their bun bo hue! I'm also addicted to their customer service haha Peter & Kelly are such good people! I'm sure you'll notice it once you're there.

Anyway, their dishes are around $7-9 so not too bad... (I'm just so used to eating pho for under $4!) Imperial rolls are really good here too. Basically I've never had a bad experience here before. Everything that I have tried so far have been good. There were only one or two times that my food took awhile to come, but that was because they were super busy those days. But every other time, their service has been speedy!

I can't get over how nice they are here. One time I ordered some sort of noodle soup dish and an order of imperial rolls and Kelly came over to advise me that I didn't need to order an entire order, but a half order instead. They truly care about you!
author: Sandy M.

description: Three words: Spicy Beef Pho. I have eaten at so many different pho places in this city and this one is by FAR the best. The broth is just incredible and the meat is delicious. If I was stranded on a tropical island and got to take one thing with me, it would be unlimited quantities of this Spicy Beef Pho.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Disclaimer: I've never eaten at Jasmine Garden.

Explanation: I've tried multiple times to get delivery, and I've never succeeded.

Their Yelp information says that they deliver. Am I missing something? I've called so many times and got a busy signal or no answer all but one time.

One time, they did answer. I was so excited! I asked the guy if I could place an order for delivery and he said yes, and asked if he could put me on hold. Sure, no problem.

I waited for over 5 minutes. He never came back.

If Jasmine Garden actually does deliver and actually starts taking my order, I'm sure I'll be a loyal customer. I can never get pho-livery in this neighborhood and it's starting to break my heart.
author: Beth K.

description:
Exceeded my expectations.  Extra points for the images of Vietnam.
They have much more to offer than pho, so read the menu and if you have questions, be sure to ask them about it.
author: Charles C.

description:
VEGETARIANS:

Being a vegetarian, it's hard to find decent or even good pho.
This place has the best Veggie pho! The broth is amazing (It's vegetable), plenty of noodles and vegetables, and the tofu is best. Huge bowl, you'll be happy you got the pho.
People are great here. All family, they treat you like family as well.
author: Jeanette M.

description:
Without a doubt the worst delivery service in the city of San Francisco. I called up for delivery at 8:40pm. At 10pm I called back asking about the status of the order. I was told that it had just left and would be there soon. At 10:20pm (1 hour and 40 minutes after ordering!!) I called back to tell them to not bother and to not charge me. The same man that I had spoken to 20 minutes earlier had the audacity to tell me to be patient, the delivery girl had left 10 minutes ago. 

I am capable of cooking my own food. One of the primary reasons that I frequent restaurants order in from them is the service. Waiting an hour and forty minutes to have the staff admit to me that they had simply lied to get me off the phone earlier is clearly unacceptable. They can be assured to NEVER hear from me again.
author: Chef T.

description:
imperial rolls + chicken pho. 


i'm vietnamese and this place is on hit.
author: Leelee K.

description: Love jg and it's great for vegetarians and vegans. Ask for the vegetarian pho! It's your friend.
author: Brian K.

description:
Poorly run establishment.

The food is underwhelming. I tried branching out from the go-to pho spot, Kevin's Noodle House, which really made me appreciate Kevin and his noodles.

To-go pho: there is no cooking involved... put everything in packages and hand it to me! Having me wait 35 minutes to observe the incompetence of the proprietor and wait staff left a bad taste in my mouth.

Pho was nothing to Phone home about.  Too many good pho options in the city to waste your time at this one.
author: Phil P.

description:
This isn't the 'Gary Danko' 5-star I'm going to over-impress you in presentation, culinary chivalry, so-expensive-you-eat-here-once, stimulate your senses until you go numb kind-of 5-star restaurant. 

This is the 'I just walked into my friendly neighbors who happen to be Vietnamese, who happen to make amazing Vietnamese food, who happen to charge you barely anything to eat their amazing Vietnamese food' kind-of restaurant. 

I recently held a birthday dinner here - 14 (probably) loud, boisterous gays getting their grub on. It was my third visit here, and only 1 other person had dined here before.  Everyone walked out saying they'd go back! The wait for a group was longer than you'd find in a chain, but it's a special experience: they do bend-over backwards to accommodate your needs - you just have to ask. 

The ticket prices ranged from $8-16 so everyone walked out with a few beers down, a meal in, and only $20 out-of-pocket. I always go for the Jasmine Garden Special Clay-pot and something else to split. The clay-pot dishes are delicious! And if you like something tasty, but safe, then this is the dish for you! No joke, just walk in with an open mind and you'll walk out with a smile.
author: Andrew C.

description:
I LOVE this place.  To be honest, I've only tried the pho - the veggie and the seafood (seafood is my go to here), so this rating is based on that alone.

If you come during dinner, you'll have to ask for the pho menu - it's only on the lunch menu.

Anyway, the interior is...special.  Very cheesy neon things hanging from the ceiling, but it's somewhat endearing...since the food is so good.

The servings are huge - I always have leftovers.  A couple minutes after you order, fresh bean sprouts / jalapeno / basil are delivered to your table, and the guest of honor appears about 5 - 7 minutes later.   A huge bowl of piping hot, flavor filled broth chock full of rice noodles, prawns, scallops, calamari, and scallions.  For added flavor, dried onion comes on top.  If you're a vegetable fan like me, I'd recommend asking for added vegetables (they'll add broccoli and bok choi).  Either way though, it will be delicious.

Also - for the seafood pho, it's only $7 - $8.  Favorite Vietnamese place I've found yet!
author: Ashley M.

description: Place smells like wet dog but food tastes awesome.
author: T A.

description: Came in one night and waited in the entry way. We were completely ignored for 10 minutes. Waved down a waiter who just nodded "okay". All this time we kept staring at empty tables. After another 10 minutes waiting and watching the neglectful staff continuously walk by and other people lining up behind us we just left.
author: Pierre C.

description:
First of all: don't expect great or even consistent service. I've been there many times and no one has ever been rude to me, but service can be slow, absent-minded or just baffling. And sometimes the service is just fine. So now you know: inconsistent service, but not rude or mean service. 

But the food is really good, and consistently so. At these prices, it's totally value for money.

I get the #12 pho with the #14 broth. It's yum. It's a massive bowl and I always end up taking some home--it's really good rewarmed and with an egg thrown in to poach in that delicious liquid.

I've had one of the clay pot dishes--rice with seafood, and that was delicious too, with just the right amount of crunchy burnt bits at the bottom.

One of my favorite things is the sea bass, which they prepare "salt and pepper" style--cubed and fried--and serve with garlic noodles. Hearty, comforting, and with bold flavors love it.

It's Tuesday as I write, and they're closed, and I'm seriously bummed because all this talk is making crave their food...
author: Neha B.

description: The pho was good, but the quail was even better. The staff and owners are very friendly and attentive. I really liked the ambiance. Most Vietnamese restaurants don't put too much thought into decor, but this place is the exception.
author: M R.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in the neighborhood.  I've been eating here 2 to 4 times/month since they opened.  

My favorite entrees are the Crispy Egg Noodle with Seafood (shrimp, scallop, calamari and vegetables served in a crispy noodle "nest"), both claypot dishes (chicken with caramel and ginger; and chicken/shrimp/chinese sausage with veggies), five spice chicken (outstanding!), and the Dancing Beef.

But I think my very favorite thing on the menu is the side order of Garlic Noodles, which you can also get as an entree (entree comes with Shrimp).

The FLAMING BOWL salad the flambeed HONEY ROASTED QUAIL are great appetizers to share with a second person, actually, the Flaming Bowl is big enough for one person's dinner.  

My partner and I have tried two of their three crab signature dishes and they are excellent.  I had the Crab Salad and he had the Wok Roasted Crab.  Both were super fresh and super delicious.  In fact, we had these on our first visit and they basically sold us on Jasmine Garden forever!

I have only been here for lunch a few times (mostly dinner), but the pho (lunchtime only) is delicious.  Many dinner items are also available at lunch, but there ae separate menus for lunch and dinner.

I'm not too big on dessert (I'm always too full of garlic noodles) but I had a flambeed banana thing once and it was pretty tasty.  My partner almost always gets the sweet sticky rice with mango.  

Oh, and the Thai Iced Teas are the BEST IN TOWN.

Jasmine Garden can make a lot of their dishes vegeatarian and do so with a smile.  Service is impeccable.  The staff is so nice!  Try it today!  And spread the word.
author: Dave M.

description: woohoo - as good as Vietnamese food gets in my neighborhood, for sure. the lady here is so nice, i feel like my friend's mom is cooking for me.  Eat the imperial rolls, the pork something rolls, pho, fried rice - so far everything I have tried.
author: Wakako U.

description: What a great place. I discovered Jasmine Garden through my father-in-law. He and I split a pho soup as well as the noodle salad, and I was completely stuff and satisfied with the portion size. Kelly, one of the owners, sat with us and gave us background on all the items we ate. This was a very educational experience with a touch of wonderful hospitality. I would recommend this restaurant to anybody who likes Vietnamese food as well as someone who is trying this type of cuisine for the first time. You won't be disappointed.
author: Sam F.

description: I eat at vietnamese restaurants at least once a week and all around the Bay Area.  This place is up there with some of the best tasting food.  The pho is great and their Dancing Beef (Shaken beef) is soooo good.  While you're there, you might as well get a fresh young coconut to go with the meal...mmmm :)
author: H R.

description:
One of the most important things in the world is pho delivery. This is because pho is the Hangover Slayer, and many times I am not actually slaying a hangover as much as I am still drunk from the night before and need to get some salty fluids in me. Thank you, Jasmine Garden, for delivering unto me a steamy bowl of pho-king goodness when I am still intoxicated from the prior evening. Also, it's walking distance from me if I am feeling adventurous with my residual drunken state.

I come here a lot, but I only ever get 2 things here: the Vietnamese crepe and the beef pho. Both are GREAT. Other stuff on the menu appears tasty, but I'm so impressed by those two dishes that I can't stray.

Pluses: PHO DELIVERY!!!, reasonable prices, lovely service, handy location, speedy kitchen unless it's insanely busy.

Down sides: closed Tuesday (really?), once made a BIG peanut-containing boo-boo with my takeout order, lightly staffed on some rather busy nights. All of those are forgivable.
author: Polly Enmity P.

description: I LOVE PHO. i get my pho fix once every two weeks and this place is flavorful and cheap. service was a little lacking though since there were only two people working and it was a full house.
author: Jamie P.

description:
Lordy,

Best Pho I have ever had in the city.  If I could fill a practice dive pool with the spicy lemon-infused broth I would buy a groupon for lessons.  A cool trick here is to get the normal beef pho but substitute the broth for the aforementioned.  The spring rolls are always good while you wait for your soup.  Service is always quick and there typically isn't a wait.  I usually park in the safeway across the street because parking can be quite a bitch.  Also convenient if you need to run in and grab some heartburn medicine after dumping a garbage can full of hot sauce in your pho like it do.

Enjoy
author: Lee S.

description: A great place for dinner without breaking the bank. Their imperial rolls and carpaccio are my favorite on the menu. Haven't tried the pho but have heard it is some of the best in the city. Their dish presentation is beautiful and the atmosphere is quiet, making it an awesome date spot. The owner is incredibly friendly.
author: Candy C.

description: Ammazing food. We had raw beef salad an glass noodle and it was seriously 10/10. Enjoy!
author: nathan p.

description:
Jasmine Garden serves the most ridiculously tasty vegetarian pho.   To get veggie pho at other places, I usually have to make a special request to hold the meat and add whatever veggies are lying around back in the kitchen.  Even then, I'll likely end up with smelly meat broth, limp carrots and maybe a few slimy pieces of soft tofu.  But Jasmine Garden dares not to believe that all the world's taste buds crave meat.  They top a massive ball of rice noodles with a delicious broth that is completely meat-free (doesn't even have fish sauce!), and add fresh broccoli florets, shitake mushrooms, carrots, baby bok choy, celery, all kinds of onions and--my favorite part--fluffy, marinated, pan fried tofu.  When you add the sprouts, basil, mint, and jalepenos, it's mouth-watering glee.

The staff is also really friendly.  They have never given me any flack for ordering pho at dinner (it's only on the lunch menu) and give me lots of extra condiments when I order it to go.  

I have actually ordered other items at the Garden and they've all been pretty good.  They do a great crepe and their claypot dishes are yummy.  We had them cater a big family dinner at our home once and it was a hit with everyone.
author: Amber H.

description: The imperial rolls and bo luc lac is really good! My friend ordered the clay pot catfish, it was really good also. I would definitely come again.
author: V N.

description:
Bar none, the best Vietnamese in the City (and a crazy good value, too!)

I come here for lunch, usually.  Keep in the mind the dinner menu is completely different (more of "entrees" rather than the noodles), but you can order from the lunch menu at any time.  Just ask them.

My favorites:

- Beef carpaccio.  One of my top dishes I've eaten...anywhere.  This is a crazy dish for the $8 they charge for it.  Thin slices of raw beef, topped with chopped mint, chopped cilantro, peanut bits, and fried shallots.  Drizzled with the sweet/sour/salty goodness of fish sauce.   It's probably worthy of a $20 appetizer price at a fancier restaurant.   Order it.

- Lemongrass beef noodle soup.  Slightly spicy and very heavily flavored with lemongrass.  It's really good.

- Beef noodle soup (pho).  Also very, very good.  The broth has nuances in flavors that show that care was given in adding spices/herbs rather than the normal pho broth that most places serve.

- Bahn xeo (Vietnamese crepe).  A crispy, slightly coconutty flavored crepe filled with chicken, shrimp, veggies, bean sprouts, and some beans.  Really delicious.  I've tried it at various places, and this is the only place where the crepe itself is very delicate and not a thick soggy mess.

I don't think you can go wrong with any of their dishes here.  Super friendly service too.
author: J M.

description:
Jasmine is my local go-to for my ultimate comfort food: Pho. It is way better than Sunflower, Zadin, or Bodhi for Pho and closer than driving out to PPQ or Kevin's.

 There are 2 main types of Viet places in my book: those that do Pho well and those that do everything else well. I can't speak to the rest of the menu here and I only ever get takeout, but...

+ Jasmine Chicken Pho is perfect. None of that nasty processed white chicken or funky gristly stuff...just the good stuff here. Flavorful broth, noodles done right, generous amounts of basil + toppings.
+ BBQ pork salad rolls are fantastic.
+ Shrimp salad rolls are fresh, flavorful, and extremely well rolled.

Peter is a sweetheart and works way too much. We should save up and get the guy a vacation :).
author: Lindsay M.

description: Love this place..... The food, especially the pho, the service, the atmosphere and the prices.
author: Katherine H.

description: My new favorite Vietnamese spot in town. What the hell took me so long to try this place? From the very first bite of our imperial roll appetizer we knew we were in for a treat. Their pho is amazing, best broth in town. This place is real inexpensive, too. And the owner is super-friendly... can't wait to go back for dinner and try their bo luc lac!
author: Brett W.

description:
Ehhhh Im not sure what all the hype is

I went here with my friend because he told me it was good and cheap Vietnamese food...well it's not. I mean, the prices are OK, I suppose, but it's definitely far from the some of the best Vietnamese that I've had. 

I was going to order the spring rolls but my friend stopped me from doing so, and after the waiter left he whispered to me "they're really bad here." Uhhh not a good sign. Then 2 seconds later, the waiter comes back with this bowl of Pho and I'm like, WTF? I told him I didnt order it and it took him several minutes to realize that it wasn't the order. But I mean, the guy literally just took our order, so how could he forget? 

And then we proceeded to wait for almost 25 minutes to get our food, but it was staggered so weirdly so that my friend got his food way before mine. And I ordered #15 which was some house special something-or-other, I don't remember because it was so forgettable. But I specifically asked "Do not make it spicy. No pepper flakes or anything" And much to my annoyance, I get the food with tons of pepper...WTH guys? I ended up barely eating any of it because I have a super low spice tolerance, and the food just had too much of their sauce and the seafood in it (the muscles especially) looked really weird. Some of them were normal colored, but some looked older and weird and orange? 

If this place tickles your fancy, then go for it, my friend's dish looked really good, but mine sucked. The service was forgettable and inconsistent and I didnt enjoy it. I know of a lot of other better places...
author: Dustin H.

description:
Dear Jasmine Garden,

Broth: Good
Noodles: Plenty
Meat: Enough
Portion: Big

You are my favorite Pho place in SF. (Tip the pho is not on the dinner menu, so you may have to request a lunch menu to see it)

-Ed
author: Ed T.

description:
Great place... Super clean, reasonably priced. They even have stainless steel chop sticks.  They really take pride in their service and the food is both beautiful and yummy in my tummy! This is a great date spot.  You can get the bells and whistles without the price LOL. Garlic noodles and shrimp mmmmmmm, seafood pho mmmmmmm... can't wait to try more...

Well, I've tried more and more and this is such a sure shot that I have been twice in the same day, lunch with my co-workers then dinner with my family lol.  Me and the lunch crew already comes once a week for lunch.  I selfishly regret putting the office up on our secret spot JK, but hey Kelly and Peter deserve for their business to be thriving.  The warm welcome and super-fantastic service is a bonus because honestly the food is just that good!
author: sonia m.

description: Super friendly staff and good Pho (I took the vegie). Can't wait to try a noodle dish next time !
author: Steve G.

description:
Pretty much our favorite neighborhood spot. The food is always excellent, and it's extremely reasonably priced. Highly recommend the pho (not on the standard dinner menu - there's a separate pho menu, or just ask for whatever you want). Also can't go wrong with the crunch roll for an appetizer. 

The staff is super nice, although they're often pretty harried and service can be slow. Great for takeout (even pho - they package it very well!) as well as dining in.
author: Eliot D.

description: Best food in sf. Amazing cozy place for a date.  great presentation, friendly service, Delicious fresh food.  You will leave feeling like a million bucks!
author: Joshua D.

description: I had the seafood Pho: very good, not fishy, good portions and yummy. The papaya salad was amazing. Prices are good and it's close to the Castro.
author: Carlos L.

description:
I love pho and that's all i've had here - it was pretty good.  Full of vegetables and a broth that is different than what I've had at other Vietnamese restaurants.  

Service is okay.  Come here with an order in mind and not to make conversation.
author: Jimmie L.

description:
I love to get food to go, however....

I've called twice to order either for pickup or delivery and I can't understand a damn thing the person on the other end is saying. It's best to order in person.
author: J H.

description:
Service was quick and the food was delicious. We had the seafood pho, beef carpaccio salad and crunch rolls. They respected my request for no cilantro and even stated no cilantro each time they delivered food.

I saw bad reviews saying service was bad. Not this Saturday night.

I saw bad reviews saying it was overpriced. The pho was only $8.
author: O W.

description: I was invited to the city for a day and we stopped by this place for Pho soup.  The food took 20 minutes!  The waiter never checked in on us and never brought our appetizers.  Extremely poor service!!!!
author: Larry M.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in the neighborhood, which says a lot!  The pho is amazing, and the flaming bowl salad is delicious and fun to prepare!  This place is great, but please don't go there because it's already busy enough.  ;)
author: Susie B.

description:
Nice atmosphere, yummy and authentic food. 

I got the veggie pho... delicious broth, lots of veggies. Was a nice quiet place to have lunch and read :)

Will be back soon!
author: Judah C.

description:
This place has the best Vietnamese beef carpaccio, hands down!

Parking is a little hard to find around here, you have to stalk your potential space givers. Anyways, I came here on a weekday with a couple of my friends, the place is a fairly good size, not too big and not too small. The people who work here are really nice also, they showed us to one table, and he came back, and asked if we wanted to move next to the window, which was better! 

The food didn't take long to to come out, we each ordered different dishes, and we shared the beef carpaccio, which was the best thing out of the entire meal. I ordered pho ga (chicken pho), I thought it was pretty good. The prices are good, the service was good, the food was good, overall experience was good, because I left happy, and my stomach was happy.
author: Heather C.

description: The staff were very friendly and the food tasted good. We had chicken and seafood phö. The portions were more than generous. The down side is that they either use msg or just a ton of salt because the next morning my eyes were so puffy I had trouble opening them. There also is no wheelchair accessible bathroom. If the food wasn't so salty, I would definitely come back.
author: Rebecca K.

description:
Apparently the pho is really good. I cant eat soup unless it is cold as fuck. The weather here is to perfect, so yeah,  I must say, San Francisco has much better Asian food then NY. and now on to Jasmine Garden.
I am staying in corporate housing in the Financial district so when I saw a real Supmarket I freaked out. The Castro was almost worth the naked people for a Safeway.  
As I blindly ventured to the Safeway I found myself sitting in Vietnamese restaurant.
The food was so good.  Hot and fresh. We had those spring rolls wrapped in rice paper. There was a lot of noodles and shrimp( would have preferred tofu)so good. I got the rice noodles with imperial spring rolls.This one came with BBQ chicken which I have never seen before. So good. They were not skimping on the meat either. My Bf got some chicken dish. It was good too. Our bill was less then 30 bucks and the service was great + Safeway.











9
author: Corey Jace W.

description: The spicy lemongrass pho was perfect. Thanks Justin K!
author: Andrew K.

description: This is the best Vietnamese restaurant in the city. The pho noodle soup is awesome. I also highly recommend the 5 spice chicken. You can not go wrong with anything on the menu. Hurry up and go try!By the way,service here very friendly!
author: Craig P.

description:
We had a lunch here yesterday.......The service was terrible!!!!!!!!!!!!!
The waiter was very rude, he ignored our needs, and pointed to my $100 dollars and said that he did not have changes impolitely. I did not want to give me tips, but he could not even do the math. He gave us the changes was shorted.
The food was not that good neither, dishes were in very small size like it were Japanese food. I don't know what to say, but this is the worst restaurant that I've ever had in Calif in US. I don't think this restaurant can survivor in SF and in this area!!!!!
author: Jessie W.

description:
4.5 stars!

I dropped by this place and had a big, hot bowl of delicious vegetarian pho and spring rolls. The place is clean and service is fast and friendly.

Great value too.
author: O O.

description: OK, so the place needs a makeover in a serious way but the food is delicious.  my favorite dish is the spice beef phô, enjoy!
author: Tom O.

description:
Great pho...

Haven't tried anything else there, but the dishes I've seen waiting for my pho to go look delish as well.
author: Laura L.

description: Good food, great service, unpretentious decor, inexpensive, no unappealing music, simple. Would definitely eat again. Try the bun rieu.
author: Adrian D.

description:
I am very fond of Jasmine Garden for food and freindly staff.
I love Vietnamese food and to have a fine one in the neighborhood
is even better.
Great Pho, very tasty varied offerings, and my favorite waitperson/owner
Kelly who is worth a visit even just to have her serve you.
It is the only restaurant that has suceeded in that location in all my
time in the 'hood.
I highly recommend the restaurant
author: david p.

description: Came here so many times and in my opinion, the Chow Fun, the Crunch Roll, the  Crunchy Egg Noodle, and the beef salad were super stars. I had very good crispy calamari and sea bass with garlic noodle at the first time I came for dinner. But when I ordered the same things for lunch the next time I brought my friend here. It tasted different. So I was quite disappointed about the consistency. The Spicy Beef noodle soup didn't have the authentic flavor we expected. Service was okay. Expect to get in line for dinner time, especially toward the end if the week. Don't miss the fresh coconut juice! They will bring you a whole fresh coconut, not the canned one like most  Vietnamese restaurants do. The fried banana was good too!
author: Trang L.

description: I haven't had a bad dish here yet.  The papaya salad has just the right tangy-ness.  The beef pho has excellent broth.  The veggie pho also has excellent broth and a ton of delicious veggies.  The garlic noodles, spring rolls, calamari, and imperial rolls are also top notch.  And it's cheap.  You can't say that about many places in the city!  They usually get busy around 8:00 p.m., so if you go around then you may have to wait.
author: Johanna C.

description: Great food, passable decor and decent service. If you want pho, it's only on the lunch menu. Lunch menu is available during dinner, but you have to ask for it. Had a wide variety of food and appetizers and all were acceptable.
author: Ichor B.

description:
THANH LONG MOVE OVER!! JASMINE GARDENS IS HERE!! FOR ALL YOU CRAB LOVERS... 

OH MY!!!!! who would of thought... this place is... WONDERFUL.. . service was FANTASTIC..food was AMAZING.. 

THE DISHES THAT ARE A MUST HAVE;
*Beef Carpaccio
*Garlic Noodles with Shrimp
*Dancing Beef
*Grilled Rack of Lamb
*Salt and Pepper Seabass
Last but not least my FAVORITE!!!! 
**** The WOK ROASTED CRAB..
author: Shirl C.

description:
Service is terrible!

I ordered take out, waited a half hour, and when i arrived home found out I was given the wrong order. I tried calling but their phone line was busy. So after numerous failed attempts at calling, I was forced to walk back to the location.

When I arrived and explained what happened I was met with attitude, unconcern, and down right rudeness. They tried to blame me, indicating that I said it was my order when I went to pay. Really!?!? The order was handed to me from one of their employees who verbally confirmed it was mine and since the bag was knotted and the to go containers not visible, I took their word for it. 

In the end, since my original order was no where to be found and I was not going to wait another half hour, I asked for a refund. Reluctantly, I was refunded in cash, and when I counted it, they shorted me the change. Just what you don't want to happen after a long day at work!

I will never go back!
author: Joe G.

description:
How to describe this place? 

Cheap, relatively clean and just good enough for repeat business--- just like the men I date.

If you're on a good date get something light like the pho, if you're on a bad date, treat yo self with the white pepper garlic noodles because: 
1. They're delicious 
2. Easy on the stomach
3. Gives a subtle hint that you don't want to make out later
author: Angie O.

description: This is the default place for me when I don't know what and where I want to eat. Food quality is consistent and tasty. Staffs are very friendly. Ask for Pho menu even at dinner time.
author: R M.

description:
So after passing by this place for YEARS, I finally went here to try it. 

Starter:
Beef Carpaccio
AMAZING flavors.  with crunchy peanuts and something else (dried shrimp? fried onions?)  nevertheless you need to try this...

Main course:
5 spice chicken
great flavors and presentation

I can't believe it has taken so long for me to try this place!
author: Matt V.

description: This review is long overdue, considering I've been a regular for over a year! Jasmine Garden is a family run joint with a loyal neighborhood costumer base. The pho is among the best I've had in the city. It is well spiced, with fresh jalapenos and sprouts, loads of garlic, and lettuce leaves that add a distinct texture to the broth. I would also recommend the papaya salad. On a hot summer day, it is a crisp and refreshing treat. The setting is clean and nice, but without pretension. The owners of this establishment are incredibly personable--they know the names of half of their costumers, and I never leave without getting a handshake and a smile.
author: Sarah S.

description:
It's very rare to find a good Vietnamese restaurant in San Francisco that's outside of the Tenderloin, but Jasmine Garden was a great find. It's location makes it very hard to locate, as it's nestled in the seemingly infinite traffic jam of an intersection at Market/Church/Duboce, but once you find it, it's well worth it.

The Pho here is decent, not the best, but decent. For being outside of the Tenderloin, it gives some of those "authentic" Pho restaurants a run for their money. No Pho place in San Francisco has compared to Pho places in San Jose for me just yet, but I haven't lost hope in finding one! 

Rice plates here are okay. Nothing too fancy. Good food, good portion, good price.

And last, but not least, the appetizers here are GREAT. It's rare to find springrolls that have eggrolls wrapped INSIDE them; this is a treat found in the motherland, Vietnam, herself. Very few restaurants will do this, and Jasmin Garden does it well. If you go here for anything, go here for these!

The service here is sweet; a husband/wife duo that are always happy to serve and have small conversation. If you become a regular, they'll treat you well. Loyalty pays off here, apparently.
author: Mike N.

description:
They delivered quickly to the Mission! Yay!

Beef Pho was good; I prefer the kind with lots of random cow parts though -- this almost felt healthy, the way there was no gristle and just big strips of meat! It wasn't too MSG'y either. 

Lemongrass Beef was very tasty.

I didn't like the Imperial Rolls at all -- I'm not sure if it's because I got them delivered and so they got mushy along the way by steaming themselves in the container, or if it's the flavor themselves.
author: Dina G.

description:
We stepped in and the atmosphere was nice. Our table was set for 14, but eventually we had to add another table for additional friends. We love to EAT.

They had a good selection of beer and a small wine list. We placed an order of a lot of food. The food came pretty fast. Either that or we were all just lost in conversation. All I know was that the food didn't stay on the plates for very long. No doggie bags for us. 

Some dishes we had were: 

Imperial Roll wrapped in a spring roll - Yummo 
** this came out in a nice basket. It was the perfect presentation. 
Dancing beef - Yummo 
Fried Sea bass with the garlic noodles - Yummo 
** I didn't see this on the menu, but they suggested and it was good 
Curry Lamb - Yummo 
** The curry isn't really spicy but is over powering. 
Curry Crab - Yummo 
** The taste of the crab was lost in the curry. Still a very good dish. 
Wok Crab - Yummo ( a must have) 
Garlic Noodle - YUMMO

The price was decent, the food was delightful and our hostess was fun to talk to. Which made our expereince all the more enjoyable. This is a must try for dinner if you are around the Castro and just can't seem to think of what to eat.
author: Tyrone L.

description:
Pho: 4-star (Love it, but amount of noodles isn't enough)
Price: 4-star
Service: 3-star
Atmosphere: 3-star
Temperature: 4-star
Brightness: 3-star
Table: 3-star
Cleanness: 3-star
Bathroom: 2-star
author: Yosuke K.

description: Tried this to see if there was a little Pho I hadn't tried - had panko breaded shrimp app that was really good to start with - nice dipping sauce and perfect to get the mouth watering - Pho, however, was uninspired - good, not bad, very avg - still trying to top Turtle Tower and Quan Ngon.
author: Richard D.

description:
I love these guys, but you gotta know there are some "quirks" with delivery.
Right now I think they ONLY deliver on Friday and Saturday and even then, it will be close to an hour wait (for delivery). Also the guy on the phone doesn't speak the greatest English, nor does he have any investment in being friendly or understood. Giving up on delivery, I've walked to the restaurant for take out and I watched him take the phone off the hook  for a while (cause he can't deal with the phone). I wish I could say I saw this happen only once. 

But once you are a "regular", you will see he can be friendly under this gruff, difficult to understand exterior and his sister who does the delivery now gives me a hug every time she delivers food to me. 

Why would you put up with such a frustrating and perhaps impossible delivery process? Because so much of the food is consistently fantastic, that's why. The Pho is great, esp if you are sick and it is easily enough for two. I'm a big fan of the Dancing Beef. I've enjoyed the Spring Rolls (not good if you are allergic to shrimp though), the Five Spice Chicken and the Steam Sea Bass (much better in the restaurant).  I'm still looking for a more veggie oriented option on their menu. The Garlic Fried Rice is a bit spicy for me, but goes great with either the chicken or the beef.

I'll be back-for a while I was eating there at least once a week, so I've needed a little break. I hope this restaurant is around for a LONG time
author: stephanie s.

description:
My 5 Favorite Things About Jasmine Garden:

1. Sea bass garlic noodles...best thing ever, even as leftovers
2. Really nice staff with great service
3. Comfortable environment for groups and solo eaters
4. Metal chopsticks
5. Food TV

It's was literally so addicting I ate here two nights in a row....oink oink
author: Leslie T.

description: Pho selection is small but it is excellent.  Peter is the man!
author: Edward P.

description:
[Review by Kel]

In my opinion, one of the best places in the city for pho. Delicous broth in the pho ga. :D The soup is very clean tasting, bean sprouts are fresh and unwilted, chicken meat in the soup is the good stuff, not the left over chicken parts.

The fried rice is also delicious. Plus, prices are reasonable for the Castro.

Minus one star for the surly wait staff who gave us our check before we could order some fried ice cream for dessert.
author: Kel S.

description:
I've tried over 12 other Vietnamese restaurants in SF, and Jasmine Garden is hands down the best pho I've come across in this city. If you're not into certain cuts of meat, just ask and they're always nice enough to accommodate. Other dishes are also very tasty. 

Friendly service, and more importantly, excellent food - give it a try.
author: Ack J.

description: Amazing pho. Great service. Inexpensive  My new fave pho place!
author: Diana B.

description:
When I yelp for places to visit, like most of you, I usually go by places that a. have the most reviews and b. have the highest rating, but luckily for me, my friend convinced me to visit Jasmine Garden even though it wasn't very much yelped about. (As a side note - I feel like a lot of places that get a lot of high yep reviews - 600 and up -  get worse and worse - I happily exclude ikes, tomasso's, and delfina).

Jasmine Garden was a very pleasant surprise. I expected a brightly lit place with pink table covers, old and crusty condiment bottles and loud Vietnamese music overhead, but the dinning room had a clean, comfortable, aesthetically pleasing and inviting atmosphere. 

Wait staff was very friendly but the language barrier was definitely present - I tend to just point at menus these days anyway. 

Finally, the food was delicious - that's what its all about right? The pho and spring rolls we ordered were fresh and tasty. Presentation was, again, unexpected and unique at that price range. 

Definitely recommend it!
author: Rusty B.

description:
I love narrowing down choices and letting someone else make a decision. It's the best of both worlds. I've already picked three things I like, so no matter what you pick is a *win* for both of us. I did this last night with my buddy Jason D. I gave him the following three options:

-Sushi Time
-Jasmine Garden
-Kasa

(Clearly I was in a south and east Asian mood upon my Yelp reading)

Due to the avalanche-like weather, we chose the Vietnamese place because a huge bowl of pho sounded amazing at the time. Although we were already at Church & Market, we had to cross 15 intersections to get to the part where Jasmine is located (directly across/in front of the 37 bus stop). We walked in and grabbed a seat against the wall with the windows.

The decor is interesting. I hate using the word 'interesting' because, as my friend Peter likes to remind me, it means "less than expected." But yes, interesting suits Jasmine Garden. There's a random white cupboard-like thing that surrounds the top of the restaurant and it feels like it should have doors that open up... but it doesn't. They were playing some random new-age music but showing a video of these REALLY INTENSE female violinists. What I saw and what I heard was very clashy-clashy.
