When it came to ordering, I wanted a vermicelli bowl. I *thought* I ordered one. It had lemongrass beef and the description said "noodles, beansprouts...." and everything else that normally comes with a V-bowl. Soon as I ordered, the server asked "do you want rice with that?" 

Me: "Uhhh...no thanks" (wondering why this man wants to carb me up)
Server: "Um, are you sure?"
Me: "Yes"
Server: "You should probably get rice"
Me: (taking out the menu and pointing to what I wanted) Isn't this what I ordered?
Server: Yes... but I think you need rice
Me: Fine... I'll get some rice

Ten minutes go by and our food comes out. What do I have? A plate of beef and veggies and a side of rice. I SWEAR I ordered a V-bowl. I mean, I even pointed at it. So how did I end up with this? And why am I giving this place 3 stars? Because the food was pretty good. Sure I had my heart and freezing limbs set on one thing, but you can't help an honest mistake (on their part... I refuse to accept blame... it's a Taurus thing). 

The moral of the story? If you're in the mood for pho, but secretly want something else, come here and order the pho and enjoy whatever you get.
author: Jared S.

description:
I was sad when I moved from the Castro to SoMa, as I thought I'd never be able to enjoy Jasmine Garden again. Alas, they deliver to SoMa, quickly, I might add -- and are always so dang nice on the phone.

The Dancing Beef is great. So is the Pho Ga.

I'll eat here again and again.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
I love this place! Lets keep it simple. The food is amazing and consistent, the service is great, the prices are super cheap and they deliver!!!

Couple of my favorite dishes... spicy lemongrass beef pho, lemongrass beef salad over noodles, garlic noodles, veggie salad.
author: Paul C.

description:
Jasmine has a great atmosphere, nice decor and attentive waiters. Their Garlic noodles are a must have. The papaya salad is a pass if you really like papayas or prawns, but other than that, their pho and other soup noodle dishes are pretty good. 

This is a great place if you have large groups for lunch  because of the spacious interior and modest prices.

My regular order there is the chicken pho with a nice tall glass of thai ice tea.
author: Monlia W.

description:
I dont know how this place only has 4 stars... in short, best vietnamese food I've ever HAD SHIT YOU NOT

service was extremely kind as well, im really glad to have found it today!
author: Philip L.

description:
Welcoming my bff's niece's visit to the Bay Area again and she was missing good Vietnamese food, so her aunt remembered this place. She remembered it so well mainly for the Cold Crab and Lamb.

Cold Crab Special - damn, this dish requires 1 day advance order and we didn't know that when we got there so we can't have it, but my friend swear by it.
Rack of Lamb - tasty and moist, then finger-licking good
Beef Carpaccio - it's good and won't make you sick, but somehow from the pictures shown, our dish is lacking the jalapeno peppers
Tamarind Jumbo Prawns - sweet and sour yumminess 
Dancing Beef - moist and tasty
Garlic Noodles - delicious without the greasiness as with other places

This place really deserves 3.5 stars because I hated the interior design and the food does not match the decor at all.  The service was disoriented at times.  

I will still go back and try some other dish and the Cold Crab to look forward to.
author: Vanna S.

description: Best pho in the area! Surprisingly good broth and decent meats. No need to venture to Tenderloin/Richmond for a fix
author: Sefi K.

description:
My favorite Viet restaurant I have been to in California, if you visit SF or just live here and want a great meal at a decent price this is the place! Try their Pho its awesome and so many other favorites are there.

 Also most places need this but don't have it which is they have really nice people and nice ambiance.
author: Samuel B.

description:
Hey All,

Went to Jasmine Garden recently and all I have to say is they have the best of all tastes in the Bay Area. First off on the menu! There aren't many places around that serve those many types of dishes and still have it tastes so good. Of course everyone has their own taste buds and a taste for different types of foods so reading the negative reviews didn't make me doubt the restaurant. I had to try it for myself and I suggest the same for everyone. 

Second: When you return, I suggest you try different dishes. I definitely enjoyed the many different dishes that I have tasted for the past 6 times I have been there. Dancing Beef, Sea Bass, Garlic Noodles, Pho, Appetizers, etc... TRY IT ALL... 

Be open minded.. Thats how I am with a lot of restaurants... =D
author: Chris L.

description:
The food was great but oh. my. god. The service was horrible. At least 30 minutes passed between the time we got our appetizers to when we got the first of our three entrees.

Meanwhile other people who sat down 30 minutes after us got their food before we did and other tables that were seated when we walked in waited even longer than we did for their pho. Hello, pho takes 5 minutes to make. That's unacceptable. 

I'll come back. But I'll only give it one more shot.  The food is more authentic than Zadin (not better, just more authentic) but the service was enough to make me want to storm out.
author: Courtney N.

description:
Jasmine Garden is hands down the best Pho I've come across in this city.  Also, delivery Pho? really? unbelievable! I never thought it was possible but Jasmine Garden proved me wrong.

Bests:
Pho - vegi or rare beef (good quality meat - ask for no balls)
garlic Noodles - mmmmmmm 
fresh spring rolls - large, healthy and delicious

Delivery Pho at it's best.
They don't deliver every day - but they should.
author: A S.

description: Noodle soup when you crave it, and specialties like dancing beef and the crab are super delicious!
author: Andy K.

description: Incredible... I eat here quite often, and continue to bring new friends to check it out. The pho is fab, and the rice dishes perfect.. Siblings, Peter and Kelly run the place, and are consistently sweet no matter if they're too busy to give perfectly attentive service. That's the sitch when a little place like this gets to be as well known as it is.... ya gotta share. :)
author: Cole B.

description:
I took my husband here to have his first taste of Pho, and fulfill my pregnant craving. It was cool. Not many pho soup options. But I can't be picky because they aren't just a Pho soup restaurant. 

p.s. I hate the smell of egg on dishes, especially when they don't have egg in it. I'm pretty certain their dishes weren't cleaned well. This is what caused the egg funk. Maybe it's my preggo senses. Yuck.
author: Claudia L.

description:
Thanks to my lovely friends, Jasmine Garden has become my dining room away from home on the weekends.  Conveniently located for me around all my favorite people and places (Castro),  I do feel most like I'm at home when I'm dining here.

I've become a regular weekend customer and with a little encouragement from Kelly, I've been trying out a few dishes outside of my regular favorite (BBQ PORK - Buun Cha Gio Thit...YUM).  I've found a new dinner dish that I LOVE and it is the Grilled Rack of Lamb - Cuu Nuong).  I've also tried the Dancing Beef - Bo Luc Lac and the Garlic Noodles - Mi Toi.  If you like fish, you should try the Salt and Pepper Sea Bass.  For appetizers, my favorites are the calimari, the Imperial Rolls and the BEEF CARPACCIO (very fresh and well spiced).  On Saturday, I tried the Hue Noodle Soup...delish...  Also, there is a chicken stock soup that they have here that IS TO DIE FOR.  

I remember going on a Friday evening and there was quite a crowd.  So, it may help to call ahead to see what the seating situation is like.  If you go during LUNCH or early dinner, you may actually get to meet Kelly and you'll understand WHY I go there so often with my friends.  She's the BEST!!!
author: Hiromi N.

description:
I think I can say the worst service I have ever had in a San Francisco restaurant. Staff was very unattentive and somewhat rude any time we had a question. I nearly had to stand up and hold my arms out in front of the waiter to ask him to take our order. Same for them to bring us the check. 

Food was decent though. Location is super convenient.  Price wasn't the cheapest though. There's just as good Vietnamese food in the Duboce Triangle area for a cheaper price and better service.
author: Stu C.

description: 4 stars for being the best Vietnamese in the vicinity of the Lower Haight/ Divisadero/ Alamo Square area. Other than Thai, there are not a lot of Asian options. When we don't want to trek to the TL or the Avenues, the pho from Jasmine Garden's lunch menu is a good option. Thankfully, they offer this at dinner as well as the cold vermicelli with grilled pork (bun thit nuong). Everything is reasonably priced as well.
author: Mimi L.

description:
Had an awesome lunch at Jasmine Garden yesterday and tried this AMAZING new special that was not on the menu... mini Vietnamese cupcakes  [see attached photo] -- this is not a dessert, but an appetizer that will explode of flavor in your mouth! Yummm!!!... :)

You can NEVER go wrong having lunch or dinner at Jasmine Garden.. Every time I have someone visit from out of town, I take them to this wonderful Vietnamese restaurant and Jasmine Garden NEVER lets me down... every item on the menu is great! 

And they serve pho ALL day!

The chef is an artist when it comes to vietnamese food.. some of the items have a Thai influence, but it definitely has a vietnamese style taste! Yummmmmmy!! :)

Lastly.. the service is great and very friendly... always with a smile! Such NICE people and wonderful food!
author: Bob V.

description: In love with this place, so good. Get the garlic noodles, fried calamari & salt & pepper garlic shrimp dishes, amazing!!
author: Luisa L.

description:
Seems like the recent reviews indicating a fairly downhill trend might be accurate.

Went here Tuesday night. The BBQ Pork spring/imperial rolls were delicious, and innovative. The lamb curry was very good, except there were three fatty/boney pieces of lamb which I was not happy about.

This restaurant also seems to have a bit of an identity crisis...it's much nicer (and pricier) than Tu Lan or other hole-in-the-wall joints, but not quite on the level of some of the more upscale places...if they're going to use organic ingredients, they should be more upfront about it.

The presentations of the dishes are absolutely stunning, but they need to fix a few things to make the rest of the experience comparable to that.

I'm also hoping the tub of I Can't Believe It's Not Butter that I saw in the kitchen was just being used for storage and that it didn't actually contain any....
author: Mark A.

description:
REDUX! . . . ( but no duck on the menu).

Old restaurant buddy & connoisseur & I needed a wok-baked crab and tamarind prawns fix last Friday after work, so we made a beeline here, arriving before 6 p.m. to beat the crowd.  -abundant parking just a block away.

 -stepping  into the same tasteful Continental interior, banquette like welcoming embracing arms, flat-screen playing the food video of Ho Chi Minh City open-air eateries of a food zone . . . lilting club music & alternating light classical in the air,  we were -

- Greeted by 2 hospitable young men in logo T shirts, Mr & Mrs (owner/operators) were already table hopping with seated customers. We had our choice of seating along the right banquette.  Before opening the menu, we requested the crab -not available today . . .  MAJOR disappointment.  OK, ordering as appetizers the Tamarind prawns and the new soft roll with crispy bbq pork, to give us menu time, were told that the Tamarind prawns were also not available.  -now borderline crisis mode/ trine not to make a scene, we opened the menu  to peruse for entrees to complete our dinner, expertly guided by my favorite waiter, the pepper prawns replacing the Tamarind.  .  .
Dancing Beef, 5 Spice Chicken & Double order of the garlic noodles.  No rice?  No rice.
Expecting the dry-fried peppered prawns, we were pleasantly surprised to see a dozen rolled in a spicy concoction of "rub" atop a bed of garlic noodles, savoring the seasoning, head-to-tail, the sweetness of the carapace of each prawn.  My buddy gave me all his because he doesn't do heads.
Dancing beef  came 'salad' style, perfect little cubes of 'filet' on a bed of fancy greens, tossed in a just-right vinaigrette.

Five spice chicken, the Vietnamese classic, had its own special secret flavor twist, nestled atop green beans.

Garlic noodles were excellent, "goes without saying", also having its subtle added note of seasoning, setting it apart from other restaurants'

Vietnamese beer '33', Iced coffee, bottomless lemon water . . .

Dessert!  their feather-light fried bananas alongside sumptuous toasted coconut ice cream.

  -Our waiter & host asking after us no less than 7 times during the course of our dining. The place was humming when were 1/2 way thru ours.

Remember to call ahead for that crab next time!
author: Clifford L.

description:
I wish I could give this place 2.85 stars.  I realize that I am a hard critic when it comes to Vietnamese food given the fact that I grew up in Southern California - in the heart of Little Saigon - eating Vietnamese food every single day.  Of course everything fails in comparison to the home-cooked meals that I get when I'm home-home, so although I expect quality/authentic food, I do leave some wiggle room.

With that said, I've been on the hunt for good/decent Vietnamese food in San Francisco.  I was craving the claypot catfish and the hot and sour soup also with catfish, but our waiter said they were all out!  What the heck???  No more catfish??  Ok, I'll be flexible and try something else.  Italian boy and I ended up ordering fresh spring rolls, hot and sour soup with shrimp and the lemongrass chicken.

fresh spring rolls ($6.50) - it comes with two spring rolls cut in half, so you get 4 pieces.  Overpriced for two spring rolls if you ask me!  It met the spring roll standards in terms of taste/quality, so fine I will pay more for spring rolls given this is San Francisco.

hot and sour soup with shrimp - it was yummy, but a tad too sweet.  this soup generally isn't supposed to be that sweet.  the shrimp was nice and plump and juicy.  lots of bean sprouts, couple of pieces of pineapple and tomatoes, etc.

lemongrass chicken - too sweet and overcooked.  i'd pass on this dish if I were you.

My general impression of this place is that it's not the typical Vietnamese restaurant in terms of presentation.  I give them extra points for trying to make Vietnamese food look classy.  However, the amount of time it took our food to come out was subpar.  Spring rolls came out rather quickly then came the soup then it took foreeeeeeever for the last dish to come out.  I was full off of soup by the time our main entree came out.

Needless to say, I will not be a repeat customer.  The hunt continues...
author: Lynda N.

description:
I was puzzled the past several times I've been here because they have a neon "Pho" sign in the window, but there is no pho anywhere on the menu!  Turns out, it is on the lunch menu, which you can still request during dinner time if that is what you want.  Good to know.

I ordered the Hue noodle soup (Bun Bo Hue), which is somewhat of a risk, but I hadn't had it in a really long time.  Plus my past experiences here (with their sour soup and claypot catfish -- both extremely authentic) gave me more faith.  But I really should've ordered something else.  The Hue noodle soup here is basically just their pho in a different broth (that has way too much lemongrass in it btw).  The noodles are the wrong type and it just has the regular pho meat, not the stuff that should be in bun bo hue.  Alas.

I took 1 star away, but I will still come back to this place because the other food I've had here has been quite good.  Should probably just stick to the pho next time I'm in the mood for noodle soup, which was what everybody around me was getting and looked pretty good.  And if you haven't already, you really need to try their catfish claypot and sour soup.
author: Leslie L.

description: Been here quite a few times now. And, the place is amazing. Imperial rolls are fresh and the shaken beef is super lovely.They show vietnamese cooking shows...awesome! The service can be odd at times.
author: Joe G.

description: I was there with a couple of friends. The shrimp spring rolls were yummy, maybe because of the sauce. Later we were all surprised by the flaming beef, rolled with vegs, mint leaves and rice paper. Not to mention that the beef was on fire when they serve the dish. Finally the dancing beef kinda sealed the deal, before we weren't sure to order beef twice but we weren't wrong. The crispy stuff and marinated beef they have is sure delicious.
author: Hung D.

description:
With all the Viet's restaurants in the bay area, this place suck!
Food tasted bland and artificial. 
It is expensive as well. 
Don't bother.
author: Derek S.

description:
A hidden gem....I hope I don't regret writing a review for this place (for fear I will one day have to wait for a table).

I've been eating Pho all my life and this is now my go-to Pho place. I am a loyal PPQ fan since i've been a patron there for over 10 years but after trying Jasmin Garden....PPQ is now 2nd on my list. *gasp*

First of all Jasmin Garden is really clean. They have glass tops over their white table cloth and individual place settings. I don't even wipe down my utensils, plate, or cup (like i usually do at other asian restaraunts).  The two times I've been here, i never had to wait. It's usually not busy which is the strange thing for being such a great restaraunt.

Jasmin Garden is not a noodle house or strictly Pho restaurant. They are a vietnamese restaraunt so most of their items are entrees that you can share family style. However, their lunch menu has a small section for noodle soup and this where my obsession with their beef pho began.

Service is excellent. The lady (owner? maitre d? hostess?) is really sweet. I see her mingling with other customers and really chatting them up, recommending good dishes. The customers seem to really like her. The waiter is swift and refills my water often. He is friendly but usually  a man of few words. 

The two times my husband I and have been here we were the only Asian patrons. Just something I noticed but it didn't bother us nor did we receive any lesser service.  

Two dishes you must have: the beef Pho and Imperial Rolls. I cannot rave enough about both. They are absolutely delicious.  I even drink the soup after I finish my noodles. A first for me since i'm paranoid about polluting my body with msg. 

They also have garlic noodle. It's pretty good but you can really taste the butter. The five spice chicken is good but not amazing. They also have this spicy noodle soup that my husband tried but I still think the Pho is better.

Price is cheap/moderate. I think my pho was like $7 and the imperial rolls were $6.

Just come for the beef Pho and the imperial rolls. You won't regret it.
author: Terry D.

description: Went here with two friends and ordered salmon. It had a nice amount of spice and was pan fried. Yum. My friends got stir fry dishes and liked it. This place is a solid dinner spot if you like Vietnamese food. I won't go out of my way to go back, but it was a nice dinner.
author: Rachel S.

description:
First of all. I work in the medium end and high end restaurant in sf so I know that there are times that the food take a long time for whatever reason BUT OH MY GOD! This must be the loooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooongest time that I have to wait for my food in my entire life. It's ridiculous considering how busy they were cuz you would think that they would try to get the food out as fast as they can and turn the table for new customers but nope,not what they are doing here @ Jasmine garden

We ordered garlic noodle with shrimp and steamed sea bass. We waited at least half an hour before the garlic noodle arrived. Guess what? we already finished the noodle and our sea bass is no where to be seen. I had to ask our waiter if our sea bass was coming. We waited for another good 15 mins til we got our fish and another 5 mins for jasmine rice. No joke, the stop watch on my iphone never lie. 

I know it's a family business. I know they know their foods are good and people keep coming back for the foods, of course not for the service but still!

The funny thing of eating here is when I asked for the check. U think it would probably take another forever, WRONG! it's presented right in front of my face in less than 5 seconds! Now that's impressive! Wish they can bring the food out as fast as they bring me a check.

2 star for garlic noodle shirmp+sea bass and 1 star for best jasmine rice I ever had!
author: Joey P.

description: I actually like the food here, but the service I got this last trip makes me never want to go back again. I ordered take out and showed up when they said the food would be ready. I ended up waiting (patiently) for an additional 40 minutes. The host was unapologetic and even told me that I shouldn't have called after 7 PM for takeout. I told him he was the one that told me what time to come. He refused to take any responsibility and told me there was no way he could offer me a discount. My impression of this place went from 4 stars to 1 star.
author: R P.

description:
I LOVE this place. I'm a total regular. Here is why. 

BEST vegetarian pho in the city, hands down! 

I get the vegetarian pho with a side of the spicy lemongrass sauce to put in it. It is the tastiest veggie pho I've ever had and it's packed with veggies like mushrooms, bok choy, carrots, broccoli, fresh cilantro, and tofu. They also have a delicious lemon grass tofu over vermicelli (over rice on the menu). It comes with crushed peanuts and a salad on the bottom. The ingredients are fresh, always, and the service is great. I love the people who work there, especially the woman server (i think she may be one of the owners?) who always remembers me and is really warm and speedy. It's also cheap! I always walk out with a full belly and feel surprised at how little money it is. I highly recommend this spot- they also deliver!

Negatives: not organic, if someone knows of an organic pho spot-please let me know!
author: Lina M.

description:
Love everything on the menu. There are some things if you go often enough the owner will recommend to you. They are a small family run business, but there is no shortage of smiles and wonderful, delicious, and fresh food. 

You have to try their raw beef appetizer it is sooooo good.
author: Angela W.

description:
When it comes to Vietnamese food I've been stuck in a rut,every time It's either Bahn mi or Pho. I felt like trying something different.

I called Jasmine Garden and asked them to bring me their best stuff up to their $20 delivery minimum. I didn't really understand what he was saying so I just said yes to everything. For $22 not including tip I got imperial rolls, beef pho, and a delicious pork dish. I'd order that pork all the time if I knew what it was called.

I am no expert on Vietnamese food and have no idea if this place is authentic but I can say that I really enjoyed their food.
author: Manny F.

description:
I was very pleases with my experienced last night!  The service, oh so friendly, ambiance, lovely... dinner was excellent, with a fake chicken eggplant thing, firm delicious rolls, and topped off with fried banana..

Did I mention the service was great?  I even got a hug on my way out - i'll be back for seconds.
author: Tim D.

description: The vegetarian pho here is delicious as far as San Francisco is concerned.  A great vegan option for those needing to go out with friends.  All of the meat based dishes look great from what I see.
author: Nate W.

description:
First time trying this place, and now surprised by its 4 star ranking here.  So I might give it another try in the future.  But my buddy and I weren't terribly impressed.

We tried the papaya salad with prawns.  The dressing was very good, but the prawns were pretty bland.  Not sure they were fresh. 

The other dish was 5 Spice Chicken, but as my friend stated, "More like 1 spice!"  Fairly over cooked.  

I'll try some Pho next time and see how that goes.  The service was great though!  Very cute buff waiter, yum!
author: Bryan L.

description: I am writing this while waiting 30 min to get y check after asking. And that's after waiting at least 45 minutes for our food. I won't be coming back unless I feel like sitting all night.
author: Berl Q.

description:
At first this place let me down.  I was so excited for Vietnamese by my house that I insisted we go here, a lot. the food was mediocre.  But...lately it has been stellar.  Went here on a double date about a month ago and the food was so good that we literally ate, everything.  Like scraping the last bits off of the plate everything. 

Then, I ordered this for delivery Sunday night...at like 5:30.  Perhaps it was the early order, but my food arrived piping HOT and super duper good. I had the dancing beef (yum! worth the $14) and the 5 spice chicken, again YUM and the garlic noodles sans shrimp.  This had been the recommendation when we ordered in the restaurant and they were goood goood good.  

If you are a local, they will deliver, they did give me a bit of a run around at first when they didn't realize I was a stones throw away.  Eventually we worked it out and they were there...fast!  Anyway, highly recommended, but stick with the tried and true dishes (like the ones I am recommending) some of the other things we have had here have fell flat...
author: Claire C.

description: Delicious veggie pho & exciting appetizer trays make me want to come back... but we were super gassy afterwords so only three stars.
author: jizzie b.

description:
I was underwhelmed.

I went there for dinner at 9pm on a Saturday night and it was completely empty. Better than having to wait, but it made the place pretty uncomfortable (and cold). We had the full attention of the waiter and the service was fine, although they refilled our water after every other sip, which I found unnecessary and annoying. Also, despite being the only guests at the time, our entrees were served 10 minutes apart.

Food: We got spring rolls, the lemongrass beef and the five spice chicken. The entrees were meat-heavy and disappointing. Both came with only a minimal amount of vegetables (like, 4 green beans, 3 mushroom halves). Portions were on the smaller side, and for the quality of the food I felt the place was too expensive (we ended up with a $30 bill without drinks).

I can't judge how "authentic" the food was, since I don't have much experience with Vietnamese. No pho on the dinner menu - maybe it's more of a lunch thing?

I won't be coming back. The food certainly did't deserve the 4 Yelp stars we came for.
author: Carter D.

description:
I really like this place!
I've only had the delivery,
but I will definitely be going in to eat soon.
I think the, seafood in a hot iron plate, 
just wouldn't be the same if I had it delivered? :)

The delivery is always VERY fast..maybe 20 minutes!

Favorite Dish: Vegetarian Pho!!! It's filled with veggies (carrots, baby bok choy, mushrooms) and it has fried tofu in it too. YUM!

Special Mention: Garlic Noodles & Crispy Calamari
author: Linz H.

description:
My husband and I visited this joint for lunch and dinner in 2 separate occasions and were pleasantly surprised by the cleasiness, service, and food quality.  It has more of a modern feel than typically Asian pho places but not over the top upscale.  Definately tops sunflower in terms of ambiance though.  From where we sat, I can see the kitchen which appears bright and clean.

We enjoyed the pork spring rolls, noodle soups, and especially the Flaming Bowl I tried this evening.  When the dish arrived, it had light blue flames going off from the bottom of the bowl and our waiter used a pair of super long chopsticks to stir partially cooked pork, onion, shrimps and tomato together in front of us.  It's obviously for show but it was quite interesting.  You are given 10 rice papers in stackable individual plates and lettuce, basil, mint, and other greens to make your own wrap.  I got busy and enjoyed making and eating this tasty dish.  

There are many other dishes we'd like to try and I look forward to returning soon!
author: Katy Y.

description:
Maybe I am biased about this place given our mutual affinity for a certain flower, but I have to say that I had some of the best vegetarian pho I have ever tasted last night. Super tasty broth, fresh vegetables, and yummy fried tofu (amongst other bits of veggie goodness). Not only that, for $7, it is easily enough to feed me for at least two meals. 

I would also feel remiss if I didn't point out the fact that the "lady of the house" is one of the sweetest, friendliest people I have ever come across. She's always very attentive and happy and once let me order delivery below the minimum because they weren't very busy at the time. She is obviously really invested in the restaurant and I love that!

So what have I had? There's the garlic noodles, which are delicious fresh and hot out of the kitchen, but not so great for delivery because they tend to get gooey and stick together if not super fresh. Then the lemongrass beef w/ Vermicelli noodles for lunch--freakin' phenomenal! Also can't leave out the lemongrass tofu dinner (no noodles in the dinner entree)...very, very good. And I love that for the veggie version of things, you can choose between tofu and fake chicken (or is it duck) and I think maybe one other thing? Oh, and they will not fry the tofu if you specify it, which I think I will next time I get the pho. 

Damnit, now I am craving Vietnamese at 10 in the morning!
author: Jasmine F.

description:
My favorite local that hasn't disappointed yet.

The food is a strong four stars.  Every dish that I have tasted there exceeded my expectations.  And I cannot say enough about their Vietnamese beef carpaccio... the mix of the fried garlic and shallots against the mint, basil, and cilantro blend beautifully with the delicate slices of raw beef...  getting hungry just writing about it.  Other dishes that stand out for me are the dancing beef, imperial rolls and salmon curry.  I am not a pho aficionado and haven't tried the pho menu so I can't judge that part of their lineup.

This place gets the extra star for its EXCELLENT VALUE (most entrees under $10) and its exceptionally friendly service.

While the ambiance is not quite suited to my taste Jasmine Garden more than makes up for it in other areas.

Give it a try.

Cheers
author: William B.

description: This is some kind of BBQ pork and Imperial Roll vermicelli heaven. Thanks be to the gods of take-out that I have known this place.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
Jasmine Garden is a hidden treasure!  I used to be a die-hard Sunflower fan until I ate here.

Kelly greets you with a smile and a hug. One you are seated, you get treated to amazing appetizers and dishes. Tonight tried the rack of lamb and of was amazing as was the basil beef and BBQ Pork rolls 

To top off an amazing meal, try the Vietnamese coffee and fried bananas with coconut ice cream with toasted coconut flakes!

Prices are reasonable, food and service are amazing. This is my new favorite restaurant!
author: Ed C.

description:
This was my first visit to Jasmine Garden since I moved a number of years ago.  I met a friend here today on his birthday for a late lunch.  It proved to be the perfect choice.

The tables were nicely prepared, the atmosphere was casual and relaxing.  

We had Imperial Rolls, beef carpaccio, special coffee brewed at the table, and banana flambe.  The food was nicely presented, the portions were generous, and the taste - exceptional.

The expertise of the young waiter was a bonus.  Very pleasant and quick to smile, helpful, and attentive in the appropriate way.  He didn't interrupt us even once while providing excellent service.

I'm thrilled to find a jewel I'll return to and I look forward to trying other items on the menu.
author: Carol K.

description: The place doesn't look like much from the outside.  BUT, the food definitely makes up for it once inside!  We had the Dancing Beef and Garlic Noodles along with a Salmon Salad appetizer.  Fantastic!  The chit chat with the likable owners also adds to the very warm and welcoming atmosphere of this place.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Dexter L.

description: I had a craving for pho tonight and searched for a place in my neighborhood. Sunday at 8 pm and there were plenty of people inside, but we were able to get a table. I can't express how  delighted I was  to discover this place. Great fresh spring rolls and the rare beef pho hit the spot.  Good prices too! I can't wait to come back again.
author: Julie B.

description: People like the vegetarian pho so much because it's chicken based. Sure there are no pieces of meat with your noodles, but the broth does come from an animal. The staff is super sweet and the menu has pretty good variety, and everything is made well
author: James P.

description:
On a recent visit to San Fran, our wonderful foodie friend took us here for dinner. It was hard not to immediately love the salad rolls with shrimp, lettuce, carrots and rice noodles wrapped in rice paper, especially because they came beautifully (and creatively) presented in two little hanging baskets balanced on a miniature stand. The rolls were also extremely fresh and came with a delicious peanut sauce, and so they were a winner in our books. Our other favourite dish was the glass noodles with garlic, veggies and other assorted goodies. Absolutely delicious! The shrimp and papaya salad with a large assortment of shredded veggies in a light vinaigrette was also very refreshing and delicious. The only dish we didn't care for was the lemon chicken. I think we were hoping it would be skinless chicken breast in the lemon sauce, perhaps with other veggies, but the chicken came with the skin left on, which was unfortunately quite tough and chewy, so the dish was difficult to eat and not very enjoyable. However my friend and I enjoyed the glass noodles and salad rolls so much that we returned for dinner a second time during our stay. On that visit we tried another chicken dish which was very tasty.

Overall, the food is delicious, the atmosphere is casual and comfortable, and the service is fast. We had to repeat a few instructions and questions to our server because of a language barrier, but overall the service was good. Also the TV was showing videos of traditional Vietnamese food being prepared, which I thought was neat. Definitely worth a return visit next time I'm in San Fran.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
wow good reviews? I must have picked the wrong plates, anyways to start off the evening after I had lunch at this place I became extremely sick from indigestion and even vomited up a bunch of noodles etc... i'm pretty positive the food from this place did not sit well in my stomach.
But i'm gonna give it fair judgement and rate the food as it is -

Dish 1 - vermicelli noodle + pork + egg rolls = would have been pretty average in taste if not for the horrible choice of noodles. It (the noodles) was extremely hard. Price wise its pretty average
Dish 2 - Spring Rolls - first off 6.50 for these spring rolls? you got to be kiddin me. Secondly, the rice wrappers were super hard!!! They stuffed it with a bunch of bean sprouts... come on for 6.50 give us more shrimps or something.
Well that sums up my experience here, first and last of it.
author: Dang L.

description: Solid pho place, 3.5-4 stars. Came here on a sunday afternoon   and the place was only 20% full. Most of us ordered the basic rare beef pho only i asked for only beef and meatballs without brisket or blank. The service is pretty nice and fairly fast. They provided an individual plate of sprouts/lime/greens for each person which was convenient. The broth was good - not the best i've ever had but a solid broth, good noodles, ok rare beef texture and ok meatballs.
author: Cecilia T.

description:
For the tight space they have, the wait was surprisingly not very long, which may or may not be a good thing, especially since I came in at 8 on a Friday night. Service is quick, albeit it seems that they focus so much on quickness that they seem to forget some other key points such as providing a welcoming environment. But other than that, they seemed to really know their way around running a restaurant pretty smoothly.

Onto the menu and food, the selection was decent; nothing too special that you wouldn't be able to find elsewhere with minor modifications. I was kind of disappointed that there weren't any pho selections for dinner; only lunch. In fact, most of their menu, lunch and dinner, was comprised mostly of Chinese style dishes. I guess the part of it that would be Vietnamese would be the choice of ingredients, but even then it was mainly Chinese. Even the name of the restaurant suggests so. Anyway, I ordered the lemongrass beef. Apparently rice doesn't come with it; it's an additional $1 charge. The portion size was perfect for your appetite, average for your wallet. Other items also seemed fairly reasonable for the price, but again nothing too special. Flavor-wise, something seemed off. Perhaps the peppers were a bit overpowering when accompanied with the lemongrass? It wasn't bad, just average. Appearance was Chinese style. Rice came in a dim sum basket, while the beef came on a wok on a plate. Texture, the beef was okay. Not chewy, but not entirely soft. The beans came off a bit crunchy and didn't seem to fit the dish so well. Overall, my experience was slightly above average, only because of the swift service. 

Menu: 7/10
Food: 7/10
Environment: 7.5/10
Service: 9/10
Overall: 7.5/10
author: Darren H.

description:
It was late, I was tired and I wanted some pho bad. Unfortunately, my nearby favorite Golden Star had just closed at 9pm and I had to find another place quickly.  My mobile yelp app showed Jasmine Garden as a possibility and I relented to driving all the way down to the Castro knowing full well I would have to face a battle with parking.  

Luckily, found a good parking spot after only 10 minutes of circling and walked 3 minutes to the restaurant.  The restaurant is kind of cheesy from the outside but is noticibly nicer (mildly) on the inside.  The place was surprisingly full for a late Thursday night on a near deserted street.  

Imagine my surprise when I sit down, look through the menu and see NO PHO! What the heck?  Quickly, I point this out to the waiter and the fact that there is a big "Pho" sign outside their restaurant and he proceeds to bring me another menu.  What?  A secret menu with lower priced items?  Maybe I'm just paranoid and it's a lunch menu, who knows?  Either way, I just ordered the pho and a shrimp garlic noodles.  Wow, the pho was great and the shrimp garlic noodles were super delish as well (even though I could literally taste the butter that had been soaked into the noodles).  The waiter was great.  Brought out the right condiments and an extra bowl and plate without me even having to ask.  

For the both of us, the bill was $20 including tax and tip!  Great weeknight cheap Asian fix!
author: Susan L.

description: Excellent spot that we were very glad to discover is right in our hood. The crepe thingy (sorry not sure what is was called) was unlikely anything we've ever had and we loved it. The fish sauce is perfect, the Hue Pho was excellent, and server very friendly and accommodating to questions and helped us through making a custom dish that we ended up loving. This is definitely going to be one of our go to spots from now on.
author: M L.

description:
This place is like a lost gem. Tons of people pass by Church and Market without even knowing it's there, but it's probably my favorite restaurant in the City.

First of all, the food there is amazingly good. The Bun Bo Hue is delicious and full of flavor, and what a beautiful color! It definitely has its own kick to it but the waitstaff there are more than willing to give you extra peppers if you so desire.

If you only want to give Pho a chance, I recommend that too. They let the meat cook from the heat of the broth right in front of you, which is exactly how Pho is supposed to be served. And the broth there is so amazing I can drink the whole thing! I like the Pho here even better than most of the places in Little Saigon. That's why this place is a gem!

For appetizers, I always get the Crunchy Roll. It's not on the menu, but the waitress suggested it to us one day. It's your traditional spring roll with nuoc mam sauce, but instead of shrimp they give you pork, and they also put little peanuts around the outside that stick to the rice paper. It is simply delicious, and the nuoc mam sauce is awesome. 

Another thing about this place is that they serve everything in such an appetizing way. Like order the Crunchy Roll and they serve it to you in a martini glass with shredded carrots. And the water they serve you has lemon and mint leaves floating in the pitcher.

They have lots of other traditional meals that remind me of my mother's home cooking, Banh Xeo, Catfish cooked in a clay pot, Chinese sausages cooked in a clay pot (OMG So good!), and Sweet and Sour Soup with Pineapple and Catfish. heaven...drool...

So, if you're looking for Vietnamese, this is definitely the place to try. The door sticks, so don't think it's closed. I wonder if that's why the place is always so empty. How sad!
author: Xavier G.

description:
Five stars for the CALAMARI! That's right, calamari at a vietnamese restaurant, and it was amazing. Calamari is one of those foods that has become very homogenized, do you agree? Kind of like fish and chips: always sounds great, always tastes about the same (exception, Edinburgh Castle). Anyway, this calamari was great and had a unique flavor, for once!

If it was me cooking, I would use a sauce that was more interesting. But still delicious! Don't leave here without ordering the calamari!
author: Paloma B.

description: Apparently if you are friends with the owners or staff, you step into a totally different dimension. We saw great reviews so we tried this place, but our experience was horrible. Waiter was pushy to take our order and not friendly or helpful at all. No Pho on the menu. We were confused, thought maybe they had it under a different name, tried asking questions about the menu, but the waiter wasn't forthcoming and bordered on rude. Tea for 3 came in a tiny child-sized tea pot labeled with cheesy coffee words and the cups were miniature espresso cups, almost thimble-size - I'm not kidding. Food was super greasy and there were so many fish bones in the soup my friends stopped trying to eat it.  The vegetarian food was the worst Vietnamese I've ever had. We all felt sick afterwards.
author: Ashley S.

description: It was a fairly average experience in terms of atmosphere and service, but the pho was really, really good!  The broth was extremely flavorful. I'm not sure why we had to ask for a separate pho menu.  If the pho is always that good, I'll be back.
author: Kate Marie G.

description: Jasmine Garden's a solid Vietnamese place.  Entrees are between $8-$12, with typical lunch specials.  Wasn't busy at all during lunch hours on a Monday.  I'm blanking on the name, but I ordered a heavily-seasoned chicken lunch special which was fairly good.  I'd definitely go back.
author: Bill H.

description:
4.5 stars!

First off let me say that I'm a very discerning Vietnamese foodie.  Born in Vn, been back, and have been eating this stuff all my life.  Nothing can compare to my mamas stuff, so here goes...

Been here 3 times and have had about everything on menu..

Aps
Beef Carpaccio- da Bomb!!! the best I've ever had and I've been to Italy.  Just the right mixture of beef, mint, fried scallions, cilantro and onions, all over lemony fish sauce.  5 stars

Banh Xeo- Vietnamese Crepe is above average.  A little too much bean sprouts but overall very crispy and fresh.  3.5 stars

BBq pork spring rolls are very tasty and fresh 4.5 stars

Entrees

Prawn noodles- Very good esp with eggy vermicelli... not authentic VN but tasty

Pho Dac Biet- not bad, but not stellar.  3.5 stars.  Broth could be a little tastier... Maybe more oxtail, cinnamon or anise star would help.  

Bun Bo Hue- again above average, but not a go to dish.  The broth is missing something special, maybe a little more porks' blood.

Shaking beef- 4.5 stars "tenderness....(80's style)", tasty, great presentation with plenty o veggies.  beef cubes could have be larger for extra tenderness... a little too savory but excellent

claypot fish- good but a little dry.  Fish could have been thicker cut for for juiciness.  3.5 star

Overall the owners and workers are great, and a joy to patronize esp for the price...
author: Vinh N.

description:
1 star - price is very reasonable
1 star - food are fresh and a lot of flavor, each dish can serve 2-3 generously
1 star - staff were nice and helpful
1 star - restaurant was clean

If many of you like food with many flavor ranging from spicy to extremely spicy then Jasmine Garden would be a place to try. Their menu may not be extensive compare to others but it has enough to wet your palate. Waitstaff were warm and helpful and maybe since we were dining their on a weekday and raining, we were there for over 2 hours, they did not rush us out. Kept filling our water glass and just smiled. That is good in my book. Therefore, Jasmine Garden has now have a permanent space in my cell phone for when I am to dam tired to cook after work.
author: Kathy T.

description: Anglicized bowls of pho portioned for women and children.
author: Michael C.

description: The three stars on this rating pertain specifically to the pho, which was why I went to this place to begin with. If that is why you are coming, you may like it but I didn't think it was up to snuff. Personally I like to be able to order the cuts of beef, size and that is it. I like pho spoons and sauces on the table. This was more full restaurant/menu. the service was nice, the wine was right on price point and overall it was a good experience. Worth a try if you are on a pho hunt...
author: Shanna T.

description:
There is this nice, bright, led sign that says "pho", greeting you when you enter this eatery.  The place is quite pleasant really, comparatively clean to other Vietnamese restaurants I've visited.  Actually, this place is beyond clean compared to most of them.

The sign totally fooled me! When I got in there, there wasn't any pho on the menu. Fear not: let the service person know you're there for pho and he'll bring out a second menu like it was the best kept secret.

Hah!  Foooooled YOU Mr. Waiter!  I don't keep secrets! Muahahaha!

I had their Jasmine Garden pho, and although it was above my expectations, it wasn't the best pho I've had.  Kevin's noodle house still rains champ.  I think it's the lack of siracha and hoisin sauce that you're given.  Augh!  When will any of the restaurants learn?!

Their imperial rolls do champion though; they're by far are the best I've had anywhere, they're... quite imperial.

I would come here again just to prove to myself that three stars is too little to give.
author: Alfred Y.

description: My friend host a private party about 70 guests (it's quite a party). The best part of this party was the food, mostly the food was Vietnamese food.And it was so good, nobody talking they just gather around the food table and keep eating. The host had to keep calling the more delivery. When i asked him where he ordered this food from. He said that he order food from "Jasmine Garden" and the rest is history. Now this is my favorite place for me.
author: Dom G.

description:
OMG, treasure find in the duboce triangle! I've walked by it many times and the exterior is totally misleading because the inside is quite nice and service is great. It's also not just another dive Vietnamese hole in the wall, they're a cut above, but still cheap!

The food is solid, try their clay pots, and pho during lunch time. The coconuts are fresh and sweet and the deserts are great. 

I definitely need to go back and give my tastebuds a good time!
author: Venatius P.

description:
I DON'T UNDERSTAND. WHY DO PEOPLE SAY THIS IS THE BEST PHO PLACE IN THE CITY?!?!

First, very friendly service and they don't have a minimum charge for credit cards. Nice!

i read so many reviews and they raved about the delicious pho. Being in the Mission, you don't have many choices if you're craving that tasty beefy broth and noodles with thin slices of meat. I can't stand sweet broth at Sunflower, so I decided to try this place. 4.5 overall rating...must be good right?

WRONG. IT'S LIKE A $7.33 BOWL OF MSG WATER. I guess being too caffeinated didn't help because now I feel weird and thirsty and the caffeination has heightened into this uncomfortable I can't stop moving skin crawling feeling. And I'm still thirsty. Thirsty thirsty thirsty.

Portions are not large here. They are normal. If these are large portions for people, then they haven't gone to a real pho joint such as Pho Kim Long in San Jose. Now THAT'S a large portion--where there's so much soup, noodles, and meat that you can't finish any of them. Maybe all the meat, but then you're left completely stuffed with leftover noodles and soup. Or if you eat all the noodles, you're left with leftover meat and soup. Or if you eat all the soup, you're left with leftover meat and noodles.

I got the beef pho. The meat is decent, but not the best I've had. It was nice to get ONE whole meatball (sliced in half to make you feel like you're special and you get two pieces of meatball)...I guess that was very generous. The noodles are fine. The broth has okay flavor, but it is definitely too MSGed. TOO TOO TOO TOO MSGed. One scoop of soup and I knew already that I would be dying of thirst and regretting drinking all that soup.

I finished the whole bowl, and as anticipated, I regretted it. I know what you think: Why did you eat the whole thing if you knew you would be dying of thirst right after? I can't help it. I'm a pho monster. And when I think about pho for more than 2 days straight, I will down any bowl of pho I can find. =(

I do not recommend the beef pho here. Unless you can handle loads of MSG. If you want decent pho, please just go to the Tenderloin. Every place I've tried there is better.
author: Angela H.

description: Entirely decent pho for $7.25 (or just under $9 after tax and tip) in San Francisco. I shall try other dishes next time.
author: AloisSchicklgruber H.

description:
Disclaimer: I know nothing about Vietnamese food, especially pho. If you are a connesiur or pho-phanatic , skip right over this review right here. I am speaking purely from a place of what I think tastes yummy.

Tonight I wanted to get some takeout and have nice night of sitting on the couch with my kitties and watching the "What Not to Wear Marathon" on TLC. I wanted to try something new (so I could Yelp it,  of course!), and was having a craving for a steaming bowl of goodness.

I've wanted to try Jasmine Garden for a long time- actually, since it was Will's.  I have always been dishearteded, though, by the consistent lack of patrons. When I stopped by tonight though, there was a family of 20 which made me feel slightly better.

I told the woman at the counter I would like to place an order to go and she immediately ushered me to an empty table, handed me a menu and  a glass of water while I decided. Very nice. 

I ordered the Bon Bo Hue- thinly sliced beef, noodels, and lemon-grass infused broth. It was so delicious. Not as spicy as I expected (supposedly the spiciest pho on the menu) but it had a wonderful, clean feeling in my mouth. And the portion was massive! When I got home, I had to use a large mixing bowl to house my pho!

I was so impressed by the pho, I returned the following night to order the same thing.
author: S F.

description:
I like Pho.  I had Pho.  The broth was tasty.  

The broth was a bit different than what I am used to, and that was a good thing.  I am not sure what the scent was, though it was familiar.  I think it might have said Lemon Grass infused, which would make sense.  

The broth was interesting enough that I will be back within a week. They had a Chicken Pho which I am looking forward to trying, though describing the chicken as blanched doesn't do a lot to make the taste buds water.

....did I miss a secret pho menu?  ....I think only saw 3 on the menu.
author: Travis S.

description: This place is a great combination of cheap and delicious. It was rainy cold, so we ordered pho (off the pho menu, which we had to specially request). Mmmm.... The vegetarian pho was so full of mushrooms and baby bok choy that it made my tablemates jealous. Plus they specify that they have vegetarian broth, so I didn't have to worry.
author: Renee T.

description:
I don't think noodle soup is Jasmin Garden's forte'.  The two times that I've been here, the soup has been lazy in flavor.  What I mean by this is that the flavor just doesn't go the extra mile.  It's mediocre at best and the ingredients seem bare minimum.  

The first time we went here, I ordered pho and it didn't have tripe or tendon, or beef brisket, nor did they have dandelion greens in the vegetable selection that usually accompanies the pho.  It's hard to ding them on this, since I'm sure the tripe and tendon issue is more of a "catering to the white man's palate" thing.  But for me, that's what makes a 5-star aunthentic bowl of pho.

The second time I was there, I had bun bo hue, and it seemed like they just took the pho, and threw in some store-bought lemongrass paste and substituted the pho noodles for bun noodles and changed the name.  My mouth was covered in orange chili grease after the meal.  It was kind of disappointing, especially considering the day before, I had the exact same meal at Mangosteen and it was delicious.

The sad thing is that I REALLY want to like this place, given it's location and the fact that the service is always super nice.

Everyone seems to give this place a good review based on other dishes so maybe I'll need to try it again, but no noodle soup.  I'm willing to give this place one more shot, but for now, two stars is my rating based on my experience so far...  Third time's the charm???
author: Phillip H.

description:
Yelp strikes again! I caught a cold and needed a day in bed, but I could rent my cupboards out for storage space at this point, they're so bare. I have a few favorite restaurants who deliver in my neighborhood, but I wanted something different than my usual go-to's, and figured Yelp would provide my new lunchtime delivery options. 

Noticing that everyone seemed to rave about 2 dishes - the dancing beef and the garlic noodles - I just had to go for it and try them both. I got 2 side orders of the garlic noodles so I could give some to my boyfriend later (he gets upset when I eat good Vietnamese without him), but I ended up eating it myself for dinner.

The beef was tender and sweet, and even presented well for food that came in a box. The noodles had those beautiful sear-lines indicative of pan-frying and roasted aromatic garlic bits that practically melted in my mouth. I could already feel myself getting better. 

This is definitely my new favorite Vietnamese in town and I can't wait to sample the rest of their menu.
author: Kat E.

description:
Even though I left bloated and gassy, the food and drink was very enjoyable.

I sat with my two girfriend in a corner booth area, right near the kitchen. It was sorta drafty, but the loudness of the Santacon group kept me distracted. 

We ordered two orders of the bbq rolls (AMAZING), a chicken salad (delicious dressing), eggplant with tofu (tasted very Thai), and the garlic noodles (drenched in buttery goodness). 

We had a bottle of reisling, which complemented the meal very nicely. The bill was $61 for the 3 of us--great deal!
author: Misha F.

description:
The Banh Xeo here is really good, but the veggies you get with it is outstanding... super fresh and crunchy and you get a lot of it.

The garlic noodles with shrimp is very good too.

I'm stolked they moved into this really convenient spot.

I'm going back really soon
author: Geordie E.

description:
To preface, I'm obsessed with Bun. So when I judge a Vietnamese restaurant, I'm judging the Bun. 

The Bun at Jasmine Garden is pretty damn good. It'd be better if the noodles were a little less sticky and not so clumped together and there were more fresh vegetables and mint leaves piled at the top, but I must say the BBQ pork makes up for it because it is outstanding. Tender, juicy, clean, and full of BBQ flavor, I could eat their pork every day. The crispy spring rolls are also delicious. The combination of crispy, doughy, meaty, and leafy textures together in one bowl is delightful. 

The service is fast, but perhaps a bit too fast. Every time my friend paused from her Pho, one of the waiters tried to take her bowl away. 

Jasmine Garden is definitely worth going to, but I'm still looking for the best place in the city to find the perfect Bun. Suggestions are welcome!
author: simone H.

description:
Jasmine Garden is a superb hole in the wall vietnamese restaurant focused on authentic vietnamese food with a mild bent towards chinese cooking styles. 

Pho - For Jasmine Garden, this standard vietnamese dish is a walk in the park. For the diner, this is an excellent dish. The broth is complex and negotiates well between the salty, sweet, and lightness of a good broth. The noodles are a bit starchier than I was expecting, but not a big deal. The meat was excellent and the condiments were fresh. Really, the broth carried this plate.

Bun - The BBQ Pork bun is really where this restaurant shines. Traditional vietnamese executions emphasize the fish sauce heavily and as a chinese person, I find the result a little challenging on the nose. In Jasmine Gardens' rendition, the mix of the flavors very clearly have a chinese bent, which to me, optimizes for my palate. I'll take it.

Crunch Roll - This invention should definitely be tried. Jasmine Garden takes a spring roll and wraps that inside a freshroll. The inventors of the turducken were quite proud. 

An important final point to make is how sweet Kelly (the owner) is. She really goes out of her way to make your dining experience excellent. She is passionate about her food.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I've just completed my 5th trip to Jasmine Garden. It's a completely new place with new menu, new staff, and new owners. The dishes are tasty and generously sized. At an average of 7 or 8 bucks each, they're competitively priced. The staff is extremely nice and accommodating, as other reviewers have noticed.

Some noteworthy dishes: 

- the spring rolls: fresh, flavored with mint, classic. Healthy and delicious. And not the tiny wieners you get a Sunflower in the Mission either.

- catfish claypot: the caramel sauce is out of this world in terms of flavor. The catfish morsels are tender and delicious. I've tried the chicken claypot and it's also as good. The veggie option is ok but not as good as the catfish

- basil chicken/tofu: one of the better sauces in this category. Better balanced than similar dish at Thai Corner express nearby. Less overpowering than similar dish at Red Jade nearby.

If you're looking for a change of pace from Thai and Chinese, which are everywhere in the Castro/Duboce area, definitely check out Jasmine Garden. 

An excellent new addition to the neighborhood.
author: Patrick S.

description:
My first experience of Pho here was awesome, and I really looked forward to returning and showing off my great find to a friend.  Alas, something must have happened between the two experiences, because the pho was really lacking.  

Sorry Jasmine Garden - no consistency = no repeat business :(
author: Corey C.

description:
I have to try out this place because my friend that's extremely picky with Vietnamese food rave about this place. I went there with 5 other people. We ordered house special crab, Banh xeo (crepe), house special noodle, clay pot cat fish, stir fry beef. All the dishes taste pretty good fine if  you eat each bite with TONS of white rice. It was as if the salt was on sale, all the dishes turn out to be super salty. Price is at the cheaper side with lunch portion. I guess you pay for what you get.

I like to give an extra star for our super accommodating waiter. The restaurant had Vietnamese karaoke playing when we walked in the restaurant, he was so kind that he switched over to Celine Dion's concert in Vegas for us. Not that any of us were Celine Dion's fan, but we appreciated his effort. :)
author: Ervinna L.

description: Holy Crap! This was one of the best meals I have had in the city. The service was amazing too. So friendly. One of the members of my party is a vegetarian but also hates mushrooms. They made us some off the menu appetizers that were so delectable, I cannot wait to ask if they could do it again. We also had veggie pho which you have to ask for and young coconut milk served in the real coconut. I walked out thinking, I HAVE to take my BF here so he can also experience this treat! We had fresh spring rolls and "crunch rolls" that were like an imperial roll wrapped in a fresh spring roll. As I write this review, I am trying to think of someone to take here tonight!!
author: Jena D.

description:
This place is absolutely amazing.  I have grown up in the City, and was on a mission to find a great Pho place. Now, I finally have a place!  Everything about this place is awesome: food, service, cleanliness. 

Ever since I discovered this place, I have been recommending it left and right!
author: Rita R.

description: Good, authentic vietnamese food. Ive been going here regularly introducing friends to this establishment. Out of the 15+ encounters, no one has encountered a bad plate out of their menu. All-around good food, quick and personable waiters, and a really nice location.
author: Aakash D.

description:
Got delivery on a Saturday night.  Here are the pros and cons:

Pros -
- Good pho -- yummy bbq pork -- it would get 4 stars on its own
- Good papaya salad, but kind of small.  We were fightin' over the last nibbles -- it would get 3 stars on its own.

Cons -
- ordered and paid for two portions of rice.  Not in delivery bag. (zero stars)
- garlic noodles were some kind odd concoction of stuff you might be left with after making scrambled eggs and sauteing soggy noodles in the same pan, and then slathering on some 'buttery' flavored oil or margarine.  had an odd synthetic taste along with the garlic.  ick!!!!  (zero stars)
- chicken in basil chicken was dry like left-over, re-microwaved chicken breast bits.  Not much basil and the sauce was just average. (zero stars)
- they called my cell phone twice around 9:45pm to track down the information on the receipt that the driver had accidentally left with our order.  (zero stars)

Bottom line... the leftovers are sitting in the fridge and will probably remain there, untouched, which is almost unheard of in this house.   We won't order again -- next time we'll order from Red Jade.  Always yummy.
author: S S.

description: Pho and Crunch Rolls are amazing!   The atmosphere is very nice but the service could definately be improved.  Never had a bad meal at Jasmine Garden.
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
Super Yum! I ordered the beef pho and garlic noodles (carb fest) and it was delicious!
I went to pick up my order, and the lady that was helping me told me I could have my food delivered next time.. I told her I only worked two blocks away and she said Next time call! So you don't have to walk!! 
umm..okay! 
The exterior is not amazing, and the interior was not super fancy, but the food was amazing, and I couldn't eat my garlic noodles fast enough.  I am super surprised they are not packed every minute of the day because of how good their food and service is.
author: Janet R.

description: The food here is very good, the portions are on the smaller side but it's reflected in the prices, love the videos overhead showing vietnamese food stalls and restaurants inside vietnam.
author: N A.

description: Amazing place, clean and beautiful dining room, great and inexpensive food.
author: Lucky S.

description: this place is NOT open at 10 so don't even bother trying to get dinner here. FUCK YOU JASMINE
author: James M.

description: There is something very strange about this place. The service on each of the 3 times I tried to get takeout was a lengthy nightmare full of rude interactions with the staff. The food can be quite good but i've never been able to get take out in less than 45 minutes... even when the place isn't crowded. The manager says it will take 20 minutes but each tine it's been far longer. There seems to be no rhyme or reason to when food comes out. I've seen new tables get food delivered to their table ahead or mine even though I ordered before they arrived. A friendly manager could solve some of the frustration but the guy who seems to be the frontman has almost no people skills and has been rude on each of my 3 visits.  The best that I can say is that he is trying to discourage new customers so that they don't become disappointed.
author: Andy P.

description:
We try to make it to this place once a week! The pho is always good, and so are the shaking beef, basil chicken, bbq pork fresh spring rolls, crab, vermicelli bowls...  I really can't think of anything here that isn't good.  

The service here is great too.  I ordered Pho to go once, and they took the time to pack the soup, meat/fixings, noodles, all separately!
author: Jing Y.

description: Taking your phone off the hook is not an acceptable way to tell your customers you don't do delivery or pickup orders anymore.
author: joe b.

description:
Good, not great. Fairly prompt delivery, but the ordering process was a serious hassle. I have no issue with most restaurants and the constant language barrier, this time it was like I was speaking in tongues, it took ten minutes just to correctly place my order.

That said, food was decent and the price was fair.  Good spring rolls and the garlic noodle shrimp was pretty good, but the Vietnamese crepe and the lemongrass chicken were simply OK. Also, and this could be my own ignorance, but my order came with a big bag of butter lettuce that didn't really seem to go with anything, hmmmmm.
author: brant f.

description:
I recently moved to a new apartment in San Francisco and decided to check out this local restaurant.

My fiance and I got the vegetarian spring rolls (pretty good but nothing to drive across town for), the jasmine garden clay pot and the chicken eggplant (with the vegetarian fake chicken). The food was simple, good flavors, and very well priced. My fake chicken was okay, not bad not amazing...but my fiance says the real meat would probably make it a lot better :)

All in all, I'd come here again for some quick, yummy and cost effective grub.
author: Galeet L.

description:
Yelpers say they are slow in delivering, so we decided to pick the food ourselves. There were 8 of us, so we needed thematic food quickly while we watched our friend's Vietnam travel photos. As they say in 'Nam, tot... I can already feel that humid air of the Mekong Delta....

The imperial rolls were ok. This Cha Gio of minced pork, garlic , mushroom, taro, glass noodle, onion and water chestnut served with fish sauce was middle of the road OK. The papaya salad - Goi Du Du Tom of shredded green papaya with poached shrimps, carrots, mints, raw ram and fried garlic served with lime vinaigrette was good. We also ordered their Jasmine Garden Noodle Soup or Pho Dac Biet. Of course the noodles were all stuck together in a massive white cube of goo until you throw them into the hot broth along with plastic bag full of sprouts, beef balls, onions and thin slices of tender beef to create your Pho. It was tasty, especially the beef and sprouts.  We also ordered lemongrass chicken, sauteed together with lemongrass , chili, green ean and onion -- get it to go spicy and you wished you had Vietnam pilsner. Finally, some shrimp - Chao Tom minced shrimp wrapped with rice noodles rice wrapper, lettuce, herbs and peanut sauce. Hot.

Overall, we enjoyed the food and enjoyed the travel photos of HCMC, Hoi Ahn, Hue and Hanoi.

All I can say is "tot, cám on"
author: Reyz A.

description: Thanks Bart M. for introducing this place.  Flavorful and affordable.  I love the seabass & garlic noodle.
author: Paul M.

description:
So my sister has been telling me about this place for a while, so i went today for lunch. 
I had the garlic noodles with shrimp mmm mmm good! 
calamari and double crunch roll... FABULOUS!
The hospitality is FANTASTIC... Thanks!
author: Yolanda M.

description:
I stepped in last night for the first time to get some Bun (vermicelli noodle dish) to go. The staff was INCREDIBLY friendly -- they made sure I was comfortable during my short stay and even served me water 3 times! (It's the little stuff like that that really shows me the quality of service). 

Got home and couldn't stop eating it was so good. Will definitely go back. Oh yea, prices are awesome too. $7.60 for my food and i was stuffed. Yay!
author: Christina G.

description: Seafood pho is so good! Nice place inside, friendly staff and really good menu.
author: Lacey M.

description:
If I was close by here I'd come here more often....I came here with my boss and coworkers for lunch. I expected it to be like any other Vietnamese place...but they sure proved me wrong.

We shared a bunch of stuff. We had a bowl of pho, the spring roll/imperial roll platter, beef carpaccio, garlic noodles, and the salmon spring roll, and a surprise sear salmon salad on the chef =) THEY WERE ALL DELISH! When the pho first came I expected it to taste like all the other pho with a lot of MSG but this was so tasty, taste like my mom's pho...all stewed and taste like it's be cooked the right way. The spring roll and imperial rolls also taste like home for me. The fish sauce was just right, I love Vietnamese food, so this was good to me, especially when it taste like real Vietnamese food with no "cheap" ingredients. They're all fresh. The beef carpaccio was soo tasty, the was thin and fresh, didn't taste like those already cut beef that's sold at the markets, it came with a lot of cilantro =) made me a happy girl. The garlic noodles...oh man IT'S A MUST TRY HERE.....soooooo good....I love garlic and this was really garlic-y.....This was also my first time having the salmon spring roll and surprisingly it was pretty good...I like it...All the side salads were fresh. As for the seared salmon salad, it was created on the spot by the chef, pretty good to be a new dish from him, now you can tell he's a great chef if he's just putting stuff together and it taste great. I would definitely come back and I would recommend people to come because it is affordable. 

My boss also told me their crab are good, they buy it fresh from the market according to who calls in to order the dish. So if you're having a get together and wants crab, try it and let me know how it is because supposedly it's one of their specialty. And it's a guarantee freshness....
author: Helen T.

description: decent. huge plus that they deliver to the office. the pho ga has been the only thing i've ordered from there. not too shabby. but i still prefer turtle tower anyday.
author: Ann T.

description: This place is super friendly. I don't mean all Applebee's fake friendly, I mean, if you go there often enough, they'll remember your name, like Cheer's friendly. I've only eaten there a few times, so they don't know who I am... yet. Their pho is excellent and the sprouts, basil and peppers to put on top is always fresh, unlike some other places where it's clear that stuff as been sitting out of days, all wilted and questionable. Their clay pots are delicious and generous. They have two versions of their menu, one with the pho listings and one without, and it's not clear which is for lunch and which is for dinner. Weird, very Asian to not care about that, but they'll serve up dishes from both menus no matter the time of day. Also, very Asian. Finally, the prices are amazing for the quality/quantity of food you get.
author: Jay D.

description: Everyone who talks about the pho here... LOL. I have been to this restaurant twice and I haven't even tried their pho. Maybe it's because I come here to eat other Vietnamese foods, like Ca Kho and Canh Chua, I don't really think about the ordinary fare like pho as much. But seriously, this is one of my favorite restaurants in the city. The waiters here are super nice, the owner is fun to talk to, and actually one of the chefs explained to me the basics of how some of the dishes are made when I asked. The ambiance here is nice and the plating is much better than most Vietnamese restaurants. Also, for the price, this place is a great deal. Oh and the dishes don't take long to come out! The inside of the restaurant is much nicer than one would expect from the outside, but warning! this place is very busy, so if you know you're gonna have a group, make reservations beforehand! Also, it's really hard to find parking, so be prepared to park a bit farther or just take the bus. Anyways, the food here is all awesome! I definitely recommend the quail, the lamb, and my favorite: the Ca Kho (catfish claypot). But I really recommend that people go out of their comfort zone. I know that most of the customers are not Vietnamese, so they generally gravitate towards what they know (PHO), but that is not the extent of Vietnamese food. Pho happens to be one of my less favorite Vietnamese foods, actually, so branch out. Try something new or ask what the waiter or manager recommends. It's totally worth it. Great restaurant, great atmosphere, great staff, and great food.
author: Kellie L.

description:
This is the old, Will's restaurant (http://www.yelp.com/biz/wills-house-san-francisco).  I think it is under new management, and its under gone some major changes, even though its still a Vietnamese restaurant. 

So I never had the chance to visit the old WIll's, but from what I gather the renovation has turned the place a bit more fancy and upscale.  I was actually in the mood for Pho, but it didn't really seem like the Pho place (they only had Pho on the lunch menu).  It was fine though, as I do like lots of non-Pho vietnamese food.  I ended up ordering the spring rolls (goi cuon) and the Hot and Sour Soup w/ Shrimp ( a classic favorite for my family gatherings).  The spring rolls were definitely in the top quartile of one's I've tried.  The soup was delicious and authentic.  Everyone who worked there was very nice and prompt with service.

I will have to come back for lunch sometime, and would like to try out some of the other dishes to give it a deeper look.
author: Randal T.

description: I have to update the fact that now it seems like every other time I call, Jasmine is busy. I have to walk down there everytime because you people just don't give up. Stop calling my place dam you.
author: seb j.

description:
Great food, great prices, and excellent service. 

Everyone in the restaurant was so friendly and helpful, which made the already delicious food that much more enjoyable. I've been for lunch and dinner, both of which are really wonderful.

I agree, the giant TV above the door is out of place, but it didn't take away from my enjoyment of my meal. I hope this place stays in business -- we need more places like this!
author: Christian C.

description: I ordered chicken in clay pot. The flavor is ok but the portion is extremely small, 1/4 of 5 inch diameter clay pot. I think they might split one portion into two orders since the table next to us ordered the same thing and the two pots came exactly the same time. Anyways, wish they are more generous with the portion.
author: Suki C.

description: The best pho in the city....flavorful balanced broth, fresh veggies. Even a small bowl is almost too much..AND...nice atmo, super friendly service. My comfort food.
author: Janet P.

description: This place is yummy; I had dinners here with friends so many times. Try the banana flambe as a dessert, it's to die for, you won't regret it!! Excellent Vietnamese food in the Castro area.
author: Will P.

description:
Yummy Vietnamese that delivers....whoa!  The bf and I order here at least once a week.  Our favs are: dancing beef, vietnamese crepe (and it's still crispy when it gets to your house!), the jasmine garden taste appetizer, and side of garlic noodles.  although, you will not go wrong if you get the salt & pepper garlic prawns (if you like the heads) and just make sure to order an extra side of garlic noodles (or you'll be fighting over them).  oh, and most entrees have a veggie option too.

would have given them 5 stars if the lunch items (noodle plates) were available for dinner.
author: maggie m.

description:
Great Vietnamese Food at Reasonable Prices.
For lunch I had the papaya salad & thereafter the noodle soup-Bun Bo Hue.  That was tasty as well.

I'm actually a little surprised that the restaurant doesn't appear to be that busy since it has such great tasting food. 
Parking can be a little difficult since the restaurant is basically at a busy corner i.e. intersections of Church/Market/14th Streets.

I will definitely return!
author: J B.

description: I come to Jasmine Garden at least once a month. I usually get the seafood pho which is very fresh, tasty, and healthy. Whenever I feel adventurous I try something new and I am always pleased. The dancing beef is great and the carpaccio is very good too!
author: Raquele C.

description: I hesitate to post such a short review, but: I've tasted at least 6 dishes and 2 appetizers, and would order every single one of them again.  The servings are huge, the prices are extremely reasonable, and the staff seem to genuinely appreciate the business you give them.  This is a local business you feel good about supporting considering how many mediocre and over-priced places are in the area.
author: Danny G.

description: Finally!  A good pho place right by my work though my Vietnamese coworkers say it's not authentic. Oh well.  I've tried tons of Vietnamese places in SF and all along the peninsula.  This place is great if you're looking for pho.  Their broth is good.  Meat is cooked well, especially the brisket where a lot of places tend to make chewy.  No tendon in the pho which was a little disappointing because it's my favorite part.  For $6.75, it's a great deal.  Service was good but it wasn't busy so that's to be expected.
author: Young C.

description:
In the Castro? Craving Vietnamese - food that is? I'm not talking about those 'fusion' places, I mean just Vietnamese food. This is definitely a hidden gem in the neighborhood.

I'm cranky, my head is stuffy, I am hungry, and I didn't want to go to either Chinatowns or the Loin. We came here due to my Pho craving when I was sick.
It's my third time here and it has consistently met my expectations.
