For starters, we ordered the calamari. Nice crispy batter, fried to perfection served with sweet chili sauce. I ordered the Beef Pho. It was delicious! The beef slices were thin and lean - no gristle or other weird parts, and the broth had the perfect amount of seasoning. Hit the spot! Eric ordered the the Bahn  Mi with egg rolls, and grilled pork - always a sure thing.

4 stars: good service, good atmosphere, great food. Oh and I love the Vietnamese fruit harvest marathon - yummy!

I will be back to try what everyone has been raving about: Dancing Beef and Garlic Noodles.
author: Sam H.

description: Cute place, and a rather lively place on the Friday night that I went.  The pho is delicious.  I look forward to trying some other things on the menu sometime.
author: Aaron F.

description: I love this place, and I am sick of people writing reviews about service being bad here..Sorry but if you have ever spent anywhere outside of the US, you know restaurants are were people go to enjoy there food, eat at a leisurely pace, enjoy the friends company, so service is always slower, because they don't want to rush the guest, this is even more true in Asia.  The service here is great for the simple reason they great you quick and are very friendly, they always thank me and shake my hand when I leave, and why would you want to rush when you can watch the amazing food markets of Vietnam playing on the TV?  The pork in the Bun is some of the best I have ever had, and the Pho Ga, is simply amazing, they do everything right, and really if you like fast service then just go somewhere, where all you are is money in the pocket and no one cares about you.  I LOVE JASMINE GARDEN
author: Mark C.

description:
I only give it four stars because I think to be five it has to be knock-it-out-of-the-park sublime, but make no mistake, this place is amazingly tasty. Everything we ate was incredibly good. The chicken pho was awesome. Somebody else on Yelp was complaining about MSG. While I am not positive the pho had MSG in it-- it didn't taste like it to me-- MSG, people, is god's gift to your taste buds, and the pho is, as well.

We also ordered calamari and shrimp claypot, which was also yum if a bit oily. The Vietnamese crepe was delicious. The papaya salad was good by itself by I preferred it with a dose of the sweet chili sauce they provide.

To top it off, THEY DELIVER, and the staff is very friendly. And I mean this in the nicest of ways: the woman who took our order over the phone spoke excellent English and I didn't have to spell anything at all, which I often find to be a problem when ordering. She was on it.

Don't hesitate to eat here. It's great.
author: Nick H.

description:
soooo good.
I love the pho, had it for lunch today and couldn't even finish... i took it home for dinner so there's an amazing meal twice!! 
best thing on the menu: the bbq pork rolls.... mmmm!
also, super secret goodness: their vietnamese coffee!!!! better than local coffee shops.
author: Bren B.

description: Doesn't look very nice, but it's some of the best food I've had in SF.  Our waiter recommended garlic noodles with sea bass (not on the menu) and it was incredible! I'll also be going back for the #12 Flaming Bowl - they cook the meat in a bowl at your table, serve rice paper with fixings, and you make your own roles. Delicious!
author: Julie W.

description: Fabulously amazin pho at a wonderfully low price.  I ordered the seafood pho when I was feeling sick with a very bad virus, and it cleared my sinuses (due to its kick) as well as put me on the road to healing (due to the fact that it has a chicken broth base.  I highly recommend for a quick Vietnamese meal that won't break the bank.  Dinner for the two of us, drinks included, was around $25.  Not a bad deal at all.
author: Nina B.

description: Don't judge a book by its cover. The exterior wont win this restaurant any prizes but inside, is a modern marvel. The atmosphere is relaxing and the food is amazing. Great service and friendly waiters. I've been there at least 10 times. I really recommend the eggroll/pork/noodles.
author: Tony H.

description: Just a quick skip from home, I'd say Jasmine Garden is maybe a wee bit better than Sunflower in the Mission (I know, calm down.), less crowded and more comfortable. I've taken friends there to get cold-curing, spicy soup. I've ordered take-out to cure hangovers. And I've relied on their -big screen TV South East Asia travel movies playing while you eat- to ease a first date! So in more ways than one I am thankful Jasmine Garden is so close and oh so delicious.
author: Nicole d.

description: best veggie pho i've had in town. i've become addicted and now a loyal customer for years. plus the owners are lovely :)
author: Elise H.

description: Great beef pho and the place is very clean.  The calamari is good as well.  The chicken pho is also good, but not quite as good as the beef version.  Portion sizes are a bit smaller than Ben Tre in South San Francisco.
author: Basim Z.

description:
I went to this place for the first time last week, and, wow - this is going straight into my short list of great neighborhood restaurant. What a find!

The food is very affordable, yet delicious. Staff was really nice. You absolutely HAVE to try the seabass, which is cooked in a way comparable to the one they serve at Yank Singh - amazing!!!!
author: bart m.

description: Love Jasmine Garden! Food is delicious, very accommodating for families with kids, moderate prices and customer service is 5 star. The owners are sincerely warm and go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Sometimes they are swamped, but when they're not they love chatting with you. And, from how friendly all their customers were talking with them, I think they have A LOT of regular customers. And now, including me! Highly recommend Jasmine Garden for authentic vietnamese food.
author: jey o.

description: Their beef pho is really really good. It says on the menu is spicy and i usually don't eat spicy but this spicy is just the right amount of spiciness. The soup is so flavorful that it makes it perfect if your sick or for a cold, raining day like today. Soo good!
author: Smiley H.

description: We had a great experience here: clean, good food, friendly and attentive service, reasonable prices (table cloth dining at under $10 pp). We'll definitely be returning!
author: Savannah L.

description:
We pitched up to this place at 8:45 on a Saturday and were very happy to be seated immediately. 2 beers later (a great choice of Vietnamese imported bottles) and we ordered a couple of mains and a garlic noodle dish.

The main course was fantastic in both quality, presentation, quantity and service. The rice bowl with crispy rice on the bottom, beef lemongrass and the noodles were well cooked and tasted great. We also managed to down 2 desserts (mango rice and deep fried banana) which were also great in terms of both price and taste.

I feel almost guilty in giving this 5 stars as I'd like to keep this place to myself, but these guys deserve to be publicized after they treated us so well. Highly recommended.
author: Nick L.

description: This is a family owned restaurant in the Castro and the food here is amazing.  We had a group of 8 and tried many dishes.  I have to say I think my favorite was the Sea Bass with Garlic Noodles.  We also had the Salt & Pepper Shrimp with Garlic Noodles and the Dancing Beef - both which were very tasty.  They made us some pork spring rolls that we were told were not on the menu - yummy.  Will definitely go here again.  If I lived in the City, I would probably eat here or have them deliver often.
author: Randall J.

description:
Went there for dinner love thier food and service!
Definitely thumbs up on seabass and noodles!! Also thier seafood dish and squab appetizer must try! My two year old son loves their chicken pho.
author: Olivia K.

description:
It was a cold night and we needed some toothpaste and toilet paper from Safeway.  I was too lazy to make food and was in the mood from some Pho so I Yelp'd Vietnamese restaurants on my iPhone and saw one across the street.  It was around 7 PM.

When we went in, there wasn't a lot of people--it was a Tuesday--so the waiter sat us down and gave us his undivided attention.  I could tell from the decor of the place that the service was going to be good.  The waiter handed us the dinner menu but I didn't see any Pho so I was given the lunch menu and left alone to decide.  When the waiter came back, he poured our tea for us and I got the Pho Dac Biet and my girlfriend go the Pho Gai.  

Anyone who knows me knows I always order the Pho Gai, but this time something in me wanted to go old school.  I remember my buddy in high school once took me to this Pho place on our lunch hour where I had Pho for the first time.  The Sriracha, the Hoisin, the bean sprouts, the Basil--I've never had soup I could customize like this before and I've been loving it ever since.  It was an enlightening experience.  Where am I?  Sorry.  Anyways, the Pho Dac Biet here is fantastic, just like I remembered it.  

The Pho Gai was prepared the way I've seen it in other Pho restaurants where the chicken was in strips verses cut up in pieces with the skin still on it.  I'm not sure if it's an northern or southern Vietnamese thing, but I usually ask about the chicken before ordering Pho Gai because I'm a fan of the pieces verses the strips.

After the Pho, we ordered fried banana with coconut ice cream and this was fantastic.  It was a great way to end the meal and all this for under 35 bucks.

I'll be back.
author: Steve Y.

description: The veggie pho is super fresh and tasty, the imperial rolls are perfect little morsels of just-greasy-enough yum, and they always deliver faster than they say they are going to. The only complaint I have is that they never leave me with a menu, and the one they have listed online is so tiny you can't read it. But, last time I just threw out something that sounded good, and what do you know, they brought it!
author: Erin A.

description: The only reason I drop one star from this review is because the service, while friendly and usually good, is sometimes slow.  That is probably because they are so popular, and good.  Everything I've had there in the 3 or 4 times I've been has been either good or excellent.  The one soup, (sweet) hot & sour is stellar.  Have not tried the pho yet...
author: Darrin C.

description: I recently discovered this restaurant i am obessesd with the beef pho # 11 it's divine also the spring rolls I'm looking forward to going for dinner as so far I've been getting it to go the staff is very nice and friendly
author: lyn m.

description:
This is the place to go if you like authentic Vietnamese Fusion food.
From the Rack of Lambs to the regular bowl of Pho , you can tell that its all made from the freshest ingredients. The waitresses and waiters were very helpful when it came to comforting us and helping us chose what tasted great and also appeared to be visually pleasurable.Having this being my second time ( once lunch and once dinner) i would without a doubt come again to try the new flavors that are changed after lunch and dinner.In fact i may go again some time soon.
 
                                                          -Andy L.
author: Andy L.

description:
The Hue pho was bland as can be.  It tasted like nothing.  The beef pho, however, was pretty solid.

So I've mixed feelings about this place right now.
author: Pin K.

description: Great service, prices, and food! Their pho is the best I've had in the city. go, gO, GO!!!!!
author: Tasha S.

description:
I love love love this place.  I've been heading here for the past few months for weekend pho, and always hope to be recognized by the waitstaff for my 'off the menu' order (beef pho without beef balls or tendon)...
that hasn't happened yet, but I have yet to try a bad dish on their menu.  I recommend the calamari if you're into apps, but even just the entrees are filling and tasty.
author: Ruth P.

description: I love the atmosphere-peaceful and healing-and the location is perfect! I sat alone at the table savoriering every bite! So much clean flavor! Totally recommend.
author: DeDe D.

description:
I love this place! This family run restaurant has great food and friendly service. The place is cute, cozy and very welcoming. Another plus- it's also very affordable. Best part was the amazing food. Everything we ate was delicious. 

Some items you should give a try (outside of the typical imperial rolls and pho noodle soups):

Beef Carpaccio- Thinly sliced raw beef marinated in a flavorful tangy fish sauce mixture, topped with cilantro, peanuts, fried shallots and thinly sliced red onion. It's a great way to start off a meal since it's not too heavy and full of flavor.

Lamb Chops- I don't even like lamb, but they had great flavor and were nice and juicy. It had this It has the chewy consistency of sticky rice but with the nice crunch to it. 

Sea bass - Drool. . . so flaky and moist. It melted in my mouth. The glass vermicelli noodles underneath soaked in all the delicious flavor. Truly mouth watering- definitely the stuff that dreams are made of.
  
I had a great experience. I'll definitely be coming back again.
author: Anne Y.

description:
Best Vietnamese restaurant ever!!!
Had the rack of lamb with the sticky rice.. Recommended
So delicious will come back again. Everything was so cheap and good. Need I say more
author: Danny D.

description: I still think this place is so, so amazing. It never lets me down and I come here several times a month. The same two guys who work there all the time work so hard, the food is consistent, the decor is pleasant and clean, and it's cheap!! They have the best vegetarian pho ever, and their green papaya salad is delicious to boot. I love it, long live Jasmine Garden!
author: Laura M.

description:
Outstanding Vietnamese!  Great service, great food, surprisingly reasonable prices.  Great, authentic southern-style pho, but much nicer than your typical noodle house.  Full silver, linens, uniformed staff, etc - which is appropriate since they also have more upscale Vietnamese dishes like dancing beef (filet mignon), table-flambeed meat for the Imperial rolls, and awesome steamed seabass.  

I used to go out of town to get good pho for lunch, but was thrilled to find this place right in town - Half-block from Church Muni stop.  And since they have a full menu and decent wine list, it's great for dinner too.
author: Chase P.

description:
It was very good... except... 
I moved here from San Jose, in the land of a hundred different pho places in every neighborhood. The food here was very impressive and tasty. Great springs rolls and sauces. But I went specifically for the pho and was not impressed like I thought I would be. The broth was fatty and rich. VERY RICH. the flavor was good but you got tired of it after 10 minutes. If you're like me, and you eat all parts of the pho, this might not be your place. The presentation of the food is adorable though.
I'll go back, but for the food. Not the soup. Still on the hunt for my neighborhood pho spot.
Side note, the environment is cozy and visually pretty. Its a closed in store, which is nice, but they really needed music playing, because I was listening to everyones conversations, pretty much.
author: Dana F.

description:
one of the BEST vietnamese i've ever had. 
oh ya.
last night was my 2nd time to go.... 
their vegetarian options seems falls short, since the option would be substituting meat with tofu and eggplant, very predictable.

i was expecting a chicken substitute (with their chicken nuggets clay pot)... i want to! maybe they have to get those meatless nuggets substitute from rainbow.  lol other than that, it's great! the sauce was goooooodnessnesss... calamari was crazy good too! and the imperial rolls is crazy good! yay

my first visit wasnt disappointing, on the other hand. had the crispy noodles (vegetarian). TRES TRES DELISSSSH! 

if you're non-vegetarian (carnivore), have the dancing beef. fillet mignon topped with fries. not sure what it taste like but i feel that it is.
author: Marc K.

description:
Really as good as it gets. 

I ordered the claypot special and it was oh-so-crunchy and fresh and delicious and tasty and ohhhh.... so good.

The service is beyond any other. Fast, friendly, and clean. All the lunch menu is between $7 and $8.50. Less than a block from the muni stop. Canot wait to come again!
author: Becky J.

description:
Best pho I've ever had. And consistently so. 

I wouldn't call myself a pho expert. I sort of rediscovered it at Jasmine Garden a couple of years ago. But since then, I've tried the pho at a number of other places here in SF and elsewhere. Nothing quite matches Jasmine Garden. 

I always get the No. 9. It's a big bowl, with fresh, high-quality ingredients in the right amounts, and the key as always is the broth.

Before I started getting the pho, I had some other things here, and they were all excellent. The imperial rolls are superb. 

Plus, the service is good and the staff is genuinely charming and friendly.
author: D. L.

description: I have eaten here many times and it has some good eats.  I would recommend their rice dishes tho... the pho is not all that and they skimp on the fresh veggies (sprouts, basil, peppers etc.)
author: Peter N.

description: Peter the Pho Nazi refused to serve me Pho one cold night!  Pho injustice!!!
author: Anthony J.

description:
this is a follow up  to the quick tips (yes, plural) that i posted while at this POS establishment.  i feel the need to post this review as a public service announcement.

we came in here on a thursday night at approx 735PM.  the place was busy but not so packed that it made me want to leave.  plus, we were only going to order take out.  in case you don't know the definition of take out, let me help you out http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/takeout .  from experience, take out is quick...but apparently, i have lived 29.994 mislead years in the land of rainbows and unicorns.  because i totally got schooled at jasmine garden.  here's how the shit rolled...

we approached the older waiter (who will be referred to as old dude throughout this review) and tried to place our take out order.  i wanted the #23, rice plate with bbq pork and whatnot and the man friend wanted the eggplant with beef rice plate.  when i told old dude i wanted the #23 old dude goes "what?!" and proceeds to take the menu out of the man friend's hand.  damn, rudeness!!! (quick tip #1)  all you had to do was ask!  what happened to customer service?  i asked if i can pay for the food, old dude snaps and says "no! later. too confusing".  wtf?  you don't want my money?  this turns out to be a blessing.  will go back to this in a bit.  moving on...

man friend and i waited inside for bit admiring the awesome decor/lighting, watched several tables who arrived after us get seated, watched more people come in and order take out...we went out to smoke...you know just killing time while waiting for our food.  im thinking, "man, this place must be good.  we can't wait to eat!"  i mean, that's why people go to restaurants right??  WRONG AGAIN!!!  because 45 fucking minutes of my life that i'll never get back later, we still didn't have our food!  it's a little ridfuckindiculous when the table of four who got seated AFTER we placed our order was almost finished with their meal.  people who came in AFTER we did for take out had already gotten their food!  i mean, seriously old dude, you've walked by us 8000 times by now and it didn't occur to you in the slightest that we're sitting here for a reason?  because the tacky purple christmas lights sure as hell isn't the reason why we're there!

as patient and well-mannered as man friend and i are, 45+ facking minutes for take out is a little ridonkulous (quick tip #2).  finally man friend said something and old dude goes "two minutes", but he must've been operating on asian time because we still didn't have our food 120 seconds later.  my hunger induced bitchface could no longer be contained so i finally asked the grumpy old dude where our food is and that it's been 45+ fucking minutes.  old dude looks at me and says "that's because you ordered bbq pork."  SAY WHAT?!?!?!  oh so now it's MY FAULT for ordering something that's on your menu?!  maybe you should have a fucking disclaimer next to item #23 that it'll take 45+ asian time minutes to prepare!  fuck face.

i'm so irritated, hungry, and livid by now that we decided to leave.  the only positive notes to this shitastic waste of time was that old dude didn't want to take my money when I wanted to pay, which allowed us to just walk the eff out and that man friend and i got a good laugh out of it later.

btw, we ended up going to red jade http://www.yelp.com/biz/red-jade-restaurant-san-francisco , ordered take out and got our food in 10 minutes.  that's how it's done, son!
author: Sally T.

description: Been here twice recently and feel it necessary to review. Yumzers. I've gotten the same thing twice so I can only attest to it. It's eggplant/tofu/hoison combo with a side of rice. I'm not sure what kind of eggplant they use but it is of the smaller and plumper and delicious kind. If you order a drink, it comes in a radical glass that's like a foot and a half high off the table and it makes me feel regal. The decor is pleasant. The videos of women traditionally (?) dancing are charming and I found myself lost in them. The waitress was wonderful and funny. More peeps should know about this gem. Oh and the check serving trays are abacuses, or abacii?, either way, they are yaaaaa cool!
author: David A.

description:
I love a good bowl of pho or bun bo hue when the weather's a bit chilly... but I'm a Mission resident, and therefore deigned with few options, most notably Sunflower, on 16th and Valencia. I find myself often reluctantly lurching over to Sunflower for my pho fix, and leaving later feeling only... marginally satisfied, perhaps even a bit guilty, but full enough to be quelled until my next pho attack.
Enter Jasmine Garden. Chow and Home are my usual go-to places when my parents are in town, but a few days ago they would just not have it. Tired of Western pasta and salad options, they wanted something delicious, soupy, and... well, Asian. I informed them sadly that, although the Mission was filled with all sorts of ethnic goodies, they strongly lacked in the Vietnamese and Chinese department. They sighed, seemed to give up, and we were on our way once again to Home when... what's this little street behind Home? Have passed by Jasmine probably a thousand times but in our desperation for something else we took one look at the menu, the prices, and the waft of lemongrass and thought, this is it.
The $6.75 bun bo hue was so satisfying--this is what I've been looking for in the Mission!!! This may be as or less authentic than Sunflower (Jasmine may be a hidden gem, but it's not the hole in the wall you would expect, a strangely classier place; on a more technical review of the dish, the bun was much thinner than normally used, they had no blood cubes or pieces of ham, but I actually prefer it that way), but damn is it good, hyphenated American or not! Spicy, fragrant, and super hot, it was just what I had dreamed of, plus a little more. Dad got the satay noodles, also excellent albeit not really traditional and a tad sweeter than expected, but still good. Mom went for the regular pho, and although the meat was a little less and not as delicately cut as its done in some of our favorite San Jose Vietnamese haunts, it was still quite good--that broth, most excellent!
Sunflower, good bye. Jasmine, hello!
author: Jessica L.

description: Don't be put off by the slightly tacky decor, this is a hidden jewel. The staff is very very friendly and warm, I usually get hugs when I go. The menu is expansive and everything I've had is very good. Some standouts: beef carpaccio that is fresh, large, and delicious. The pho is fabulous, especially the seafood one. The Dancing Beef (Filet Mignon sauteed in garlic, etc) is one of the best things I've had to eat at restaurants. Best of all, the place is very, very reasonably priced.
author: Leo D.

description:
I have been to Jasmin Garden for at least 3 times. It never disappointed me. Everything on the menu is so delicious!!!

Basil Chicken/Beef, Dancing Beef, Claypot special, Bo Tai Chanh(raw beef salad) are all amazing!!
You have to try Banana with ice cream and Mango sticky rice it you love sweets...so good!

The staff are very friendly and nice, Last time I went, I forgot to take my purse home. I didn't even notice that I left my purse there until someone rang the doorbell around 10pm....yeah, a guy who works at Jasmin Garden brought it back to me. That was super nice of him! 

I will definitely go back again and again and again!
author: Lavinia W.

description: On the outside, this place appears to be a dinky Chinese restaurant but once you walk inside, this place has a very nice decor. The staff is very attentive. Of course I had to order the Beef Carpaccio and it was well worth it. All the different flavors and seasonings danced in my mouth. The food to follow was nothing short of my expectations set from the beef. The clear noodles with shrimp and scallops was really good and I'd definitely recommend it. I also had the hot and sour soup and the catfish in the claypot. The catfish was good although it was some trouble picking out the bones in the fish. It was good but I don't know if I'd order it again. The soup was good if you like hot and sour. We ordered 4 items and they were all $10 or less.. what a deal! The only thing that was $15+ was the seafood section. And there is so much more variety on the menu. Will definitely come back to try them!
author: Sophia K.

description: We wandered in here one night when our nearby (and very beloved) Ike's was out of chicken.  We had the pho.  It was delish, the service was very friendly and the bathroom was uber clean.  Aaaaaaaaand, they deliver.  Holler at your Sunday hangover cure.  Football & pho on your couch.  Totes works.
author: Emily T.

description:
My favorite dishes at Jasmine Garden!  5 Stars!

Egg roll -  Excellent
Sea Bass - Delicious
Dancing Beef - so Yummy
Beef Carpaccio - a Must Order
Rack of Lamb - Best on Earth
Garlic Crab - OMG!  Ever since we had the garlic crab here, we stopped going to Crustacean.

Price is very decent and service of course, 5 BIG STARS!  :)
author: Maggie L.

description: Pretty good Pho at a decent price. Think a basic Pho place fancied up a bit.
author: X O.

description: TOO EXPENSIVE!  I ordered chicken with noodles, with imperial rolls. Such a disappointment. A tiny hand full of small bits of chicken. They looked like the left over bits, when you cook a whole chicken in the pan. Two small imperial rolls that tasted like NOTHING! Most of this dish was composed of the noodles, which are dirt cheap to buy and make. I also ordered basil chicken. Mostly rice, and again, a handful of chicken.  I didn't order desert, I didn't want to see how little I would get again. The only nice thing about this place is the way it looks inside, but by the amount of cash they charge, I'm not surprised it looks good.
author: Gabriel T.

description: I tried Jasmine Garden for the first time tonight based on what the fellow Yelpers had to say; they served me well.  Definitely order the Sea Bass Garlic Noodles, yum!  I went ahead and ordered the Salt & Pepper Shrimp too, also a fantastic dish.  I felt like a veggie so I ordered the Cabbage Salad w/o the shrimp to serve as my salad.  All the dishes were a fantastic treat.  I will definitely order take-out from them again and again.  Get some!
author: Keith B.

description: Good food, decent price, friendly service, 'nuf said!
author: Andrea S.

description:
Yelpers....my list of problems for today: 1. I am feeling very sick today 2. I'm stuck at work (can't use any sick days because I've used them all up on my pretend sick days) 3. I am extremely hungry and finally 4. I only have $10 dollars in my bank account....(dude, payday is not until Wednesday). Where can a brotha find some comfort soup to heal me of my sickness and hunger?? 

JASMINE GARDEN!!! 

My co-worker said this was a good place to eat when your broke and sick or vise versa. Yelpers, you have got to try their #10 (their Vietnamese version of chicken noodle soup). I'm used to having bowl size options when I order Pho but this place has only Large as an option. So beware, if your ordering soup it's coming in a large bowl. The waiters were very attentive and always filled up my water just as my glass was reaching it's half empty (or half full, how ever you want to look at it) level. Great place for lunch...quick service and very polite. 

3 stars - only because this was the first time I ate here and don't forget, I am sick....tastebuds kinda outta whack.
author: dave s.

description: SO YUMMY! The staff is wonderful and they have super good veggie options.
author: Mani W.

description: I'm a pho lover.  I have an obsession.  I also happen to have a friend who shares my obsession so we always go here.  I guess you could say we're regulars by now.  The owners know exactly what we want when we walk in (we're creatures of habit) and promptly place the order.  They are always refilling our water constantly throughout our mean (a must if you like it really spicy) and are just overall really pleasant.  The place is super clean so don't let the exterior fool you.
author: Whitney A.

description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!! Not only is the food HELLA good, the people who runs the spot makes the experience even worth it. The hospitality is a 6 stars and the food is made with LOVE! Very fresh and just so tasteful!! MY FAV: Roasted crab... thee effin BEST!! Better then Thanh long and PF Chang... yeah I said it... BETTER!! Also, I recommend the Beef Carpaccio, Seabass with the garlic noodles, dancing beef, grilled lamb and the dessert deep fried bananas with the homemade coconut ice cream!! YES HOMEMADE coconut ice cream!!
author: Jennifer S.

description: Awesome place, super fresh and delicious! The calamari are to die for, probably the best I ever eaten, servers are very attentive and nice! I will go again for sure.
author: Rositsa K.

description: This place has solid pho, and I've been there a number of times. It bothers me a little that I have to ask for the menu that includes pho, though. I've tried the spicy beef (Bun Bo Hue)  pho and the regular (Pho Dac Biet) pho and prefer the latter a little more. The staff is wonderful and prices are reasonable.
author: Eric M.

description: I'm giving 5 stars but grading on a curve for Vietnamese restaurants.  In other words, I'm not saying this is haute cuisine.  I AM saying that it is among the better Vietnamese joints out there for Asian comfort food.
author: Joseph S.

description: Great Pho at this restaurant, the bowls were huge, the broth flavorful, and delicious beef. Everyone at the table had Pho, so I can't talk about their other dishes, but we will definitely be back. Ambiance was nice, with white tablecloths, and the food was cheap!
author: Jamie B.

description: I was impressed by their presentation, excellent service, and affordable prices.  I ordered a huge bowl of pho for $6.75, and my cousin ordered the bun which was equally a bargain.  It's a twenty-second walk from the Church Street underground station (thirty if harassed by riffraff), but it was a little tricky finding it the first time (make sure you're on the side of 14th that's west of Church Street.
author: Andrea U.

description: Don't let the exterior fool you.  It looks like a typical Vietnamese noodle joint that probably sports an inspection score of no more than 75....but alas, you walk inside to probably one of the cleanest pho houses in the city.  The menu is small but still authentic with extremely decent prices.  Way to go Jasmine, your garden is well maintained.
author: Brent N.

description: I have to admit that the only thing I've had here is the Spicy Beef Pho. I think it's #11. It is AMAZING!!!  The broth is unbelievably flavorful. I can't get enough. I keep going thinking I'll break out of my rut and try one of the other wonderful looking dishes but I can't do it! I'm an addict.
author: Jenny L.

description: Decided to give this place another shot...feeling risky. And I was pleasantly surprised. I got the crunchy roll that someone had yelped about and it was delicious. An imperial roll wrapped in a fresh spring roll. Novel idea, and fun to try. I definitely recommend it
author: Brittany T.

description: Bad Service, I went four weeks ago because I wanted PHO and sunflower was very busy but I had to meet a friend so my time line was being challenged. I went to Jasmine Garden and everyone was running around like a chicken with its head cut off but I was patient. After we were finally sat we ordered I ordered the Veg PHO and my friend order shrimp fried noodle dish we also ordered a appetizer and our meal. We ate the appetizer and the shrimp dish came so we waited and waited for my PHO after 10 in we asked about it and I thought well maybe they forgot to put the order in. I was patient and understanding so it finally came out and I ate through my friends shrimp dish the waiter came out with the PHO and offered it to another table I spoke out and said it was mine but the server went back to the kitchen with it. I was starting to get angry. Then it came back out to our table with no apology or reason as I sat there the other guest were being asked if everything was OK which made me feel less of a guest in the restaurant.  The server didn't come or wouldn't come to our table but for a fast run by with water, it was an experience. I wont come back.
author: RICHARD J.

description: Best pho and crunchy spring rolls in San Francisco. Love this place! The owner is also always very nice. Great for takeout as the restaurant itself can be a bit kitschy/distracting. The LED Christmas lights year-round and Vietnamese food TV reels take away from the incredible meal in front of you.
author: Christina G.

description:
This new place I have learned about is SO good! I have had several dishes that I love - yesterday was the Clay Pot. Well done!

The atmosphere is a relaxed neighborhood style restaurant. The owner is so nice. She remembers what I ordered in the past and makes recommendations based on my tastes.

Really glad it's down the street from my house - a new favorite lunch and dinner destination for my Vietnamese food desires.
author: Jimmy M.

description:
This place is a fantastic little gem hidden on upper market.  I am a pho whore, and I have to say Jasmine Garden's pho is quite tasty (but of course not as good as mom's or grandma's).  Don't worry about the weird stuff being in there like tripe or tendon - the pho comes with the rare beef, brisket, and beef balls. 

A must have that's not on the menu - the crunch rolls.  Every time I go to a Vietnamese restaurant, it's a battle between whether to get the spring rolls or egg rolls, but the crunch roll solves all my problems.  Imagine an egg roll stuffed within a spring roll with some grilled pork inside.  AMAZING.

Don't bother with the Bun Bo Hue and Bun Rieu.  The Bun Bo Hue is not spicy whatsoever and has an overwhelming flavor - lemongrass?  The Bun Rieu also lacks flavor.  The noodles were extremely soggy in both.
author: Melissa P.

description: THis is the place to go if you are looking for PHO ! so very tasty here.. there are not a lot of great places in the city to find good PHO but i love it here. and the prices cant be beat. you can walk away from this place feeling like you wont eat for a week and you pay very little. its amazing.
author: A R.

description: Yeah no this place sucks in many, many ways. First of all, why do they not have their Pho on the menu? Secondly, crepe and Sate noodles were greasier than any Vietnamese place I've ever been to. Thirdly, don't even touch their sour soup with catfish (filled with little hard bones) and the broth caused nausea in everyone who ate it. Fourthly, nice freakin' weak tea... Charge me 7.50 for a tea bag for three people? Fifthly, yu people love the vegetarian spring rolls? Wtf are you from? You poor deprived, lacking-in-any-culinary-experience people. I couldn't even identify what was in there that had the mouthfeel of eating dried, crushed spiders with a little sand thrown in. Service is pushy and very unfriendly unless you apparently frequent there. Wtf kind of place is this??? I can't even imagine why this place has 4.2 stars on yelp!!! If this place has four stars, Sunflower has 10!!!! I'm so sorry I cheated on you Sunflower for a place closer to my house! I will never do it again! this place Sucks, Sucks, Sucks, Sucks!
author: Ethan T.

description:
Jasmine Garden is one of those restaurants that has a lot of potential to be more than what it's trying to be. A lot of people kept asking about 'Will's, since this is the previous location. I don't really have anything bad to say about the food-cause it was delicious.

Now, I love divey, dicey, cheap Vietnamese restaurants. Saigon Sandwich, PPQ and the random place at Taravel and 19th have my love for $3.50 bahn mi, $5.50 pho and for having 4 star delicious food at 1.5 star prices. They also have curry noodle stew...mmmm...curry. 

Jasmine is more along the vein of Slanted Door; trying to be more upscale with pretty traditionally cooked dishes. We had the chicken shrimp crepe; a crisply fried coconut milk, rice flour, eggy pancake stuffed with meat, bean sprouts and served with fresh herbs, red leaf lettuce and nuoc cham. This was sooo good. The crepe was perfect and they gave us a ton of basil, mint, rau ram, lettuce and some shredded carrots. Reasonably priced at $7.50 and big enough for a meal. 
We also had the caramel claypot chicken (which is charmingly called chicken 'nuggets' on the menu) which came with a steamy hot sauce that included; basil, garlic, dried chili peppers and onions. The chicken ended up being sliced breast meat. We also got a huge steamer of jasmine rice. Yay for Asians. 
Fried bananas are the 'lumpia' version, wrapped with coconut shreds in eggroll wrappers and fried-but it's also the largest serving of ice cream we've ever gotten. Total bill was around $30 for two. 

So the food is great, the service is totally attentive, polite and professional (I brought my coffee cup in and they didn't give me shit about it), what's my beef? The HUGE tv mounted in the upper front wall of the business playing Vietnamese karaoke videos. While it can actually turn into a conversation piece, ("What are they doing? Ooh, she's MARRIED!" or "Wow, that sucks, her parents are totally trying to matchmake her with that OTHER guy in front of her boyfriend." or "Sepia tone means they're in love."), it's pretty distracting. The neon lit specials menu is also sort of funky. It's a VERY minimal critique. I'm sorry for people that love this place; except for the tv, Jasmine Garden was pretty romantic. 

I'd go back to try the other dishes ($3.50 for garlic noodles? score) that people have recommended, but not before I hit up my ghettofabulous spots for curry beef pho.
author: Alexis W.

description: Love the food and service here. Seems very authentic Vietnamese, though I have never been to Vietnam myself. Had the rolls as well as the salmon salad (new item) and the side veg dishes are all part of my favorite. Have not had the Pho yet, but if its anything like the rest of their menu, it will definitely be worthwhile. This is my favorite Vietnamese place in SF for sure!
author: Lisa S.

description:
yummmmmmmmm, delishhhhhhhh, d'lightful and d'lovely.
had a birthday dinner here, they gave me an orchid.  we had a ten people, lots of wine and beer, and great food.  everyone liked everything that came out, and the total was $36 each, tip included!  Left the place full, tipsy, and totally satisfied.  It's kind of like a cross between Slanted Door and  Than Long (the garlic noodle/roast crab place in the sunset), but better because the staff is nice, the prices are reasonable, and it's an easy location to get to.  The food was just fantastic.  Will be back again and again.
author: Aimee L.

description: Wow. I had my doubts about pho. I always focused on the idea that traditional pho is made with bits of animals with which I'd rather not be acquainted. However, I got the seafood pho and the broth was heavenly, briny but with bright fresh herbs and well-cooked seafood. The waiter was super-friendly and attentive and you really can't beat the price and portion size.
author: SJ P.

description: I specifically went after reading the Yelp reviews, but I really can't trust them any more.  The food was heavy on sauce and seasoning but didn't taste fresh (I didn't bother to finish the catfish although usually I finish everything on my plate just because it was the way I was raised).  Nothing was memorable, and the bill was high for an Asian restaurant.  The decor was certainly not to my taste.  If people think this restaurant is good then I feel sorry for this neighborhood.
author: Berliner W.

description: I never had the chance to eat here while it was called Will's, but my sister took me here for an early dinner a while ago. The staff was incredibly friendly and the service was just superb. My sister had the pho dac biet (beef noodle soup) and I had the com tay cam dac biet (combination rice claypot), both delicious and reasonably priced at $6-8. I never would have guessed the atmosphere to be so clean and kempt from the outside. While Jasmine Garden may have the appearance of an "American" fine dining establishment, the flavors are still Asian and made the traditional way.
author: S. D.

description: I love this place, the staff is very friendly, it's always relatively quiet and mellow place, every out of towner I've brought here has loved it. Highlights include beef carpaccio - served on this long elegant plate covered in jalapenos and thinly sliced purple onions, crispy shrimp filled pancakes (called Banh Xeo), and pineapple tomato soup (canh chua). I hope this family makes it because we need better restaurants at Church and Market. If the spring rolls don't win you over, you are a hater.
author: Steve B.

description: wasn't bad, just forgettable. can't even remember this meal well enough to write an honest review.
author: jesus g.

description: The food just wasn't that good.  I was really hoping it would be good, since there aren't really any other Vietnamese places in the neighborhood.  The service was attentive, but they had techno music blaring and the result ambience was plain odd.  I had high hopes for the food too. I love Aux Delices in Russian/Nob Hill and I was hoping this place would be similar.  The portions were tiny.  For 3 of us we ordered 3 entrees and none of us were very full.  The basil beef tasted okay, but nothing spectacular.  Same with the catfish claypot.  Decent, but no where near the quality fo Aux Delices.  I won't be back.
author: Joann C.

description:
this restaurant has it all... EXCELLENT food, FANTASTIC service, and AFFORDABLE prices. 

Kelly is just one of the kindest people I've ever met, her husband is just as amicable.

Especially now with the new hours of operation, is even better!

Cheers!
author: Alex K.

description: i've been twice and the first time was so good i ordered the same thing on my subsequent visit.  the spicy lemongrass beef noodle soup is just rich enough without muting the ethereal citrus flavor.  it's a wildly complex, spicy and aromatic broth with undertones of fish sauce, chili oil, cilantro and basil.  the hearty slices of beef, noodles and crunchy cabbage (i request bean sprouts instead) create great contrasting texture and make the dish a very satisfying meal all on it's own.  i crave this soup like a blanket when it's damp and chilly.
author: Justin K.

description:
I have made it a point recently to try every decent and "somewhat clean" Pho place in SF and this place ranks near or at the top. VERY tasty bowl of seafood Pho with just the right amount of just about everything. Some places overdo it with the noodles, or slop too much low grade fish products in there...but this place had the perfect mix. The seafood was higher quality than usual and the all-important broth was very nice and not too greasy. Me lady friend had the Pho Ga with lemongrass infusion that was definitely very tasty. I will actually go away from regular programming and get what she ordered next time it was that good.

We started off with some very plump and tasty spring rolls as we always do and they were a great start to the meal. Only setback is the place was relatively empty and the service was pretty slow and unresponsive. Lets be honest here though, service is not what makes or breaks a Pho restaurant! The location of the restaurant itself is not all that great with limited parking options usually, but worth the effort.

As for the overall eating experience this place was great and I will definitely be back here again when I am hungover...or just plain hungry.
author: The M.

description: Great Vietnamese food! It's a clean restaurant with friendly service and awesome Vietnamese food. The prices are reasonable and the selection is great & the food is awesome....it's a great location too and not a huge place but a good size so you can bring a group of friends to eat out. I def recommend this place if you're craving some yummy Vietnamese :)
author: Kimberly R.

description: Loved it! The imperial rolls were tasty, the thai iced tea was delicious, and the pho--of course--was solid.
author: Roman N.

description: Speedy delivery, Dancing Beef was excellent and spring rolls tasted fresh with good balance of flavor and textures. All around great experience
author: Bradley S.

description: Rice was dry, shrimp was overcooked, clay pot catfish tasted muddy. Service was awfully slow.  It was my  worst dining experience. I am so surprised  this place got four stars! Wait staff did not seem to care.
author: Tomoko K.

description: I can thank a good friend for pointing me to this place.  The interior is clean, and nicely decorated.  Jasmine garden is a step up from some other vietnamese places we frequent, but the prices are comparable!  The sugar cane shrimp "do it yourself" rolls are delicious, and the sugar cane in cut nice and thin, so it doesn't take iron jaws to chew through.  my mi sate was nicely seasoned and sauced, but I would have liked a few more shrimp.  Hubby's pork bbq pho was delicious and he said the pork was perfect.  Beer here is pretty cheap, and the water they serve is infused with cucumber and basil, yum!  One note, there was no music, and the place was very quiet, I felt like I needed to whisper in order to keep our conversation private.  I appreciate a mellow atmosphere, but I needed some more background noise to be fully comfortable here.  I'll still be back though!
author: Lauren M.

description: One of the FRESHEST and BEST tasting vietnamese places I have been to. The staff are always friendly and more than willing to assist in any way they can. Prices are excellent for the amount of food served. Two people at lunch can easily share one entree and an appetizer such as the beef carpaccio (which is amazing here).
author: Bonifatius B.

description: The restaurant has a nice clean vibe, but the food is lacking "LOVE"... We ordered the spring rolls with shrimp, and peanut sauce, chicken Pho, and veggie Pho. The shrimp rolls were not the freshest tasting I've had, and the sauce was also lacking the smooth consistency I've had at other restaurants. The Pho broth on both were very salty. Too salty to finish. I really wanted to like this place... Asthetically the place is fine, the food, not so much...
author: AL B.

description: Their delivery service is awesome!  The Beef Pho was yummmmy!  The garlic noodles with Sea Bass is also great!  The delivery service is fast and the food is very well packed.  Always my fall back place when I'm sick and don't want to step out.
author: Rosh C.

description:
I have been a frequent visitor to this neighborhood location through its various incarnations over the last decade.  As Mingo's the food was OK, the last owner Will pushed it to the next level and under Kelly and crew's current ownership this place has become excellent.  We eat here at least twice a month and always look forward to our next visit.

If I had to summarize Jasmine Garden to a friend I would call it a friendly neighborhood gem with excellent traditional and fusion vietnamese fare and a slightly upscale feel.

First off, the current owner Kelly is a complete sweetheart and we are always glad to see her welcoming smile and catch up with her and talk about our dish line up for the day.  We also enjoy visiting with her brother who manages things up front.

The restaurant decor is tasteful and the things are always very clean.

We have worked our way through most of the menu and we have not found a dish that wasn't to our liking.  Some of our top recommended favorites include:

Crunch roll: A combination of a fresh and fried spring roll provided an extremely crunch texture and a wonderful vibrant pallete of sweet, sour, salty, and herb flavors.

Vietnamese crepe:  A crispy tasty wok fried egg/flour shell filled with vegetables, chicken and shrimp.  Eaten wrapped in romaine lettuce with herbs and vegetables.  The vegetarian version is my wife's favorite.

Flaming Bowl:  A playful make your own spring roll dish where the main feature is marinated beef, shrimp, and shallots flaingly cooked with light rum at your table!  Served with soft spring roll wrappers and a plate piled high with thin sliced veggies and herbs.  My favorite! 

Pho:  The old standby is wonderfully made with very nicely flavored broth, perfectly textured noodles, tasty bits of meet, and all of the good vegetables and herbs.  A rainy day favorite.

Jasmine garden my not have the outright "best" version of any one dish in the city but the combination of the broad range of excellent dishes, extremely friendly service, and good ambiance makes this one of a select handful of neighborhood gems that can count me as a devoted regular.
author: Rob B.

description: I went there with my boyfriend for dinner and the food was exceptional. Spring Rolls are to die for, with soft rice wrapper and crispy fillings.  Chicken Salad was perfectly blended with white meat and finely diced cabbage, peanuts and golden brown fried garlic.  The curried salmon with asparagus and bokchoy served on a banana leaf was cooked to perfection and delicious. The owner is super friendly and service was decent (I'm told it has improved from before)
author: Yew-Hoe T.

description: 4 stars for the pho!!  I only gave 4 starts because I have yet to go to the restaurant, but they delivered to us (we are a little far, so I don't know if it will happen again), and it was worth the wait!  The broth itself is very flavorful, and after adding sauces and spices it was even better.  Nothing like some pho when you are feeling sick!
author: Sonia S.

description: Since moving to San Francisco from New York 9 months ago, I have been searching high and low for a Vietnamese restaurant that i can call my own and I FINALLY found it! Jasmin Garden has it all - amazing food (crispy pork roll, pho, claypot, etc..) and amazing service. I love Kelly, the owner, who knows me by my name just after two visits and gives me a big hug every time I go there. It really is a hidden gem and now my boyfriend and I go there every weekend! Actually, headed out to it right now~
author: Jenny S.

description: Great service, pho and beer, what more could you be looking for in a restaurant?
author: Richard B.

description: Like everyone else, stopped in looking for Will's.  Found this place instead - we actually went on their first day open.  The service was very friendly.  Waiter suggested curry-fried rice - very good.  We also had the BBQ pork rolls to start - also good, but  a little lacking in the amount of pork. The lemon grass chicken - not so good.  The chicken was really dry.  But the salmon dish (on the back page of the menu) was very good.  I would return for that - not the lemon grass chicken.  They should have their liquor license by now too.
author: Bobbi C.

description: This place is great. The food is so yummy. The front of house guy is really friendly. They deliver too!
author: Charmagne L.

description: i tried this place for the first time. i originally wanted to order delivery but their phone had a busy signal for hours ... so i got my lazy arse off the sofa to go get take out. excellent service. the lady is really nice and friendly. ordered the imperial rolls, garlic noodles w/ shrimp, and the basil tofu. all were pretty subpar for various reasons. the only dish i actually finished were the imperial rolls. i'm sorry, but i was mislead by all of the 4-5 star reviews on here. perhaps their pho is spectacular, and perhaps i'll give the pho a shot some time, but as for entrees, i was pretty dissapointed with the ones i got. way better vietnamese options in the city - unfortunately not in my neighbourhood though.
author: James J.

description: Good, but agreed with other yelpers, a little pricey.  The cha gio is served traditionally with vermicelli noodles, pickeled veggies, and lettuce to wrap.  $6.50 is a bit pricey, but I've paid the same or more and was not nearly as satisfied.  Overall a good dish.  The banh xeo was also as close to traditional as I've had in Vietnam. Was crispy and had a lot of flavor.  The only complaint was that the chicken was a little dry.  Moving on to the entrees.  We got the Pho Ga and Papaya salad.  Both pretty good.  The papaya salad with shrimp was excellent with the pho ga being tasty but not 100% traditional.  It was served with shredded chicken not sliced.  Looks like more chicken w/o being so.  The broth just didnt have the tradtional pho taste of star anise,cinnamon, and cardamon. None the less tasty.  On another occasion we got the garlic noodles.  Very good and def worth the $3.50.  Pass on the garlic butter fried rice at $3.00.  Not worth it even at that price.  I absolutely love vietnamese food and have found this place to be one of the better restaurants in the city.   Looking forward on tasting some more of their food in the near future.
author: K B.

description: We have eaten here often over the last year and they even catered a party for us and everybody we  have introduced to this place is utterly charmed by the whole experience.Great food, beguiling atmosphere and  excellent service. It's even reasonably priced ! I am so happy that we live  in a neighborhood with such a restaurant.
author: Roger G.

description: This place has excellent pho. The broth is different than that of other pho spots I've tried, I think because it has more garlic. Whatever it is, I'm down. The staff could have been a little friendlier and a little more efficient in finding us a table.
author: David S.

description: We had our engagement party here!  Since we had about 40-50 guests, David & Kelly offered to shut down their restaurant just for us!  They were so helpful and kind throughout the whole planning process & even put up some decorations for us!  All of the food was delicious!!!  They were so generous with everything that even after all of our guests filled themselves up, everyone was able to pack up their very own to go boxes!  Our guests were so impressed with the food & the presentation!  We couldn't have been more pleased ourselves.  At the end of it all, we were also very pleased with the bill; extremely reasonable for the quality & quantity we received.  They even brought in extra staff to make sure the event ran smoothly.  Whether going to Jasmine Garden for a romantic date, a small dinner gathering with friends or a large event like ours, you'd be pleased all around, from the food to the ambiance to the service and the prices.  Thank you so much for everything David & Kelly!!!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: FAN-FREAKIN-TASTIC! Service is top-notch, completely unheard of in restaurants of this caliber. The food is DELICIOUS! The carpacio is bomb-diggity! YUM! Hope you like a little spicy, as there are chiles garnishing the dish. Everything was just terrific! Get the wok roasted crab, it's a must! A great addition to a crappy corner.
author: Michael S.

description: Kelly (the owner) will usually greet you with a sincere smile, David (the lead cook) always does a great job, and the whole staff are great!  Brought co-workers and friends here many times.  I love it!
author: Ken M.

description: This is not your typical vietnamese restaurant set in the Castro next to the bar on church.  I had a Mi Xao Don Hai San, which was surprisingly very well seasoned--not too salty and the consistency of the sauce was a happy medium between thick and runny.   The scallops were perfectly cooked, though the squid was overdone.  The presentation was also very impressive.  My friend had the Mi Toi Tom and I must admit that I had a hard time stomaching this.  The noodles were overcooked and soggy, while the shrimp was too dry.  Eating this left not only an unpleasant garlic taste in my mouth, but a queasy feeling in my stomach.  It appears the chef haphazardly threw together noodles, some garlic, fish sauce, soy sauce, and shrimp to cook and serve.  The wait staff was very slow at seating us, even though no one was there, and was quick to usher us out.  I'll have to come here on a better day to try another dish, but until then, only three stars.
author: Ben T.

description: The best Vietnamese in the city!  Found the place on Yelp about a year ago and have been coming here regularly with my wife.  We love this place.  Their veggie pho is great, make sure to ask for the lemongrass chili paste to spice it up!  They also have great fake 'meats.'  We had the dancing soy 'beef' last time which was very tasty!
author: Rajeev R.

description: Deeeeeeeeeee-lish! I have been feeling a bit under the weather since I got back from vegas... shocker... So my gay lover and I decided to hit up some pho and watch Grandma's Boy while snuggling under his brand new leopard print snuggie. If that's not the gayest thing you've ever heard, then i don't know what is ;) Anyhoo, I had the chicken pho and he had the veggie. Mine was absolutely excellent and he seemed just as delighted as peach pie with his! Be sure to add Sriracha sauce, good for the sinuses and good for the soul... probably not so good for ulcers, so know your ailments. I believe he ordered the Imperial Rolls (I'm not positive on the name), they had lettuce, some weird brown stuff and were wrapped in a "soft" rice paper wrapper of sorts. I put "soft" in quotes because, well, everything was just really chewy and tough and it had like no flava... even with the dippins... I haven't tried anything else yet, but am looking forward to it. If you have a hankerin for pho though, don't hesitate to get your pho-king ass to Jasmine Garden!!
author: Amanda S.

description:
I LOVE my Jasmine Garden.....it's becoming my "dining room" away from home!  Besides the food being at its best, the service couldn't be any better!!  First, the waiter greets you with a smile and then here comes his sister Kelly, the owner, the star of the show!  She's so full of personality & makes sure that you're comfortable & satisfied during your dining experience at their restaurant.  Behind the scene, from the kitchen, comes various aromas of sauces & spices of dishes off the menu that are prepared by the hands of Kelly & her husband.  Makes you want to join the other tables that are eating while waiting for your food to arrive. The saying "your eyes are bigger than your stomach" was written for me!  It never fails, I want to order everything on the menu.....and almost get away with it. One time, I was by myself & was craving roasted crab (which is to die for)......but then looked at the menu and the steamed sea bass was jumping all over the menu......and of course none of it can be eaten without the garlic noodles and a vegetable dish.  It was almost embarrassing as each dish was brought out & all the other tables with 2 or more people were starring at me sitting by myself.  I couldn't even act like I was waiting on anyone else.  Needless to say, I ate good the rest of the week on that order alone.  The moral to the story is "never go to the Jasmine Garden Restaurant when you're starving"!

Vera O.
S.F., Ca.
author: Vera O.

description: Great place, exceptional food quality, gerat value, extremely kind staff. Loved it, so glad it's i n my neighborhood!
author: Vic D.

description: greatest Vietnamese food I ever had especially things other than pho!
author: chuchu z.

description: Very uneven:  the beef pho was pretty good, the crepe appetizer was ok (a little burnt/dry), and the chicken in a clay pot was really bad (salty, dried out, chewy chicken...).  I'd probably for the pho again but probably not other dishes on its menu.
author: Shin C.

description: Had dinner last night with a couple friends at Jasmine Garden. We started with fresh rolls, which were exceedingly fresh. The rice paper was toothsome but soft at the same time. Didn't taste like the rolls were made ahead. The lettuce and herbs in the roll were crisp and aromatic. The Bun Bo Hue was very fragrant and flavorful; however, not the best I've had. They do not use the traditional thicker rice noodle; instead, they used vermicelli. It's just not the same. My friend had the Seafood Chow Fun which looked and smelled very good. I had a bite and noticed that the seafood was not the freshest. The service was very good. I will definitely be back to try other items on the menu.
author: J W.

description: Friends took my partner and myself to Jasmine Garden last night. It was great!  Everything tasted fresh and delicious. The crunchy spring rolls were wonderful. The food is presented beautifully and the atmosphere is warm and comfortable. And best of all it was only $65 for four. I will definitely go back.
author: Neil E.

description: I really like the restaurant and its staff.  This is probably the only edible Asian restaurant in the neighborhood.  Their dancing beef, crab, garlic noodle, clay pot, and imperial rolls are good.  I hope they can do something about the layout of  tables.  It looks so empty from outside which is bad for their business.  On the other hand, I do enjoy the fact there is no wait for their yummy food.
author: K L.

description: Stopped in after seeing they opened the restaurant. Nice on the inside with white tablecloths and a menu with some variety but I didn't find the traditional Pho but who knows.. I'm not Vietnamese.  Started off with the BBQ pork rolls which were tasty and fresh. Had two dishes, chicken with eggplant and 5 spice chicken.  It took awhile to get our order but overall the food was very good and flavorful.  I'll definitely be back.  Leave room for dessert.  The table next to us ordered deep fried ice cream and a flaming banana dish with coconut ice cream.
author: Ruben G.

description: i was going to write a nasty review just so everyone would stay away from this place so i can have it all to myself...which usually is the case. i don't get why it's never crazy busy there. the food is great. it's clean, unlike other vietnamese places who accentuate their authentic experience with ants, flies, roaches, evil fluorescent lighting and bad service. it's family run by genuinely nice people and they deliver!
author: dan T.

description: I come here constantly - they are like my second kitchen.  Much love for the chicken pho.  Very, very nice people working there.  Cheap, and almost a little too nice inside.  Can't go wrong with this place.
author: Matthew S.

description: This poor restaurant is situated in a location littered with the corpses of restaurants-past.  I think this may be the fourth incarnation in the last eight years.  So Jasmine Garden has this legacy going against it.  Other detracting factors: tacky mirrored walls, huge flat screen TV in the dining area, and a fairly unwelcoming location sandwiched between George's Liquors and a crappy Chinese buffet (god knows why that place has survived!)  What might save this joint from a similar fate to the other mediocre Asian fare that's come and gone are the exceptionally friendly service and the solid (though not stellar) food.  The spring rolls are pretty excellent; the lemon grass chicken, fresh and tasty; and the pho, served with rare beef, flank steak, and beef balls, had some of the most flavorful broth I've come across in a while.  On the other hand, the spicy lemongrass pho, served only with rare beef, was on the acrid and oily side.  I'd say this place, while still tacky and unglamorous, is well worth a try.
author: bree z.

description: I will never order from this place again out of sheer ANNOYANCE!  I took me 7 mins and 2 personel changes to convey my street address... which is a major one in the mission.   Eventually i just gave up when the didn't have what i wanted to order anyways.   I have  however eaten here in the past with out such problems.  Prior to this last experience I would rate the food 3 stars.  Its mediocre vietnamese food at its finest!
author: darren r.

description: It's always been delicious when I've eaten here, and they can adapt most of the menu as veggie. I like spicy, but some items are not marked hot on the menu, so be careful if it matters to you. We've had out-of-town guests who had never tried Vietnamese and really loved it here.
author: Marc C.

description: Food is a strong four stars.   All the dishes we had were great.  Owner was very pleasant and helpful with respect to dish selection. Her suggestions made the meal.  Highly recommend.
author: Robert K.

description: I give Jasmine Garden five stars because every time I've eaten there I leave feeling so so happy and satisfied.  The food is truly delicious, though I ought to admit that I am so hooked on the hot and sour seafood soup that I haven't tried much else.  But it is clear that the husband-wife duo who run this place (and I believe an uncle is the delivery guy), put real love and food-smarts into their dishes.  Everything tastes sparkly-fresh.  And while there are the usual Vietnamese hits on the menu, you'll also find some more unusual dishes.  When we've eaten at the restaurant, we are blessed with the friendly and gracious service of the wife part of the duo, and when we want to eat at home, our food has always arrived hot.
author: Dahlia U.

description: i'll preface with the fact that i LOVE pho. i have probably ordered from here about three times. jasmine garden is ok-- it does the trick when you have a craving and need it delivered. if i was going to get pho and sit somewhere, i'd be kind of disappointed, but their delivery time and customer service are always both very good and the food is pretty decent.
author: Eryn R.

description: i love this place, the food is fantastic and the staff is great!! i could eat here every day  of the week, love vietnamese food and they do it very well.
author: meme b.

description: For the price, you can't beat Jasmine Garden in terms of food and service.  The Garlic Noodle and Dancing Beef are highly recommended.  I haven't tried their famous crab yet but look forward to it the next time I go.  You can pay double or triple the price elsewhere but this is the place for me for my hard earned dollars.  And their service is top-notch!  You'll be hard pressed to find friendlier waiters.  He was even able to calm my rowdy 1 year old and make him laugh.  So definitely recommended for families with young children as well.  Do yourself a favor and go try this hidden gem before they realize their prices are too low!
author: psychov v.

description: i love jasmine garden and go nearly once a week. the interior is very pleasant, the service is great, the food is really reasonably priced, and they deliver. with that said, i always order the same thing- the vegetarian pho- so i can't speak for any of the other dishes. getting truly vegetarian pho in sf is harder than one would think (they have assured me that theirs is in fact vegetarian), and often when you do, its flavorless. here, it is always overflowing with vegetables and is seriously tasty. jasmine garden is my go-to place when i need a comforting bowl of noodle soup. highly recommend.
author: hannah c.
